title: Tuesday's ETF with Unusual Volume: IWL
summary: The iShares Russell Top 200 ETF (IWL) experienced unusually high trading volume on Tuesday, with shares down about 0.8%. Tesla and Apple, major components of the ETF, saw significant trading volume and share price drops, while PayPal Holdings performed best, rising 4.3%.

title: Android has a response to iPhone’s satellite connection, thanks to Qualcomm
summary: Qualcomm is introducing Snapdragon Satellite service, a new emergency satellite phone service for Android smartphones. This service aims to compete with Apple's existing satellite connectivity, with specific product announcements expected by mid-year. The service requires at least one ground gateway to connect smartphones to satellites.

title: Back Again At Comparing Skyworks Vs. Qorvo (NASDAQ:SWKS)
summary: This article compares Skyworks Solutions and Qorvo, both RF suppliers currently trading at low P/E ratios. It highlights Qorvo's transparency regarding market details and Skyworks' stable growth due to its strong ties with Apple. The author also suggests Qorvo has a significant opportunity with Apple's business, especially given Qualcomm's apparent withdrawal.

title: Starbucks tells corporate employees to return to office 3 days a week
summary: Starbucks is requiring corporate employees to return to the office three days a week by the end of January, a move announced by interim CEO Howard Schultz. This decision comes as other major companies like Disney, Apple, and Snapchat's parent company are also enforcing stricter return-to-office policies, with some citing low compliance with previous hybrid work arrangements. The shift reflects a broader trend of companies clamping down on remote work that became common during the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Apple Takes Major Steps Toward ‘Owning’ Its Key Technology
summary: Apple (AAPL) is reportedly taking significant steps to assert greater control over its proprietary technology. This initiative involves increasingly developing its own in-house chips and custom displays. Such moves signify a strategic shift towards self-reliance and vertical integration within the company's product development.

title: Apple’s Reliance On China Poses A Problem For The Company
summary: This article discusses Apple's significant reliance on its supply chain in China and the challenges this poses for the company amidst growing geopolitical tensions and trade barriers between the US and China. It highlights how Apple's deep integration with Chinese manufacturing, including specialized labor and R&D, makes disentanglement difficult, even as the US government increases pressure through tariffs, forced labor prevention acts, and technology export controls. The article suggests that while Apple is starting to move some operations, achieving true independence from China will be a slow and arduous process.

title: Big Tech to Congress: Listen to Taylor Swift and Go After Ticketmaster, Not Us
summary: Lobbyists for major technology companies capitalized on public outrage over Ticketmaster's handling of Taylor Swift concert tickets to deflect congressional antitrust scrutiny away from Big Tech. They argued that Congress should focus on clear monopolies like Ticketmaster, implying that existing antitrust laws are sufficient and that efforts to reform them to target tech giants are misguided. This strategy led to a Senate Judiciary Committee hearing focusing on Live Nation/Ticketmaster's monopolistic practices instead of Big Tech.

title: AST SpaceMobile raises $75 million, partners with TIM Brasil
summary: AST SpaceMobile has raised $75 million through an offering of Class A Common Stock and formed a partnership with Brazilian telco TIM Brasil. The funds will support the production and launch of the company's commercial satellites, while the partnership will enable TIM Brasil to test AST SpaceMobile's satellite-based 4G services in remote Brazilian locations. This move highlights AST SpaceMobile's mission to connect unserved areas and positions it alongside other companies in the growing satellite-to-phone connectivity market.

title: IBM Is Tech’s Most Beaten-Down Company
summary: This article argues that IBM has significantly fallen from its former prominence, ranking 49th on the Fortune 500 compared to 8th in 1980. Its recent financial results show flat revenue and modest net income, trailing far behind other tech giants like Apple, Amazon, and Microsoft. The author criticizes IBM for missing key technological advancements such as cloud computing, search, e-commerce, and operating systems despite its past R&D capabilities.

title: BioSig Appoints Steve Buhaly as CFO
summary: BioSig Technologies, Inc. has announced the retirement of its long-serving CFO, Steve Chaussy, after 12 years of service. Steve Buhaly, with 15 years of public company CFO experience, including a significant tenure at Qorvo, has been appointed as his successor. Buhaly's expertise in financial leadership, corporate expansion, and value creation is expected to support BioSig's commercial rollout of its PURE EP™ System and national scaling efforts.

title: Groupon Outsources Legal Executive Role to Winston & Strawn (1)
summary: Groupon's general counsel, Dane Drobny, is stepping down next week to rejoin Winston & Strawn as a partner. Drobny will continue to serve as Groupon's outside general counsel through the end of the year, as the company undergoes restructuring and workforce reductions. His departure follows two rounds of layoffs at the e-commerce marketplace.

title: Dexcom G6 Continuous Glucose Monitoring System Launches in Singapore
summary: Dexcom, Inc. has officially launched its G6 Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) System in Singapore for individuals aged two and older, including pregnant women. This system eliminates the need for routine fingersticks by continuously measuring and wirelessly sending glucose levels to a receiver or compatible smart device, offering real-time data and customizable alerts. The launch marks Dexcom's first CGM availability in Southeast Asia, with DKSH Singapore Pte Ltd appointed as the sales, marketing, and distribution service provider.

title: Apple shareholder moves to boot Al Gore from board of directors
summary: An activist shareholder, the National Legal and Policy Center (NLPC), is calling for the removal of Al Gore from Apple Inc.'s board of directors, citing his political activism and perceived lack of qualifications. The NLPC argues that Gore's two-decade tenure is unwarranted and that his climate change advocacy poses a reputational risk to Apple. They also filed a separate exempt solicitation to oppose CEO Tim Cook's re-upping to the board and are sponsoring a shareholder proposal regarding Apple's business risks in China.

title: How Reuters used AirTags to reveal Dow’s false recycling promises
summary: Reuters conducted an investigation into Dow Inc.'s recycling claims by embedding Apple AirTags into donated shoes. The investigation revealed that none of the shoes were recycled as promised by Dow, instead being tracked to an Indonesian flea market and other unexpected destinations. This highlights the clever use of AirTags to expose inconsistencies in corporate recycling initiatives.

title: Lightsource bp Places Multi-Year Order for 4GW of First Solar Modules
summary: Lightsource bp has placed a multi-year order for 4 gigawatts (GW) DC of advanced thin film solar modules from First Solar, to be delivered between 2026 and 2028 for projects in the US. This marks a significant commitment, building on a previous 4.3 GW order, and highlights the companies' collaboration in advancing US solar manufacturing and sustainability efforts. The deal includes First Solar’s Series 6 Plus and next-generation Series 7 modules, with Lightsource bp also committing to First Solar’s advanced high-value recycling program.

title: Why Target says 2022 was rougher than 2020
summary: Target Coo John Mulligan stated that 2022 was the most challenging operating environment of his career, even more so than 2020 during the height of the pandemic. Soaring inflation, supply chain issues, and changing consumer patterns led to significant drops in operating income and gross margins. In response, Target plans to cut $2 billion to $3 billion in costs, invest in customer-facing upgrades, expand owned brands and retail media, focus on price points and loyalty programs, and enhance convenience with expanded drive-up returns and store remodels.

title: VT vs ACWI ETF: Which is the Best World ETF?
summary: This article compares two popular World ETFs, Vanguard's Total World Stock Index Fund ETF (VT) and iShares' MSCI ACWI ETF (ACWI), to help investors decide which is best for their portfolio. It delves into their differences in expense ratios, underlying indices, geographical breakdown, number of constituents, dividend yields, and fund managers, as well as their similarities in strategy, purpose, returns, liquidity, and sector breakdown. The author concludes that VT offers a lower expense ratio and exposure to smaller-cap companies, which might appeal to investors seeking that longer-tail exposure.

title: Sonos CEO Patrick Spence on right to repair, spatial audio and those never-ending lawsuits
summary: Sonos CEO Patrick Spence discusses the company's new Era 100 and Era 300 speakers, focusing on the emergence of spatial audio and its mainstream adoption challenges. He also addresses Sonos' commitment to right-to-repair principles, its premium pricing strategy, the future of the smart home market, and ongoing lawsuits with Google.

title: Virtual try-on is being hit by class actions. Should brands worry?
summary: Fashion and beauty brands like Dior, Louis Vuitton, and Estée Lauder are facing class-action lawsuits over their use of biometric data collected through virtual try-on technology under the Illinois Biometric Information Privacy Act (BIPA). These lawsuits highlight the need for brands to prioritize clear disclosure and consent regarding customer data, particularly sensitive biometric information, even as virtual try-on continues to grow in popularity and benefits. While legal challenges may represent "teething problems" for the industry, experts emphasize the importance of robust security and transparency practices to navigate evolving privacy regulations.

title: Apple Inc. to Launch Apple Music Classical App
summary: Apple Inc. is launching a new standalone app called Apple Music Classical, specifically designed for classical music enthusiasts. This app will feature over 5 million tracks, immersive spatial audio, curated playlists, composer biographies, and complete metadata for accurate displays. It will be available for pre-order and officially launch on March 28, 2023, at no extra cost for existing Apple Music subscribers.

title: From Apple to Boeing, India is being put to the test as China manufacturing alternative
summary: India is emerging as a potential manufacturing alternative to China, attracting major companies like Boeing and Apple. While significant deals, such as Boeing's record-breaking aircraft order, signal growing ties, India faces substantial hurdles including bureaucracy, lagging infrastructure, and red tape in its ambition to become a global manufacturing hub. Despite these challenges, India's economic growth projections and strategic partnerships indicate a strong push towards self-reliance and increased integration into global supply chains.

title: Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway speeds up stock buybacks
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc. has significantly increased its stock buybacks, repurchasing over $1.8 billion worth of its shares this year. This move suggests that Buffett and Charlie Munger believe Berkshire's stock is undervalued, following nearly $60 billion in buybacks between 2020 and 2022. The company sees repurchases as a prudent use of its substantial cash reserves, despite a proposed quadrupling of the 1% excise tax on buybacks.

title: For Broad-Based Large-Cap ESG Exposure, See CVLC
summary: The article highlights the Calvert US Large-Cap Core Responsible Index ETF (CVLC) as a significant option for investors seeking broad-based large-cap ESG exposure, particularly focusing on climate change and net-zero goals. It emphasizes CVLC's ability to identify companies taking actual steps towards net-zero objectives, citing examples like Apple, Amazon, and Tesla. The ETF offers a tangible way for investors to align their portfolios with values related to environmental sustainability and responsible investing.

title: Apple introduces Apple Pay Later to allow consumers to pay for purchases over time
summary: Apple has introduced Apple Pay Later in the U.S., allowing users to split purchases between $50 and $1,000 into four payments over six weeks with no interest or fees. Designed with financial health in mind, the service integrates into Apple Wallet for easy tracking and management of loans, with repayment via linked debit cards. Apple Financing LLC, a subsidiary of Apple Inc., is responsible for credit assessment and lending, and will report loans to U.S. credit bureaus starting in the fall, while Mastercard and Goldman Sachs facilitate the program.

title: Live Nation head says ‘speculative ticketing’ to blame for difficulty with buying event tickets
summary: Live Nation Entertainment President and Chief Financial Officer Joe Berchtold attributes difficulties in buying event tickets to "speculative ticketing" by secondary sellers. He explained that these sellers list tickets they don't yet possess and use bots to acquire them when sales officially open. Berchtold also highlighted Live Nation's push for a "Fair Ticketing Act" to combat these practices, make speculative ticketing illegal, and ensure transparent "all-in pricing" for consumers.

title: Top and Flop ETFs of March
summary: The U.S. stock market experienced extreme volatility in March, characterized by bank failures and a tech-driven rally. This article highlights the top and flop ETFs of the month, with technology and gold-related funds performing well, while regional bank and natural gas ETFs saw declines.

title: iShares MSCI USA Quality Factor ETF (QUAL) Stock Price, Holdings, Dividend Yield
summary: This article provides a detailed overview of the iShares MSCI USA Quality Factor ETF (QUAL), including its stock price, key statistics, top holdings, dividend data, and historical performance. As of the latest N-PORT filing on 2025-07-31, QUAL holds 125 stocks with NVIDIA, Microsoft, and Apple as its top positions. The ETF has a current dividend yield of 0.94% and a P/E ratio of 26.81.

title: ProShares Ultra QQQ 2x Shares (QLD) Stock Price, Holdings, Dividend Yield
summary: This article provides a detailed overview of ProShares Ultra QQQ 2x Shares (QLD), including its stock price, key statistics, top holdings, and dividend information. It highlights QLD's current portfolio value of $6.70 billion with top holdings like NVIDIA, Microsoft, and Apple, and details its performance and historical data. The article also lists recent trades and key fundamental data.

title: Frontdoor App Changes the Game of Home Repair and Maintenance
summary: Frontdoor, Inc. has launched a new app that aims to revolutionize home repair and maintenance by connecting homeowners with pre-qualified experts via video chat. The app, available in mid-April, offers various features including DIY tips, maintenance reminders, and discounts. A new campaign from Fallon and Chemistry supports the launch, which also marks a reunion of brand and agency leaders.

title: iShares Global 100 ETF (IOO) Stock Price, Holdings, Dividend Yield
summary: This article provides a comprehensive overview of the iShares Global 100 ETF (IOO), detailing its stock price, current holdings, and dividend yield. As of its latest N-PORT filing on September 30, 2025, IOO primarily invests in major tech companies like NVIDIA, Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, and Broadcom. The ETF manages $7.30 billion in common equities with a 0% turnover rate, offering key statistics and historical performance data.

title: Introducing Domino's® on Apple CarPlay®: The Easiest Way to Order Pizza on the Go
summary: Domino's Pizza has launched a new ordering feature through its iOS app on Apple CarPlay, allowing customers to easily order pizza on the go through "Tap to Order" or "Call to Order" options. This integration highlights Domino's leadership in combining technology with pizza ordering convenience, aiming to enhance customer experience and offering an alternative to traditional drive-thru waiting. The company reported global retail sales exceeding $17.5 billion in 2022, with a substantial portion from digital channels, underscoring its strong market presence and reliance on tech-driven solutions for ordering.

title: Domino’s Introduces In-Car Ordering
summary: Domino's Pizza has launched a new in-car ordering system through its iOS app on Apple CarPlay, allowing customers to place orders without waiting in drive-thru lines. This new feature, part of Domino's AnyWare ordering platforms, offers "Tap to Order" for saved meals or "Call to Order" for hands-free placement. Domino's is among the first quick-service restaurants to offer this convenient on-the-go ordering method.

title: Apple will use 100 percent recycled cobalt in batteries by 2025
summary: Apple announced a significant acceleration of its efforts to use recycled materials in its products, setting a goal to use 100% recycled cobalt in all Apple-designed batteries by 2025. By the same year, magnets in Apple devices will use entirely recycled rare earth elements, and all Apple-designed printed circuit boards will incorporate 100% recycled tin soldering and gold plating. This initiative is part of Apple's broader commitment to eventually make all products with only recycled and renewable materials and achieve carbon neutrality by 2030.

title: Autodesk Technology Engagement Center breaks ground at CSUN
summary: California State University, Northridge has broken ground on the $50-million Autodesk Technology Engagement Center, which will house the Global Hispanic Serving Institution Equity Innovation Hub. This new facility aims to steer Latinos and other underserved communities into STEM careers through research labs, a maker space, and student showcase areas. Funded by Autodesk, the State of California, and Apple, the center will leverage XR technology and address the underrepresentation of the Latino community in the tech industry.

title: YieldMax APLY ETF Seeks Income Through Call Options on Apple Stock
summary: The YieldMax APLY Option Income Strategy ETF (APLY) has launched, aiming to generate monthly income by selling call options on Apple (AAPL) stock. APLY, managed by Toroso Investments and ZEGA Financial, uses a synthetic covered call strategy to provide exposure to AAPL’s returns and income from option premiums, without directly investing in the stock. It operates with an expense ratio of 0.99% and maintains its strategy regardless of market conditions.

title: Eye on Tap to Pay: MagicCube Teams Up With ACI; Fiserv Offers Tap to Pay on Clover
summary: MagicCube and Fiserv are expanding the adoption of tap-to-pay technology on smartphones for merchants. MagicCube partnered with ACI Worldwide to enable small and mid-sized merchants to accept contactless payments with or without a PIN, enhancing payment acceptance without additional POS terminals. Simultaneously, Fiserv introduced Tap to Pay on iPhone for its Clover merchants, allowing them to accept contactless payments via the Clover Go iOS app, increasing flexibility and customer engagement.

title: Webull expands to Japan
summary: Webull Corporation has launched a local version of its trading app in Japan through Webull Securities (Japan) Co. Ltd., offering Japanese investors access to thousands of U.S. listed stocks and ETFs, including fractional shares. This expansion follows successful launches in Singapore and Australia, with plans to introduce Japanese securities, U.S. options, and Chinese and Hong Kong S.A.R. securities later in the year. The platform aims to attract both experienced and new investors with its convenient mobile trading tools and low commissions.

title: If Expense Ratio Really Mattered, Most of These ETFs Would Dominate
summary: Despite investors consistently indicating that expense ratio is the most important factor in selecting an ETF, several low- or no-cost ETFs with significant assets remain under the radar. Examples include the BNY Mellon US Large Cap ETF (BKLC) with a 0.00% expense ratio, the JPMorgan BetaBuilders US Equity ETF (BBUS) at 0.02%, and the SoFi Select 500 ETF (SFY) also at 0.00%. The article suggests advisors should investigate these cost-effective options for client portfolios given their stated preference for low expense ratios.

title: Qualcomm outlook grim as smartphone sales stay weak
summary: Qualcomm Inc. forecast third-quarter revenue and profit below Wall Street estimates due to weak smartphone sales and excess chip inventory. The company's CEO noted a lack of meaningful recovery, particularly in China, and faces increased competition and a rise in used phone sales impacting premium device demand. Qualcomm's shares fell nearly 7% after the announcement.

title: Amkor Technology seeks to open Vietnam factory in fourth quarter
summary: U.S.-based Amkor Technology Inc. expects its mega facility in Bac Ninh, Vietnam, to begin first-phase manufacturing in the fourth quarter of this year. This factory, covering 1.9 million square feet, will be among Amkor's largest globally and represents a $1.6 billion investment until 2035. The move highlights Vietnam's growing importance as a manufacturing and R&D hub for major foreign electronics manufacturers.

title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has been a fortress stock during recessions and bear markets. Here's how
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has proven to be a resilient investment, consistently outperforming the S&P 500 during recessions and bear markets due to its long-term focus and conservative investment strategies. The conglomerate's significant stake in Apple, coupled with its substantial cash reserves and insurance ventures, underscores its "fortress stock" reputation. This approach has led to impressive compounded annual gains for Berkshire shareholders over decades.

title: Apple stakes future growth on emerging markets, starting with India
summary: Apple CEO Tim Cook is betting on emerging markets, particularly India, for future growth after iPhone sales surprisingly rose despite a global smartphone slump. The company sees significant opportunity in these markets due to their youthful populations and low iPhone penetration, with India showing strong double-digit growth and becoming a major focus for Apple. The booming used iPhone market also contributes to Apple's market share gains in these regions.

title: Buffett says Apple is Berkshire portfolio's best business
summary: Warren Buffett stated that Apple Inc. is a better business than any other in Berkshire Hathaway Inc.'s portfolio, citing its dominant consumer product, the iPhone. Berkshire Hathaway's stake in Apple grew from $1 billion in 2016 to $151 billion by March 2023, accounting for 46% of its equity portfolio, and Buffett indicated the company could buy more shares. He views Apple primarily as a consumer products company rather than a technology company.

title: Best Buy Announces New Membership Programs to Save You Money
summary: Best Buy is introducing three new membership tiers, "My Best Buy," "My Best Buy Plus," and "My Best Buy Total," replacing its previous Totaltech program. These options cater to different customer needs, ranging from a free basic membership to a premium plan offering comprehensive tech support and extended protection. The changes aim to provide more flexible benefits to consumers, with current Totaltech members transitioning to the new tiers upon renewal.

title: Apple previews Live Speech, Personal Voice, and more new accessibility features
summary: Apple announced new accessibility features including Assistive Access for cognitive disabilities, Live Speech and Personal Voice for speech accessibility, and Point and Speak in Magnifier for users who are blind or have low vision. These features leverage advances in hardware and software, including on-device machine learning for privacy, and are part of Apple's ongoing commitment to making technology inclusive for everyone. The company also detailed various initiatives and events celebrating Global Accessibility Awareness Day, showcasing applications of these features and broader accessibility efforts across its products and services.

title: Steve Jobs: Apple Cofounder and Tech Innovator
summary: Steve Jobs, co-founder of Apple Inc., was an American inventor, designer, and entrepreneur responsible for pioneering revolutionary technologies like the iPhone and iPad. The article details his life from adoption and early education to co-founding Apple, his departure and subsequent ventures with NeXT and Pixar, and his triumphant return to Apple, ultimately shaping modern technology. It also covers his personal life, battle with pancreatic cancer, and lasting legacy after his death in 2011.

title: Fidelity Metaverse ETF ETF Price, Holdings, & News (NASDAQ:FMET)
summary: This article provides an overview of the Fidelity Metaverse ETF (FMET), including its price, holdings, and recent news. FMET tracks a market cap-weighted index of equities related to the metaverse, launched on April 19, 2022, and is managed by Fidelity. The ETF has seen a significant increase in share price since the beginning of 2025 and lists its top institutional shareholders and key holdings.

title: Examining the Importance of Dividend Growth
summary: This article contrasts dividend growth investing with high-yield strategies, highlighting its benefits like reduced volatility and steadily rising payouts. It uses Warren Buffett's investments in companies like Coca-Cola and American Express to demonstrate the long-term efficacy of reinvesting growing dividends. The piece concludes by suggesting dividend growth ETFs, such as the T. Rowe Price Dividend Growth ETF (TDVG), as an accessible option for retail investors.

title: Everything you need to know about Salesforce’s Q1 2024 financial results
summary: Salesforce, Inc. reported increased first-quarter adjusted earnings in Q1 2024 ($1.69 per share) and revenue growth of 11% year-over-year to $8.25 billion. All key operating segments showed growth, driven by its generative AI ecosystem including Einstein GPT, Slack GPT, and Tableau GPT. CEO Marc Benioff highlighted the role of the Salesforce GPT Trust Layer in securing customer data and enhancing enterprise automation.

title: Apple Bets On The Emerging Markets Growth Story
summary: Apple is increasingly focusing on emerging markets, particularly India, to drive growth amidst a challenging global smartphone market. The company achieved marginal growth in iPhone sales despite overall industry decline, with India seeing significant retail and manufacturing expansion plans. While services and financial technology offer long-term opportunities, the emerging markets strategy is a key component of Apple's immediate growth narrative, alongside ongoing share repurchases and dividend increases.

title: Apple, Microsoft Boost the S&P 500 Amid Tech Comeback
summary: Apple and Microsoft have significantly contributed to the S&P 500's gains in 2023, accounting for nearly half of the index's rise and reaching an all-time high combined weight of 14%. This tech rally, driven by robust earnings, has left many mutual funds underweight in major tech stocks. The article suggests leveraged ETFs like AAPU, MSFU, and TECL for traders looking to capitalize on the continued bullish trend in the tech sector.

title: Vimeo is tuning out its streaming TV apps
summary: Vimeo is discontinuing its dedicated streaming TV apps for Apple TV, Android TV, Amazon Fire TV, and Roku starting June 27th. Users can still watch Vimeo content on their TVs by casting from the Vimeo mobile app via Apple AirPlay 2 or Google Chromecast. This move aligns with Vimeo's strategic shift in recent years from a consumer-facing streaming destination to focusing on video-streaming services for businesses.

title: Introducing Apple Vision Pro: Apple’s first spatial computer
summary: Apple has unveiled Apple Vision Pro, its first spatial computer, which blends digital content with the physical world using a three-dimensional user interface controlled by eyes, hands, and voice. Running on the new visionOS, Vision Pro features an ultra-high-resolution display system, custom Apple silicon, and offers new ways to interact with apps, enjoy entertainment, relive memories, and connect via FaceTime. The device is designed with advanced materials, focuses on privacy, and will be available early next year starting at $3,499 (U.S.).

title: Big Tech Is Outpacing Small-Caps Amid Market Rally
summary: Big Tech is significantly outperforming small-cap stocks in the current market rally, with the Direxion Daily Technology Bull 3X ETF (TECL) up nearly 120% compared to the Direxion Daily Small Cap Bull 3X Shares (TNA) 3.7% gain year-to-date. This outperformance, particularly by companies like Microsoft, Apple, and Nvidia, is despite lingering recession concerns. The article questions the sustainability of Big Tech's rally while suggesting that small-cap funds like TNA could offer future upside.

title: Apple, Amazon must face consumer lawsuit over iPhone, iPad prices, US judge rules
summary: A federal judge in Seattle has ruled that Apple and Amazon must face a consumer antitrust lawsuit accusing them of conspiring to artificially inflate the price of iPhones and iPads sold on Amazon's platform. The lawsuit alleges that a 2019 agreement between the two companies restricted the number of competitive resellers, a claim that will now proceed to evidence-gathering. Apple contends the agreement was to minimize counterfeit goods and is procompetitive.

title: Lenovo ‘overall winner’ of UK FRAND trial as InterDigital confirms appeal
summary: The UK High Court has declared Lenovo the 'overall winner' in its FRAND dispute with InterDigital, determining a FRAND rate of $138.7 million plus $46.2 million in interest, making the total $184.9 million. The court found Lenovo's proposed per-unit rate much closer to the final decision than InterDigital's, and the payable lump sum 'substantially lower' than InterDigital's offer. Both parties have been granted permission to appeal this decision, indicating the case is not yet concluded.

title: How Apple Became a $3 Trillion Company
summary: This article chronicles Apple's journey from its founding in 1976 to becoming a $3 trillion company. It highlights key product launches like the Apple I, Macintosh, iPod, and iPhone, emphasizing the iPhone's central role in its financial success. The article also touches on leadership changes, challenges like supply-chain disruptions, and future innovations such as the Apple Vision Pro.

title: Apple, world's most valuable public company, is first to hit $3 trillion in market value
summary: Apple has become the first publicly-traded company to achieve a market value of $3 trillion or more at the close of Wall Street's trading day, with its stock price rising 2.21% to $193.78 on Friday. This historic milestone was attributed to its popular products and strong profits, with an analyst from Wedbush Securities suggesting its fair valuation could reach $3.5 trillion, potentially even $4 trillion by FY25, especially with upcoming products like the Vision Pro VR headset. The article also lists the world's ten largest companies by market cap, with Apple leading the pack.

title: Apple’s market value ends above $3 trillion for the first time
summary: Apple Inc.'s market value surpassed $3 trillion for the first time at the close of a trading session, driven by positive inflation data and confidence in its market expansion strategies. This milestone reflects a 49 percent gain in Apple shares for 2023, amid a tech stock rebound fueled by expectations of slower interest rate hikes from the US Federal Reserve and buzz around artificial intelligence. The company's financial resilience, strong balance sheet, and a recent augmented-reality headset launch contribute to its success, making it one of only five US companies with a valuation exceeding $1 trillion.

title: Proposal for new Costco store in region takes a step forward
summary: A proposal to bring a new Costco Wholesale Corp. store to Indian Land, S.C., has moved closer to reality after a second reading of a rezoning request was approved. The Lancaster County Council approved the request for a 28-acre site adjacent to The Exchange at Indian Land, a mixed-use development by Crosland Southeast. Three readings are required for final approval of the rezoning request.

title: Oakmark Equity and Income Fund: Second Calendar Quarter 2023
summary: The Oakmark Equity and Income Fund gained 5.3% in Q2 2023, outperforming the Lipper Balanced Fund Index, despite market concentration in large-cap tech stocks. The fund adjusted its portfolio by reducing technology exposure and initiating new positions, primarily in the healthcare sector, based on a value-driven investment philosophy. The article also reflects on the foundational principles of diversification in portfolio construction, influenced by economist Harry Markowitz, and the fund's approach to asset allocation.

title: Apple loses London appeal in 4G patent dispute with Optis
summary: London's Court of Appeal dismissed Apple's appeal in a patent dispute with Optis Cellular Technology LLC, ruling that Apple infringed two 4G telecommunications patents. Texas-based Optis sued Apple in 2019, alleging that the patents are essential to certain technological standards used in devices like iPhones and iPads. This ruling is the latest decision in a legal battle that has involved multiple trials and appeals in Britain.

title: Kopin Corp is the Technology Seen Behind Smart AR Glasses
summary: Kopin Corp (NASDAQ: KOPN), a high-resolution microdisplay maker, is highlighted as a key technology provider for smart AR glasses, including supplying displays for Vuzix and Alphabet. Despite an 80% drop from 2021 highs, the company has made significant advancements, such as achieving 3 million nits brightness for its 2K x 2K MicroLED displays, essential for AR in bright conditions. Kopin's Q1 2023 results showed increased product revenues, especially in defense, and the new CEO emphasized renewed focus on quality and efficiency to improve margins and achieve cash flow breakdown by year-end.

title: If You Like JEPI, You’ll Love This ETF With an 11.9% Dividend Yield
summary: This article introduces the JPMorgan Nasdaq Equity Premium Income ETF (JEPQ) as an alternative to the JPMorgan Equity Premium Income ETF (JEPI), highlighting its 11.9% dividend yield. JEPQ invests in Nasdaq 100 stocks, focusing on tech giants, and uses a covered-call strategy similar to JEPI to generate income. While offering a high yield and potential downside protection, JEPQ has lagged behind a comparable Nasdaq ETF (QQQ) in total return during a bull market.

title: Apple executives fight subpoenas in shareholders' lawsuit against Qualcomm
summary: Apple Inc.'s chief operating officer and a top corporate lawyer are attempting to quash subpoenas in a private securities class action lawsuit against chipmaker Qualcomm. They argue that their previous testimony and documents provided in an FTC antitrust case against Qualcomm make further questioning irrelevant to the current shareholder litigation. Apple contends that Qualcomm is using the subpoenas to harass the company.

title: Apple opens store on China's WeChat platform
summary: Apple has opened an official store on Tencent's WeChat platform in China, expanding its retail presence in the country's second-largest economy. This move allows WeChat users to purchase Apple products directly through the dominant messaging app, following a trend of Chinese consumers increasingly using social media for shopping. The expansion comes as Apple recorded a significant market share in China's smartphone market despite an overall decline in sales.

title: SIT Investment Associates Inc Acquires Stake in Neuberger Berman High Yield Strategies Fund
summary: SIT Investment Associates Inc acquired 2,043,847 shares of Neuberger Berman High Yield Strategies Fund on July 12, 2023. The transaction, valued at $7.59 per share, had a 0.42% impact on SIT's portfolio. Despite the target company's stock being deemed significantly overvalued with poor financial health indicators by GuruFocus, SIT's investment may represent a long-term strategic move.

title: A breakdown of the changes to the Nasdaq-100 and what it means for mega-cap tech stocks
summary: Nasdaq announced a special rebalance of the Nasdaq-100 Index to dilute the weightings of mega-cap tech stocks that have outperformed in 2023. The seven largest stocks in the Nasdaq-100 will see their combined weighting reduced from 56% to 44%, with Nvidia and Microsoft being most affected. Historically, similar rebalances have not had a significant impact on stock prices.

title: Apple maintains its spot as the world’s most valuable brand, per Kantar BrandZ
summary: Apple has retained its position as the world's most valuable brand according to Kantar BrandZ, valued at $880,455M, despite a 7% decline from 2022. The company's resilience is attributed to its strong brand equity, diversification into services, and ability to justify premium pricing. Apple's differentiation, purpose-driven initiatives, distinctive products, and iconic advertising are highlighted as key factors in its sustained success amidst challenging market conditions.

title: Nasdaq Is Reducing the Influence of Giant Tech Firms in a Popular Stock Market Index
summary: Nasdaq is implementing a "special rebalance" of its Nasdaq 100 index to reduce the dominance of giant tech firms like Apple and Microsoft. This move addresses the historic rally of a few mega-cap tech stocks, which have caused overconcentration in the index and potentially increased diversification risk for investors. The rebalance, effective July 24, will prompt funds tracking the index to adjust their portfolios, potentially leading to trading costs and minor market volatility.

title: How will the metaverse change our lives?
summary: This article explores the concept of the metaverse, its origins, and its potential impact on our lives, particularly within financial services. It delves into how the metaverse, driven by emerging technologies like Augmented Reality and Blockchain, could revolutionize banking with new e-commerce experiences and personalized financial assistance. The author also discusses the challenges and considerations, such as identity and fraud prevention, that need to be addressed as the metaverse develops.

title: Introducing Norton Genie - Real-Time AI-powered Scam Detection at Your Fingertips
summary: Norton has launched Norton Genie, a real-time AI-powered scam detection tool designed to help users identify and avoid increasingly sophisticated scams in texts, emails, websites, and social media posts. Available now in early access in the US, Genie combines Norton's cybersecurity expertise with advanced AI trained on millions of scam messages. The tool offers fast, free, and easy scam analysis, evolving protection, and trusted advice on how to respond to potential threats.

title: Why is Netflix lagging FAANG stocks?
summary: While other FAANG stocks have seen significant rallies in 2023, Netflix has lagged, raising questions about its inclusion in the group. Despite a subscriber boost from a password crackdown, the company faces challenges from ongoing strikes and has not highlighted AI in its earnings, unlike its tech counterparts. The article discusses investment approaches for FAANG stocks through ETFs.

title: Is QYLD ETF’s 11.3% Dividend a High-Yield Trap?
summary: This article examines the Global X NASDAQ 100 Covered Call ETF (QYLD) which offers an impressive 11.3% monthly dividend yield. While appealing for income investors, the article suggests that QYLD's covered call strategy, despite holding top tech stocks, leads to significantly lower long-term total returns compared to a standard Nasdaq 100 ETF like QQQ, primarily due to capping upside potential and higher fees. It concludes that while QYLD provides consistent income, QQQ is a superior long-term wealth-building investment.

title: Pixar, Apple and Nvidia are teaming up to promote a 3D file format that could help boost Apple's upcoming Vision Pro
summary: Pixar, Apple, Nvidia, Adobe, and Autodesk are collaborating to promote OpenUSD, a 3D file format. This initiative aims to streamline the creation of 3D content, potentially benefiting game development based on Pixar movies and boosting Apple's upcoming Vision Pro mixed-reality headset by making 3D environments more accessible.

title: Best Augmented Reality & Virtual Reality Stocks In 2023: December List
summary: This article identifies top Augmented Reality (AR) and Virtual Reality (VR) stocks for 2023, acknowledging the market's slow but potential growth, similar to the early days of smartphones. It emphasizes investing in stable, well-capitalized companies that are involved in AR/VR but do not solely depend on it for revenue, such as Alphabet, Apple, Autodesk, Meta, and Microsoft. The article also highlights the importance of risk management, portfolio diversification, and continuous monitoring of emerging trends in this evolving technological landscape.

title: Apple sees sales slump continuing, shares drop 2% despite beating sales expectations
summary: Apple shares dropped 2% after the company forecast a continued sales slump for the current quarter, despite beating Wall Street's sales and profit targets in the fiscal third quarter. While services and China sales were strong, weaker-than-expected iPhone sales disappointed investors, raising concerns about future volume growth. Apple also revealed increased R&D spending, partly driven by generative AI development.

title: After Earnings, Is Berkshire Hathaway Stock a Buy, a Sell, or Fairly Valued?
summary: Morningstar analyzes Berkshire Hathaway's Q2 earnings, noting stronger insurance results offset by declines in BNSF and other segments. The article evaluates the stock's valuation, finding it fairly valued despite strong operating earnings and significant cash holdings, and discusses the economic moat, risks, and bull/bear cases for BRK.B.

title: Exploring two covered call strategies by Global X ETFs
summary: This article explores two covered call ETF strategies offered by Global X ETFs, designed to provide alternative income solutions in a potentially rising-rate environment. It details the Global X S&P 500 Covered Call UCITS ETF (XYLU LN) and the Global X Nasdaq 100 Covered Call UCITS ETF (QYLD LN), explaining how they generate income through option premiums and their potential benefits in volatile or sideways markets. The strategies aim to offer higher yields than traditional fixed income while potentially reducing volatility compared to underlying stocks.

title: BlackRock Inc. Boosts Stake in Moelis & Co
summary: BlackRock Inc. significantly increased its stake in independent investment bank Moelis & Co, acquiring over 1.5 million shares on July 31, 2023. This transaction now gives BlackRock a 10.40% stake in Moelis & Co. The article analyzes both firms and discusses potential implications for value investors, noting Moelis & Co's overvaluation but strong profitability and momentum.

title: Dropbox review: Still the best at syncing and sharing
summary: This PCWorld review reaffirms Dropbox's position as a top choice for fast, reliable file synchronization and sharing, despite its limited free storage and lack of intermediate subscription tiers. While it excels in its core functionality and offers business-oriented features, its pricing model lacks options between the free 2GB and the paid 2TB. The article highlights its strengths for collaborative file access and its backup capabilities.

title: Apple Card named Best Co-Branded Credit Card for Customer Satisfaction with No Annual Fee by J.D. Power
summary: Apple Card, issued by Goldman Sachs, has been recognized for the third consecutive year as the Best Co-Branded Credit Card for Customer Satisfaction with No Annual Fee by J.D. Power. This award highlights Apple Card's commitment to user financial health, including features like Daily Cash rewards and the recently launched Savings account, which has accumulated over $10 billion in deposits. Apple and Goldman Sachs continue to collaborate on expanding the value and benefits offered to Apple Card users.

title: The best ETFs for retirement income
summary: This article explores the best ETFs for retirement income, focusing on conservative asset allocation ETFs and tactical overlays for retirees. It discusses how these ETFs can help reduce volatility, hedge inflation, and generate income, with insights from financial experts on their suitability for different risk tolerances and financial situations. The author also delves into defensive sector ETFs and low-volatility ETFs as additional strategies for Canadian retirees.

title: 'Not just money and math': Young people are willing to sacrifice returns for ESG
summary: New data reveals that young investors are increasingly willing to sacrifice investment returns to align their portfolios with environmental, social, and governance (ESG) causes they care about. This trend is particularly strong among Gen Z and millennials, with many prepared to underperform market averages for values-aligned investments. Behavioral scientists suggest this reflects a need for young people to signal their values and identity through their investment choices.

title: Hedge fund exposure to 7 biggest tech stocks at record high, Goldman Sachs says
summary: Hedge funds have reached record exposure to the seven largest tech stocks by market capitalization, according to Goldman Sachs data, driven by strong performance and the artificial intelligence theme. These seven stocks, including Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft, now constitute about 20% of the total net market value held by hedge funds tracked by Goldman Sachs. Despite the concentration risk, investment managers rationalize these allocations due to the significant returns generated by these companies this year.

title: Apellis to lay off 25% of staff, trim research in major restructuring
summary: Apellis Pharmaceuticals announced a major restructuring, including a 25% workforce reduction (about 225 employees) and trimmed research spending, to focus resources on its newly approved vision loss drug, Syfovre. This move is expected to save up to $300 million through 2024, helping to extend its operational runway. The restructuring follows a sudden stock price decline spurred by reports of rare but potentially blinding side effects associated with Syfovre, though the company suggests these issues might be unrelated to the drug itself.

title: Apple announces next Impact Accelerator class for businesses advancing environmental innovation
summary: Apple has announced its third Impact Accelerator class, a cohort of 12 Black-, Hispanic/Latinx-, and Indigenous-owned businesses focused on environmental solutions and green technology. This program is part of Apple's Racial Equity and Justice Initiative, aiming to help diverse businesses scale their impact and contribute to a greener, more equitable future. The participating companies offer solutions addressing climate change, resource management, and smarter chemistry, and will receive extensive support and mentorship from Apple.

title: The Fishbowl: Lydia Parker, Samsung Ads Europe
summary: This article features an interview with Lydia Parker, Head of International Agencies at Samsung Ads Europe, as part of The Media Leader's "Fishbowl" series. She discusses her career progression, professional experiences, leadership strategies in a hybrid work environment, changes in client conversations due to the booming CTV market, and her favorite ad.

title: Claim Construction – We Agree . . . Or Do We? – One-E-Way, Inc. v. Apple Inc.
summary: This article discusses the Federal Circuit's decision in *One-E-Way v. Apple*, highlighting a dispute over a previously agreed-upon claim construction for "unique user code." The case illustrates that even agreed-upon claim constructions can lead to significant disagreements regarding their application to accused products, with Apple successfully arguing that the code must be associated with a user, not just a device. The ruling serves as a cautionary tale for litigants to ensure proposed claim constructions provide absolute clarity and are well-supported by intrinsic evidence.

title: India's policy contradictions are making it harder for investors to crack its market
summary: India's apparent policy contradictions, such as import restrictions on electronics despite efforts to attract foreign investment, are complicating the market for global investors. While Prime Minister Modi's "Make in India" initiative and production-linked incentives aim to boost domestic manufacturing and attract companies like Apple and Foxconn, protectionist measures and capital controls create uncertainty. These challenges exist even as India seeks to enhance its global reputation and capitalize on shifting geopolitical alliances and supply chain diversification away from China, potentially limiting its full economic growth and investment appeal.

title: Everything Apple Plans to Show on Sept. 12: iPhone 15, Watches, AirPods
summary: Apple Inc. is set to unveil its latest products on September 12, including the iPhone 15 line, new smartwatches, and the latest AirPods. The event is expected to highlight the titanium iPhone 15 Pro, camera improvements, a switch to USB-C chargers, and faster smartwatches. This launch represents Apple's most significant new product unveiling of the year.

title: History of Apple in Photos, From Steve Jobs Era to $3 Trillion
summary: This article chronicles the history of Apple, from its founding by Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak to its recent achievement of a $3 trillion market cap under Tim Cook. It details key product launches like the Apple II, Macintosh, iPod, and iPhone, as well as leadership changes and challenges such as the recent DOJ lawsuit and declining iPhone sales in China. The article also touches upon Apple's expansion into services and new product categories like the Apple Watch and Vision Pro, alongside its pivot towards generative AI.

title: The pros and cons of the Vanguard FTSE All-World ex-US ETF (VEU)
summary: The Vanguard FTSE All-World ex-US ETF (VEU) offers extensive geographic and business diversification with over 3,700 holdings and a low annual management fee of 0.08%. While it provides exposure to many strong global companies outside the US, its exclusion of US businesses means it misses out on some top performers like Apple and Microsoft, which have driven higher returns in US-inclusive international ETFs. Despite this, VEU remains a strong choice for investors seeking broad non-US market exposure.

title: Qualcomm will make Apple’s iPhone modems until 2026, and its stock surges
summary: Qualcomm Inc. will continue to supply modem chips for Apple Inc.’s iPhones until at least 2026. This extended partnership suggests Apple's efforts to develop its own 5G modem chips are progressing slower than anticipated. Following the announcement, Qualcomm's stock (QCOM) experienced a significant surge of approximately 4%.

title: Qualcomm, Meta Platforms rise; J.M. Smucker, RTX fall, Monday, 9/11/2023
summary: This article details the stock performance of several companies on Monday, September 11, 2023. Qualcomm and Meta Platforms saw their stock prices rise due to specific company news, while J.M. Smucker and RTX experienced declines following significant announcements. Other notable movers include Alibaba, FuelCell Energy, Carlisle Cos., and Freeport-McMoRan.

title: Qualcomm to supply Apple Inc with 5G chips until 2026 under new deal
summary: Qualcomm has signed a new deal with Apple to supply 5G chips for iPhones until at least 2026, extending their previous agreement which was set to expire this year. While the financial terms are similar to the prior deal, Qualcomm's financial projections assume that only 20% of iPhones will use its chips by 2026, as Apple continues to develop its own modem technology. A patent licensing deal between the companies, signed in 2019, remains in place and could be extended beyond its 2025 expiration.

title: Apple unveils iPhone 15 Pro and iPhone 15 Pro Max
summary: Apple has unveiled the iPhone 15 Pro and iPhone 15 Pro Max, featuring a strong and lightweight titanium design, a new customizable Action button, significant camera upgrades, and the A17 Pro chip for enhanced performance and gaming. The new models also support USB-C with faster speeds and introduce new safety features like Roadside Assistance via satellite. Pre-orders begin September 15, with availability starting September 22.

title: Apple introduces the advanced new Apple Watch Series 9
summary: Apple introduced the Apple Watch Series 9, featuring the new S9 SiP chip, a brighter display, faster on-device Siri, and a magical new double tap gesture. This release marks Apple's first carbon-neutral products, aligning with its Apple 2030 goal to be carbon neutral across its entire business, manufacturing, and product life cycle by 2030. The new watch also runs watchOS 10 and introduces FineWoven bands as a leather alternative, along with new Nike and Hermès band collections.

title: Apple unveils its first carbon neutral products
summary: Apple announced its first carbon neutral products, primarily the new Apple Watch lineup, marking significant progress towards its Apple 2030 goal of making every product carbon neutral. The company detailed innovations in design, clean energy use in manufacturing and product use, reduced transportation emissions, and the development of new materials like FineWoven which replaces leather. Apple also introduced a new tool called Grid Forecast to help users choose cleaner energy times for electricity consumption.

title: All else being equal: Making the case for equal-weight ETFs
summary: This article discusses the advantages and disadvantages of equal-weight ETFs compared to market-cap-weighted ETFs, particularly in the context of the S&P 500's concentration in a few large tech companies. It highlights how equal weighting can manage concentration and valuation risk, offer a value investment style tilt, and increase exposure to smaller, well-established companies. While equal-weight strategies may underperform when market gains are driven by a select few, they can offer diversification benefits and a "buy-low, sell-high" approach through rebalancing.

title: Apple unveils iPhone 15 Pro with titanium case, holds line on prices
summary: Apple announced a new series of iPhones, including the iPhone 15 Pro with a titanium shell and improved features, while maintaining prices despite a global smartphone slump. The launch comes amidst economic uncertainty and increased competition in crucial markets like China. Apple also highlighted new watches and its commitment to becoming carbon neutral.

title: Arm, the Chip Designer, Raises $4.87 Billion in the Year’s Largest I.P.O. (Published 2023)
summary: Arm, the British chip design company, successfully raised $4.87 billion in the largest initial public offering of the year, valuing the company at $54.5 billion. This I.P.O. is a significant event for SoftBank, which acquired Arm in 2016 and aims to capitalize on the tech industry's focus on artificial intelligence, following a failed acquisition bid by Nvidia. Arm's return to public markets under the ticker symbol ARM is being closely watched as a gauge of investor interest in new tech offerings.

title: Arm climbs 25% in Nasdaq debut after pricing IPO at $51 a share
summary: Arm Holdings saw its stock jump nearly 25% on its first day of trading on the Nasdaq after pricing its IPO at $51 per share, valuing the company at almost $60 billion. SoftBank, which took Arm private in 2016, retains about 90% of the company's outstanding shares. Despite its high valuation relative to its current growth, Arm's unique royalty-based business model, including revenue from decades-old designs, and its strategic importance in AI and chip design, are key factors in investor interest.

title: Apple: Streamlining Sustainability For Every Buyer's Perfect Product
summary: Apple is prioritizing sustainability, aiming for all products to be carbon-neutral by 2030, a goal already achieved by the Apple Watch. The company's strategy involves significant emission reductions, increased use of renewable energy, and incorporating recycled materials, ensuring sustainability without compromising product features for consumers. Apple seeks to lead the tech industry towards a more responsible and environmentally conscious future.

title: Equal Weight ETF EQL Hits Key Buy Signal
summary: The article highlights the Alps Equal Sector Weight ETF (EQL) as an intriguing tool to mitigate concentration risk in the S&P 500, particularly due to the dominance of a few tech firms. EQL, an equal-weight ETF, assigns equal weight to each sector and then to stocks within those sectors, offering diversification and strong performance. The fund hit a key buy signal as its price rose above its 50-day simple moving average.

title: I Can't Stop Thinking About How Awkward Apple's 'Mother Nature' Ad Was, and I Finally Figured Out Why
summary: The author discusses Apple's "Mother Nature" ad featuring Octavia Spencer and Tim Cook, which aired during the iPhone keynote. While initially perceived as cringe-worthy and unfunny, the author concludes that the ad was effective in highlighting Apple's environmental efforts and contrasting them with competitors, even if it wasn't a comedic success. The ad addressed skepticism about Apple's carbon-neutral goals, particularly regarding the use of carbon credits, by having the "Mother Nature" character voice those criticisms.

title: Expedia Group builds generative AI into multiple products in its “Fall Release”
summary: Expedia Group is unveiling its "Fall Release 2023," introducing numerous features and products for travelers and supplier partners, heavily integrating generative AI. Key updates include AI-powered conversational capabilities within its apps, dynamic travel guides, and "EG Labs" for consumer feedback on new tech. The release also brings influencer content, group trip planning tools, and AI-driven recommendations for hotel partners to enhance performance and guest insights.

title: Calix taps Jabil as part of $42B+ broadband manufacturing plan
summary: Jabil, a St. Petersburg-based tech company, is partnering with California-based Calix Inc. to manufacture parts for expanding broadband internet service in rural America. This collaboration is part of the Biden Administration's $42.45 billion Build America, Buy America (BABA) effort for the Broadband Equity, Access, and Deployment (BEAD) program. Jabil will produce Calix’s optical network terminals (ONTs) and optical line terminals (OLTs) in Michigan, creating over 100 new jobs.

title: Buy the Dip in Apple, or Has the Trend Turned Rotten?
summary: This article discusses whether investors should "buy the dip" in Apple (AAPL) given its recent revenue decline for three consecutive quarters and concerns about its position in the AI race. It highlights Direxion's leveraged and inverse single-stock ETFs for AAPL (AAPD and AAPU) and broader technology ETFs (TECL and TECS) for traders with varying risk appetites and market outlooks. The article also provides important disclaimers regarding the risks associated with leveraged and inverse ETFs.

title: Should Vanguard Russell 1000 Growth ETF (VONG) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: This article evaluates the Vanguard Russell 1000 Growth ETF (VONG) as a potential investment, highlighting its focus on large-cap growth stocks, low expense ratio, and strong performance. It details VONG's sector exposure, top holdings, and risk profile, while also suggesting alternative ETFs for consideration.

title: Qualcomm defeats consumers' antitrust claims over chip supply contracts
summary: Qualcomm has successfully defeated a consumer antitrust lawsuit in California federal court, which alleged that the chipmaker's contracts with device manufacturers artificially inflated mobile phone costs. U.S. District Judge Jacqueline Scott Corley ruled in favor of Qualcomm, stating that allowing the plaintiffs to revive past evidence would lead to prolonged and expensive "do-over litigation." This ruling follows Qualcomm's 2020 victory against a similar lawsuit brought by the U.S. Federal Trade Commission.

title: Apple is ordered to face Apple Pay antitrust lawsuit
summary: Apple has been ordered to face a private antitrust lawsuit brought by payment card issuers. The lawsuit alleges that Apple exerts a 100% monopoly over the domestic market for tap-and-pay wallets on its devices, forcing banks to pay excessive fees and hindering competition and innovation. A U.S. District Judge dismissed a "tying" claim but ruled that plaintiffs could proceed with their claim that Apple violated federal antitrust law.

title: Dutch regulator rejects Apple’s objections to fines
summary: The Dutch competition watchdog ACM has rejected Apple's objections to 50 million euros ($53 million) in fines. The fines were imposed because Apple failed to fully comply with orders to allow alternative payment methods for dating apps in the Netherlands. Apple plans to appeal the decision to the Netherlands courts, maintaining that the original order degrades investment incentives and compromises user privacy and data security.

title: Qualcomm layoffs in 2023: Why 1,258 jobs are being slashed
summary: Qualcomm is laying off 1,258 employees in California due to a slump in smartphone sales and a prior commitment to cost-cutting. The layoffs, primarily impacting engineering teams in San Diego and Santa Clara, represent 2.5% of its global workforce. The company is trying to diversify into new markets like IoT, VR, and automotive chips, but its revenue continues to be heavily reliant on the struggling smartphone market.

title: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) is largely controlled by institutional shareholders who own 55% of the company
summary: Institutional shareholders control 55% of Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL), giving them significant influence over the company's share price. The top 25 shareholders own 40% of the company, with The Vanguard Group, Inc. being the largest at 8.3%. Individual investors and public companies hold 39% and 5.9% respectively, while insiders own less than 1%.

title: It's Not Just Lithium: Tesla, Rivian, And The Green Revolution Rely On These Precious Metals
summary: This article highlights the critical role of precious metals beyond lithium in powering the green revolution, particularly in electric vehicle batteries. It details how cobalt, nickel, silver, and graphite are essential components for companies like Tesla and Rivian, impacting battery performance, energy density, and efficiency. The piece also touches on future trends, such as solid-state batteries, and discusses investment opportunities in the materials driving the EV industry.

title: Nvidia to take on Intel, Qualcomm with Arm-based processors for PC; availability pegged for 2025
summary: Nvidia is developing Arm-based processors for personal computers, aiming to compete with Intel and Qualcomm, with availability expected as soon as 2025. This move intensifies competition in the PC chip market, especially as AMD is also reportedly working on Arm-based processors for PCs. The initiative follows Apple's successful transition to in-house Arm-based chips, boosting Mac sales, and poses a significant challenge to Intel's dominant position.

title: FDA Clears Omnipod 5 App for iPhones
summary: The FDA has granted 510(k) Clearance to the Omnipod 5 app for iPhone, making Insulet Corporation the first to offer a tubeless AID system with full control from compatible Android and iOS smartphones. This clearance follows the Omnipod 5 Automated Insulin Delivery system's initial FDA clearance for patients aged 6 years and older with type 1 diabetes in January 2022, and subsequent approval for children aged 2 years and older. The iOS app will offer the same functionality as the Android version, plus a new custom food feature, with a full market release expected in 2024.

title: ‘Fundamental rethink:’ Investors dump China shares despite new efforts to shore up the economy
summary: Global investors are offloading Chinese shares at an "unprecedented" rate due to concerns over China's economic slowdown, a lack of convincing policy responses, and an opaque business environment. Despite Beijing's efforts to stimulate growth through bond issuance and sovereign wealth fund purchases, these measures have failed to restore investor confidence. Experts suggest that a fundamental rethinking of China investment is underway, driven by a collapse of trust in the Chinese Communist Party and rising US-China tensions.

title: Apple unveils M3, M3 Pro, and M3 Max, the most advanced chips for a personal computer
summary: Apple announced its new M3, M3 Pro, and M3 Max chips, touting them as the most advanced chips for a personal computer. Built on 3-nanometer process technology, these chips introduce a next-generation GPU architecture with features like Dynamic Caching, hardware-accelerated ray tracing, and mesh shading, delivering significant performance improvements over the M1 family of chips. The M3 family also boasts faster CPU performance, an enhanced Neural Engine for AI/ML tasks, and an unrivaled unified memory architecture supporting up to 128GB, along with improved power efficiency for longer battery life and a reduced environmental impact.

title: MOAT: History May Not Repeat Itself (BATS:MOAT)
summary: The VanEck Morningstar Wide Moat ETF (MOAT) has a strong historical track record and reasonable fees but is significantly underweight in big tech. Given a bullish view on big tech, the author suggests MOAT may underperform the S&P 500 going forward. The article provides an overview of the ETF's strategy and the author's financial disclosures.

title: DarioHealth launches smart blood sugar meter for iPhone 15
summary: DarioHealth has launched a new smart blood sugar meter specifically designed for Apple iPhone 15 users. This new device leverages the iPhone 15's USB-C charging port for real-time data capture and instant connectivity, enhancing the personalized DarioHealth management experience. The company aims to innovate and continuously engage members in managing chronic conditions like diabetes.

title: Apple now has $162 billion in cash on hand, slightly less than last quarter
summary: Apple's cash reserves decreased slightly to $162.1 billion in its fiscal fourth quarter, down from $166.5 billion in the previous quarter. This comes as the company maintained one of the largest cash piles in the U.S. and posted revenue of $89.50 billion, exceeding Wall Street expectations despite analysts predicting a fourth consecutive quarter of revenue decline.

title: 'We're Changing the Structure:' GM's Software Boss Steps Down Amid Major Overhaul
summary: General Motors is reorganizing its software and services engineering team, leading to the departure of former Apple executive Dave Richardson, who was VP of software and services engineering. Sterling Anderson, GM's chief product officer, will now oversee vehicle software engineering and Global Product. This change aims to accelerate the development and delivery of technology experiences as GM prepares to launch a new centralized computer system in 2028 and moves away from phone mirroring in future vehicles.

title: On-device AI chips: New battleground for chipmakers
summary: Global chipmakers like Samsung Electronics, Qualcomm, Intel, and AMD are intensifying their focus on on-device AI chips for smartphones, laptops, and PCs, recognizing its potential for customized services, lower costs, and enhanced privacy compared to generative AI. This shift is expected to drive significant growth in AI-enabled consumer electronics and contribute to rising memory chip prices. Both on-device AI and generative AI are seen as complementary, with companies like Samsung planning to integrate both into future smart devices.

title: Why Warren Buffett has done more to educate investors than any other corporate executive
summary: Warren Buffett is recognized not only for his success as CEO of Berkshire Hathaway and his strategic investments in companies like Apple and Occidental Petroleum, but also for his exceptional candor with investors. The article highlights his significant role in educating investors about the intricacies of businesses and his willingness to discuss both successes and mistakes. This transparency sets him apart, making his biggest legacy potentially his contribution to investor education.

title: Why Warren Buffett has done more to educate investors than any other corporate executive
summary: Warren Buffett, CEO of Berkshire Hathaway and a prominent figure on the MarketWatch 50 list, is recognized for his significant influence on investors. He is known for his candid communication, explaining complex business operations, and openly discussing his successes and failures, which has made him an exceptional educator in the investment world.

title: Apple agrees to $25 million settlement with US over hiring of immigrants
summary: Apple Inc. has agreed to pay $25 million to settle claims by the U.S. Department of Justice that it illegally favored immigrant workers over U.S. citizens and green card holders for certain jobs. The Justice Department stated that Apple did not recruit U.S. citizens or permanent residents for jobs eligible for a federal program allowing employers to sponsor immigrant workers for green cards. This settlement marks the largest ever for the Justice Department concerning discrimination based on citizenship.

title: Booking.com settles Italian tax dispute with 94-million euro payment
summary: Travel website Booking.com has agreed to pay approximately 94 million euros ($100.25 million) to settle a tax dispute in Italy covering the period from 2013 to 2021. The settlement follows an investigation by Genoa prosecutors into the company's handling of VAT on properties rented through its platform. As part of the agreement, Booking.com also filed its VAT return in Italy for 2022 and committed to acting as a tax substitute for transactions with private individuals not registered for VAT.

title: FAANG Gives Way to the ‘Magnificent Seven’
summary: The "FAANG" stock group has evolved into the "Magnificent Seven," with Netflix replaced by Nvidia, and Microsoft and Tesla added to the mix of top U.S. market names. ETF issuers are beginning to launch products specifically targeting these seven stocks, while existing ETFs like the Vanguard Mega Cap Growth ETF (MGK) already hold significant concentrations of them. Investors have various options, from highly concentrated ETFs to diversified funds, to gain exposure to these influential companies.

title: Spotlight on illegal hiring practices: Apple pays $25M for recruiting, job ad mistakes
summary: Apple Inc. has agreed to pay $25 million to settle allegations of illegal hiring practices related to its PERM program. A DOJ investigation found Apple failed to recruit U.S. citizens or green card holders, did not advertise these positions on its external website, and required paper applications for PERM jobs while allowing electronic applications for others. The settlement includes $18.25 million for discrimination victims and $6.75 million for civil penalties, with Apple also agreeing to revise its recruitment practices and provide employee training.

title: FMR LLC Bolsters Portfolio with Fidelity International Value Fac
summary: FMR LLC, also known as Fidelity, has significantly expanded its investment portfolio by acquiring 350,126 shares of the Fidelity International Value Factor ETF (FIVA) at $21.95 per share. This transaction, executed on October 31, 2023, increases FMR LLC's holdings in FIVA to 1,099,261 shares, representing a 32.33% position in its portfolio. The move reflects Fidelity's strategic investment in an ETF that has shown a 9.1% year-to-date performance.

title: FMR LLC Acquires New Stake in Magenta Therapeutics Inc
summary: FMR LLC, through its flagship company Fidelity Investments, has acquired a new stake in Magenta Therapeutics Inc (MGTA) by purchasing 2,218,212 shares at $0.6996 per share. This transaction gives FMR LLC a 14.97% ownership stake in the clinical-stage biotechnology company, indicating a strategic investment aligning with the firm's focus on technology and healthcare sectors. Despite Magenta Therapeutics currently operating at a loss, FMR LLC's move suggests a belief in the company's long-term value and transformative potential in stem cell and gene therapy.

title: Warren Buffet's latest buys and sells
summary: This article details Berkshire Hathaway's latest stock buys and sells from its third-quarter 2023 13F filing, highlighting that the company was a net seller despite a tough market quarter, leading to a record cash stake. It identifies three undervalued Warren Buffett stocks within Berkshire Hathaway’s portfolio—Bank of America, American Express, and Kraft Heinz—providing Morningstar's analysis and key metrics for each. The piece also lists the stocks Berkshire Hathaway sold entirely, including Activision Blizzard, Celanese, General Motors, Johnson & Johnson, Mondelez International, Procter & Gamble, and United Parcel Service, while noting a significant reduction in its Chevron holdings.

title: Apple’s In-House Technologies Team Still Has Plenty of Work to Do
summary: This article discusses Apple's intensive efforts to design and manufacture its own core hardware components, such as cameras, screens, modems, and batteries, for its products. It also touches on Apple's adoption of the RCS texting standard, the revelation of its revenue share from the Google search deal, and a key health executive's move to Oura. The piece highlights that Apple's in-house technologies team has extensive work ahead in its strategic initiative to control major parts of its devices.

title: Venmo, Cash App users sue Apple over peer-to-peer payment fees
summary: Venmo and Cash App customers have filed a proposed class-action lawsuit against Apple Inc. alleging the company abused its market power in mobile peer-to-peer payments, leading to "rapidly inflating prices." The lawsuit claims Apple's agreements with PayPal's Venmo and Block's Cash App violate U.S. antitrust law by limiting "feature competition," including prohibiting decentralized cryptocurrency technology. This case adds to Apple's ongoing antitrust legal challenges, seeking an injunction that could force Apple to divest or segregate its Apple Cash business.

title: Should You Buy the Invesco QQQ ETF With the Nasdaq At An All-Time High? History Offers a Clear Answer.
summary: This article discusses the Invesco QQQ ETF and whether it's a good investment despite the Nasdaq Composite being at an all-time high. It analyzes historical data of the Nasdaq's performance after reaching new highs, suggesting that further gains are common. The article concludes that dollar-cost averaging into QQQ is a sensible strategy regardless of market highs, as it tracks the Nasdaq 100 which tends to rise over time.

title: Gaming Industry Charts a Rebound in 2023
summary: The gaming industry is experiencing a significant rebound in 2023 driven by strong console sales, new game releases, and innovations in mobile and cloud gaming. This recovery, following a dip in 2022, is further supported by anticipation of increased M&A activity and strategic moves by major players like Microsoft, Apple, and Netflix, positioning the sector for continued growth into 2024. The article highlights strong U.S. sales, hardware as a primary catalyst, and key factors like M&A and technological advancements shaping the industry's future trajectory.

title: Sonos Readies $400-Plus Headphones to Rival Apple and Bose, TV Set-Top Box
summary: Sonos Inc. is planning a significant expansion into new product categories, including headphones priced over $400 and a TV set-top box. These new offerings are expected to compete with products from Apple, Bose, and Roku, marking a strategic move beyond its traditional smart speakers and sound bars. The headphones could launch as early as April, with the set-top box following by the end of 2024.

title: Department of Justice and Apple Reach $25 Million Landmark Agreement
summary: The U.S. Department of Justice announced a $25 million agreement with Apple Inc. to resolve allegations of discriminatory hiring practices related to the permanent labor certification (PERM) program. Apple's recruitment practices for PERM positions, which included not advertising on its public-facing career website and requiring mailed paper applications, deterred U.S. workers. The settlement includes $6.75 million in civil penalties and $18.25 million for a backpay fund for victims, and mandates Apple to align PERM recruitment with its standard practices.

title: Warren Buffett-Led Berkshire Hathaway Sells Its Entire Procter & Gamble Stake. Should You?
summary: Berkshire Hathaway fully exited its small position in Procter & Gamble, likely due to consolidating its portfolio and P&G's premium valuation compared to other opportunities like Apple. Despite Berkshire's sale, P&G is still considered a worthwhile investment for risk-averse individuals due to its strong brand development, pricing power, and commitment to shareholder returns through dividends and buybacks. The article suggests that while P&G's valuation is high, its other characteristics make it a solid choice for passive income and portfolio stability.

title: Deere must face US farmers' 'right-to-repair' lawsuits, judge rules
summary: A U.S. judge has ruled that Deere & Co must face consolidated lawsuits from farmers accusing the agricultural machinery maker of unlawfully conspiring to restrict maintenance and repair services. The judge rejected Deere's arguments for dismissal, stating that the plaintiffs met the legal thresholds to pursue their antitrust claims. This case is part of a broader "right-to-repair" movement challenging restrictive repair practices across various industries.

title: $2 billion semiconductor testing and packaging facility planned for Peoria
summary: Amkor Technology Inc. plans to build a $2 billion semiconductor testing and advanced packaging facility in Peoria, Arizona, near the TSMC plant. This facility, expected to create 2,000 jobs, will test and package chips for Apple and aims to strengthen the domestic semiconductor supply chain. The project is seen as a crucial step for Arizona's semiconductor ecosystem and national security.

title: AI ETFs see huge performance dispersion in 2023
summary: Artificial Intelligence ETFs have shown significant performance dispersion in 2023, with top strategies more than doubling the returns of the lowest performers.
