The company is experiencing high demand for its indices, which benchmark over $2.2 trillion in assets, and is enhancing precision, coverage, and timeliness through automation and comprehensive data analysis for fixed income and equity markets. Furthermore, ICE is integrating sophisticated geospatial data and climate risk scores into its offerings to help investors identify and manage physical and transition risks from extreme weather events and climate change across diverse portfolios.

title: Ford CEO Jim Farley All-New Talent Was Needed For Universal EV Platform - Ford Authority
summary: Ford CEO Jim Farley emphasized the need for new talent to develop a universal EV platform, aiming to radically reduce costs and complexity. This led to the creation of a "skunkworks" team, separate from traditional Ford operations, to accelerate EV development and compete with Chinese manufacturers. The team, led by Doug Field, is focused on creating a low-cost EV platform.

title: 2 Vanguard ETFs to Buy With $100 and Hold Forever - Mitrade
summary: This article recommends two Vanguard ETFs, Vanguard Total Market Index (VTI) and Vanguard Total Bond Market ETF (BND), for long-term investors. It suggests a 60/40 portfolio allocation between stocks and bonds using these ETFs, highlighting their low fees and broad market exposure for growth and risk reduction. The piece details the historical performance and holdings of each ETF, emphasizing their suitability for a simple, set-and-forget investment strategy.

title: One Donald Trump post wipes out 2 trillion dollars
summary: A single social media post by Donald Trump, threatening massive tariffs on Chinese products, wiped out an estimated $2 trillion in U.S. market value, causing the S&P 500 to fall 2.7%. The market reaction was driven by fears over Trump's "lone-wolf policies" affecting the global economy, particularly regarding China's control of rare earth metals. Technology companies and chipmakers like Nvidia and AMD were among the hardest hit, though some investors view it as a potential buying opportunity.

title: APPLE INC : Jefferies reiterates its Sell rating - MarketScreener
summary: Jefferies has reiterated its Sell rating for Apple Inc. stock, adjusting the target price slightly from $205.16 to $203.07. This analyst action was based on research by Edison Lee.

title: Universal exchange: how South Africans can access Crypto, tokenized US stocks and ETFs in one place - IOL
summary: Bitget's Universal Exchange (UEX) now allows South African traders to access crypto, tokenized US stock futures, and ETFs from a single platform, eliminating the need for multiple services and foreign accounts. This platform offers local funding options in Rand (ZAR) through major South African banks and fintechs, enabling users to start with small investments and providing optional leverage tools. The UEX is presented as a unified gateway bridging on-chain and off-chain utility, signifying a shift from fragmented trading tools to integrated financial access.

title: Apple's Leadership Reshuffle: A Strategic Leap Towards Subscription-based Health Services - Retail News Asia
summary: Apple Inc. is undergoing a significant internal reshuffling triggered by the upcoming retirement of COO Jeff Williams, which is realigning leadership in key divisions like Health, Fitness+, and watchOS. This strategic move indicates Apple's future focus on subscription-based health services and greater integration across its software ecosystem. The reorganization sees Health and Fitness+ teams moving under Eddy Cue, watchOS under Craig Federighi, and Apple Watch hardware decisions shifting to John Ternus.

title: iPhone Foldable Version Just Got Cheaper? Ming-Chi Kuo Says It All Hinges On This For Apple In 2026
summary: Analyst Ming-Chi Kuo suggests that Apple's upcoming foldable iPhone in 2026 will feature a significantly cheaper hinge, dropping the average selling price to $70-$80, which could lower the final product's cost or improve Apple's profit margins. Foxconn, in a joint venture with Shin Zu Shing, is leading the production of this new hinge, streamlining the supply chain and potentially intensifying supplier competition if Luxshare-ICT joins later. JPMorgan analysts project the device could generate up to $65 billion in new revenue by 2029, with Apple aiming for 95 million unit production for its 2026 lineup.

title: Apple, predictably, thinks Windows 10 users should move to macOS – here’s why
summary: With the end of Windows 10 support approaching, Apple is advocating for users to switch to macOS, highlighting benefits such as software compatibility (including Microsoft 365), the affordability of devices like the Mac Mini, and superior long-term value retention. Apple also emphasizes the seamless ecosystem integration with iPhones, robust security features, and its distinct approach to AI as compelling reasons for Windows users to consider making the switch. The company believes its built-in security is particularly beneficial for small businesses without dedicated IT support.

title: Apple may unveil three M5-powered devices this week: Everything we know - Mathrubhumi English
summary: Apple is reportedly set to unveil a new lineup of M5-powered devices this week, including updated models of the iPad Pro, Vision Pro headset, and 14-inch MacBook Pro. These announcements are expected through press releases rather than a full launch event. The M5 chip promises significant performance improvements, with leaks suggesting a 12% boost in multicore CPU and 36% in GPU compared to the M4 chip.

title: MP Materials Stock Soars on Pentagon and Apple Breakthroughs – 400% YTD Rally Explained
summary: MP Materials (NYSE: MP) shares have surged 360–400% year-to-date in 2025, driven by significant deals with the U.S. Defense Dept and Apple. These partnerships, alongside strong Q2'25 results and geopolitical factors surrounding rare earths, have bolstered the company's strategic position and led to bullish analyst views. MP Materials is positioned as the sole large-scale U.S. rare-earth miner, crucial for various high-tech and defense industries, amidst increasing U.S.-China tensions over rare-earth supply.

title: Palantir stock falls 9%, extending losing streak to 5 trading days, as tech trade cools
summary: Palantir stock dropped 9%, extending its losing streak to five trading days, as the broader tech sector experiences a cooling trend. This decline follows a significant rise earlier in the year and a recent bearish report from Citron Research. The market is seeing a shift from concentrated growth giants to more diversified sectors, though some strategists view this broadening as a healthier sign for the S&P 500.

title: Apple doubles its top bug bounty payout to $2 million - BetaNews
summary: Apple has announced significant changes to its Apple Security Bounty program, including doubling the top award for exploit chains to $2 million, with potential payouts exceeding $5 million for additional challenges. The company is also expanding bounty categories and introducing "Target Flags" to objectively demonstrate exploitability and accelerate award processing. Since its launch in 2020, Apple has paid over $35 million to more than 800 security researchers.

title: 1 Growth Stock Down 66% to Buy Right Now
summary: Lululemon Athletica (NASDAQ: LULU) shares have dropped 66% from their peak, primarily due to slower growth in the U.S. and increased competition. Despite these challenges, the company maintains a strong brand, high gross margins, and growth opportunities in men's apparel and international markets, particularly China, making its current valuation attractive for long-term investors.

title: The limited-edition game Realme is playing in chase of the throne - The Economic Times
summary: Realme is leveraging limited-edition collaborations, such as with Game of Thrones, Naruto, Coca-Cola, and Aston Martin, as a key business strategy to enhance brand identity, engage new audiences, and build user loyalty. These partnerships transform smartphones into cultural symbols, appealing to a tech-savvy generation. Chase Xu, Vice President and CMO, Realme, emphasizes that these collaborations aim to create irreplaceable value and provide immersive experiences beyond just sales, strategically timed to maintain brand visibility and innovation.

title: USA Rare Earth’s Meteoric Rise: The Pre-Revenue Mining Stock Targeting $30+ amid China Tensions
summary: USA Rare Earth (USAR), a pre-revenue mining company, has seen its stock soar over 120% in 2025, reaching over $32 amid strong investor interest and strategic developments. The company is pursuing a "mine-to-magnet" strategy aimed at establishing a fully domestic rare-earth supply chain in the U.S., from its Round Top deposit in Texas to a magnet factory in Oklahoma. This rapid appreciation is driven by key catalysts like a new CEO with strong government connections, a strategic acquisition of an alloy producer, and growing geopolitical tensions concerning rare earth supply from China, though analysts caution about its valuation given its pre-revenue status and execution risks.

title: ‘Apple’s Biggest Threat Is Not Google…’: Former Apple Chief Has This Warning For CEO Tim Cook - News18
summary: Former Apple CEO John Sculley warns current CEO Tim Cook that Apple's biggest threat is not Google or Meta, but OpenAI, due to its significant lead in the AI race. He also notes delays in Apple's AI initiatives like Siri, leaving the company playing catch-up with rivals.

title: TSMC Q3 profit expected to soar 28% on AI spending boom
summary: TSMC is projected to achieve a record 28% profit jump in the third quarter of 2025 due to strong demand for AI chips from companies like Nvidia and Apple. This growth is expected despite potential impacts from U.S. tariffs and trade disputes. The company's expansion into the U.S. with new factories in Arizona highlights its strategic positioning in the global semiconductor market.

The integration aims to enhance accessibility and responsiveness for traders managing various financial instruments on PrimeXBT's platform.

title: Apple might launch new iPad Pro, Vision Pro, and more this week - Mashable
summary: Apple is expected to launch several new products this week, including a new iPad Pro, updated Vision Pro, and possibly a 14-inch MacBook Pro, all featuring the new M5 chip. Apple is also reportedly scaling back plans for a cheaper Vision Pro to focus on smart glasses that will launch "eventually."

summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSM) is projected to report a record 28% increase in third-quarter net profit to T$415.4 billion ($13.6 billion), driven by surging demand for AI chips from clients like Nvidia, AMD, and Apple. This launch will reveal whether Apple can maintain its market leadership despite these challenges.

summary: Jefferies has adjusted its price target for Apple Inc. to $203.07, a slight decrease from its previous target of $205.16. The firm has also chosen to maintain its "Underperform" rating on the stock. This update was reported on October 13, 2025, at 05:59 am EDT.

JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon stressed the need for faster investment and reduced obstacles in the U.S. economy.

title: Stock Market Today: Dow Jones, S&P 500 Rally After Trump Hints At De-Escalation With China—Mag 7, Fastenal, Lucid In Focus
summary: U.S. stock futures rose following hints of de-escalation in U.S.-China trade tensions by former President Donald Trump, leading to a rally in key indices and Magnificent 7 stocks. The deal, which faced intense regulatory scrutiny, is expected to accelerate AI and computing innovation, leading to more advanced AI features in consumer devices and intensifying competition in the chip market.

title: Apple CarPlay Finally Got One Of iOS 16.1's Best Features Years Later - bgr.com
summary: Apple CarPlay has finally integrated Live Activities with the release of iOS 26, years after the feature first appeared in iOS 16.1. This update allows CarPlay users to view real-time information such as navigation, sports scores, and food delivery estimates directly on their car's display. Users need to update their iPhone to iOS 26 and potentially their vehicle's infotainment system to utilize this new functionality.

title: Taiwan says China's latest rare earth export controls won't hurt its chip industry - TechSpot

title: Apple in talks to acquire Prompt AI talent and tech - Yahoo Finance

Prompt's leadership informed staff about the pending transaction, indicating that employees not joining Apple would receive a reduced salary, and that investors would get some payment but "won't be made whole." This move highlights a trend of large tech firms acquiring smaller AI talent and technology to integrate new capabilities into their existing product lines.

title: Elon Musk’s xAI ‘Macrohard’ Project Targets Microsoft’s Turf at an ‘Immense Scale’ - TipRanks
summary: Elon Musk has announced xAI's "Macrohard" project, aiming to create an AI software company capable of simulating traditional tech giants like Microsoft on an "immense scale." Macrohard seeks to build fully automated, AI-driven systems for software development, with the potential to handle coding, design, and testing autonomously. While analysts acknowledge the ambition, they also highlight challenges such as the need for human oversight in long-term product design and the difficulty of replicating established enterprise relationships.

title: Is Ford a Millionaire-Maker Stock? - AOL.com

Ultimately, the article suggests Ford might be suitable for dividend investors but not for long-term wealth creation.

title: Apple's AI Under Fire: Accused of Using Shadow Libraries for Training Data - OpenTools

The lawsuit highlights the increasing scrutiny on major tech companies regarding their collection and use of data for artificial intelligence development.

title: Investors Rely On JPMorgan ETFs to Reach Annual $10,000 Goal - cointurk finance

title: Find this one bug and Apple will pay you more than Rs 17 crore - Mathrubhumi English

title: Former Apple CEO Declares OpenAI as Apple's First Real Competitor in Decades! - OpenTools

title: Apple hits highest ever third quarter as global smartphone market grows 3%
summary: The global smartphone market grew by 3% year-on-year in Q3 2025, driven by strong replacement demand and new product launches like the iPhone 17 series. Apple achieved its strongest third quarter in company history, with a 4% increase in shipments and an 18% market share, while Samsung maintained its lead with 19%. Analyst Omdia reports that the market recovery is also seeing strong performances from Xiaomi, TRANSSION, and vivo, though competitive pressure and rising costs are challenging vendor profitability.

title: Apple & Samsung lead the rebound as phone sales rise worldwide - AppleInsider
summary: Smartphone shipments rebounded in Q3 2025, reaching 322.7 million units, with Apple and Samsung leading the market. The growth was driven by strong trade-in deals and new features in flagship phones, rather than solely AI. Analysts caution that while the rebound is welcome, growth remains fragile amid global economic uncertainties and shifting geographical competition.

title: AMD and Intel teaming up to stick it to Arm has let to 'significant progress' improving x86 after just a year - PC Gamer
summary: AMD and Intel formed the x86 Ecosystem Advisory Group (EAG) one year ago to improve the x86 architecture and counter Arm's growing influence. This collaboration has led to significant progress, specifically with the development of AVX10 for improved vector performance, ACE for standardized matrix multiplication for AI workloads, and ChkTag for enhanced memory safety, bringing x86 closer to Arm's capabilities. These advancements aim to provide customers with more reasons to invest in Intel and AMD products in the competitive chip market.

title: SEPTEMBER SPEND TRENDS | UK Unlocked - Barclays Group
summary: Barclays' September Consumer Spend Report indicates a mixed picture, with overall card spending declining by -0.7% year-on-year, despite a rise in consumer confidence regarding personal finances. Essential spending fell for the fifth consecutive month, and discretionary spending growth hit a 15-month low, as consumers focused on prudence amid a decline in wider economic confidence. However, some retail categories like furniture, pharmacy, health & beauty, and clothing showed resilience, while consumers also prepared for the Golden Quarter and November's Autumn Budget.

title: Mixed options sentiment in Snap Inc. with shares down 0.31% - TipRanks
summary: Snap Inc. is experiencing mixed options sentiment with its shares down 0.31%. Options volume is relatively light, with calls leading puts, and implied volatility is higher, suggesting an expected daily move of $0.52. The put-call skew has steepened, indicating increased demand for downside protection on the stock.

title: Global smartphone shipments rise 2.6% in Q3; Samsung & Apple secure top spots: IDC
summary: Global smartphone shipments increased by 2.6% in the third quarter, reaching 322.7 million units. This recovery was primarily driven by the premium smartphone segment, with Samsung and Apple securing the top positions in the market. Consumers were reportedly upgrading to the latest devices, contributing to the shipment growth.

title: Apple Nearly Catches Samsung In Global Smartphone Shipments As iPhone 17 Demand Skyrockets, Poised To Take The Crown - Wccftech
summary: Apple's iPhone 17 sales are rapidly increasing its global smartphone market share, bringing the company closer to surpassing Samsung. This growth is attributed to Apple's premium strategy, attractive trade-in programs, flexible financing, and strong ecosystem loyalty, defying a generally stagnant smartphone market. If current trends continue, Apple is on track to reclaim the top spot for global smartphone shipments.

title: United States Digital Payment Forecast Report 2025-2033, Competitive Analysis of ACI, Aliant Payment, Amazon, American Express, Apple, Fiserv, Mastercard, Novetti, Paypal, Visa
summary: The U.S. Digital Payment Market is projected to grow from USD 3.06 trillion in 2024 to USD 9.29 trillion by 2033, exhibiting a CAGR of 13.11%. This significant growth is attributed to high smartphone and internet penetration, evolving payment technologies, and shifting consumer behavior, further accelerated by the COVID-19 pandemic. Despite challenges such as cybersecurity threats and the digital divide, digital payments are revolutionizing commerce and financial activities, driven by government support and the expansion of e-commerce.

title: United States Digital Payment Forecast Report 2025-2033, Competitive Analysis of ACI, Aliant Payment, Amazon, American Express, Apple, Fiserv, Mastercard, Novetti, Paypal, Visa
summary: The United States digital payment market is projected to grow from USD 3.06 trillion in 2024 to USD 9.29 trillion by 2033, exhibiting a CAGR of 13.11%. This growth is driven by high smartphone and internet penetration, evolving payment technologies, and shifting consumer behavior. Despite challenges like cybersecurity threats and the digital divide, digital payments are revolutionizing commerce and financial activities, with key players including ACI Worldwide, Amazon, Apple, Mastercard, PayPal, and Visa.

title: Apple TV+ is getting a rebrand, and this could get confusing - Tom's Guide
summary: Apple is rebranding its Apple TV+ subscription service to simply "Apple TV" as part of a "vibrant new identity." While the company has not provided specific reasons, the change could lead to confusion given existing Apple hardware and app products already named Apple TV. The rebranded service will globally stream Brad Pitt's "F1: The Movie" on Friday, December 12, 2025.

title: “The Last Frontier” Showrunner Jon Bokenkamp on Creating Apple TV’s Frigid, Frenetic Thriller - Motion Picture Association
summary: Jon Bokenkamp, known for "The Blacklist," discusses his new Apple TV series, "The Last Frontier," co-created with Richard D’Ovidio. The series is a tense drama about a plane crash in a calm Alaskan town, starring Jason Clarke and Haley Bennett. Bokenkamp shares insights into the show's origins, casting choices, and how the production team achieved its unique "analog" and "frenetic" feel.

title: Goodbye, Windows 10 — how a decade of 'progress' eroded users' command over their own machines - Tom's Hardware
summary: This article discusses the end of mainstream support for Windows 10 and how Microsoft's "software as a service" approach has gradually eroded user control over their machines. It critiques the trend, especially highlighted in Windows 11, where the operating system acts more as a controlled service than a user-owned tool, leading to user frustration and a sense of lost autonomy.

title: Trump Vs. China: Wall Street Scores Early Win As Beijing's Tech Titans Stumble
summary: Renewed US-China trade tensions, sparked by President Donald Trump's threats of 100% tariffs on Chinese imports, caused a sharp selloff in markets. While the Invesco China Technology ETF (CQQQ) plunged significantly more than the Invesco QQQ ETF (QQQ), U.S. tech stocks have shown greater resilience. This indicates Wall Street is better insulated from trade shocks than Beijing's tech sector, which is already burdened by domestic regulations and geopolitical risks.

title: Apple Can't Appeal £853M CPO Funding Deal At UK Top Court - Law360
summary: The UK's top court has denied Apple permission to challenge the approval of an £853 million ($1.1 billion) collective action. The lawsuit alleges that Apple concealed issues with iPhone batteries. This decision prevents Apple from appealing the decision regarding the funding deal for the collective action.

title: Ex-Apple CEO John Sculley explains why OpenAI is Apple’s ‘first real rival in decades’ - financialexpress.com
summary: Former Apple CEO John Sculley warns that OpenAI poses the first significant threat to Apple's dominance in decades, primarily due to Apple's slow adoption of AI technology. Sculley highlights OpenAI's strategic move to acquire Jony Ive's design firm, indicating their intent to revolutionize hardware alongside AI, directly challenging Apple's core strengths and potentially shifting the industry towards subscription-based models.

title: Business Productivity Software Market Valuation Expected to Hit USD 100 billion by Key Players: Microsoft Corporation, Google LLC, Apple Inc.,
summary: The Business Productivity Software Market is projected to reach USD 100 billion by 2031, expanding due to digital tool adoption, hybrid work trends, and cloud-based solutions. Key players include Microsoft, Google, and Apple. Growth drivers include technological advancements, expanding applications across sectors, favorable government policies, and increased R&D investment, with North America and Asia-Pacific being significant contributors.

title: Looking for the red flags in Apple’s Formula 1 TV deal - Six Colors
summary: Apple is reportedly looking to secure the U.S. Formula 1 TV rights for $140 million per year, a significant increase from ESPN's current $90 million. The major point of contention is F1 TV, Formula 1's existing profitable streaming service, which Apple wants shut down in the U.S. The article explores different possibilities for the deal, questioning whether Apple will simply offer a basic video stream or integrate interactive features that align with its technological capabilities.

title: Move Over, SCHD: 3 Monthly Dividend ETFs With Superior Long-Term Returns - AOL.com
summary: This article examines three monthly dividend ETFs—Amplify CWP Enhanced Dividend Income (DIVO), WisdomTree U.S. Total Dividend (DTD), and SPDR Dow Jones Industrial Average ETF Trust (DIA)—as compelling alternatives to the popular Schwab US Dividend Equity (SCHD). It highlights their superior long-term returns over the past 10 and 5 years, along with their unique strategies for income, growth, and stability. The piece also discusses the industry sector allocations and top holdings for each ETF, emphasizing the appeal of monthly payouts for investors.

title: Microsoft (MSFT)’s Data-center Crunch is Expected to Continue, Reports Bloomberg - Insider Monkey
summary: Bloomberg reports that Microsoft (MSFT)'s data-center crunch is likely to persist longer than anticipated, primarily due to struggles in keeping up with cloud demand. This has resulted in shortages of physical space or servers in several US data center regions. New subscriptions for Azure cloud services will remain restricted in certain hubs through the first half of next year.

title: Fears of a stock market crash are mounting - is NOW the time to invest in gold?
summary: Gold prices have reached a record $4,040 an ounce, soaring due to geopolitical tensions, sticky inflation, and uncertainty around the Trump administration's policies. Investment experts like Anne Ashworth suggest that gold may continue its ascent, with Goldman Sachs forecasting it could reach $4,900 by the end of 2026. This surge in gold investment is also driven by a desire to diversify portfolios amidst apprehension about an AI stock bubble, with some recommending gold compose 5 to 15 percent of an investment portfolio as a hedge against potential market instability.

title: The strategic advantages of active ETFs in volatile markets - T. Rowe Price
summary: This article discusses the strategic advantages of active ETFs in volatile markets, emphasizing their ability to help investors adapt to market challenges and opportunities. It highlights how active ETFs combine the benefits of ETFs (cost-effectiveness, liquidity, tax efficiency) with active management's flexibility to mitigate risk and enhance returns, particularly in addressing market concentration and leveraging defensive strategies like buffered and hedged equity ETFs.

title: Teradyne price target raised to $136 from $100 at Morgan Stanley
summary: Morgan Stanley analyst Shane Brett increased the price target for Teradyne (TER) to $136 from $100, maintaining an Equal Weight rating. The analyst cited strength in Teradyne's core business areas, including networking, memory, and Apple (AAPL) related operations, and revised up future estimates. Further upside towards a bull case of $180 would depend on the Nvidia (NVDA) optionality, according to Brett.

title: Could Tim Cook and Labubus Be a Match Made in Heaven? - Business Insider
summary: Apple CEO Tim Cook's visit to a Labubu exhibition in China sparked speculation about a potential collaboration between Apple and Pop Mart, the manufacturer of the popular "ugly-cute" toys. The visit caused Pop Mart's stock to rise and suggested a possible tie-up involving content, products, or games. Such a partnership could bolster Apple's goodwill with its Chinese audience and market.

title: Could Tim Cook and Labubus Be a Match Made in Heaven? – Business Insider
summary: Rumors are circulating about a potential partnership between Apple CEO Tim Cook and the emerging tech firm Labubus, sparking anticipation in the business world. This collaboration could merge Cook's strategic acumen and Apple's vast resources with Labubus's innovative approach, promising to redefine industry norms and drive significant technological advancements. Industry experts are envisioning a transformative impact, with the potential to introduce pioneering products and services that reshape the competitive landscape.

title: Apple makes a major energy investment in Europe - Computerworld
summary: Apple has announced a significant 650MW European energy investment to offset the energy consumed by its products and services with renewable power, as part of its global commitment to achieve a circular business by 2030. This initiative aims to make Apple energy-neutral by 2030, ensuring that the electricity used to power Apple devices in Europe is matched by clean electricity within five years. The company is supporting new wind and solar farms in multiple European countries, viewing these investments as a strategic business decision that also addresses energy pricing and supply challenges.

title: Oura raises $900M in latest funding round (AAPL:NASDAQ) - Seeking Alpha
summary: Oura Health, the company behind the Oura smart ring, has successfully raised $900 million in a funding round from investors including ICONIQ, Whale Rock Capital, and Atreides Management. This investment has propelled its valuation to approximately $11 billion, more than double its December 2024 level. The company is experiencing rapid growth in smart ring sales, contrasting with a decline in Apple smartwatch sales.

title: Semiconductor Supercycle: How AI Fuels Market Surges and Geopolitical Tensions - FinancialContent
summary: The semiconductor industry is experiencing an "AI supercycle" driven by the demand for AI chips, evidenced by Navitas Semiconductor's stock surge for its role in Nvidia's AI data centers and TSMC's strong earnings outlook. This surge highlights advancements in GaN, SiC, and advanced process nodes, reshaping the competitive landscape and raising concerns about supply chain resilience and environmental impact. The article projects continued growth in AI-driven semiconductors for the next five to ten years, emphasizing the importance of specialized AI accelerators and geopolitical stability.

title: Buy the Surge in Taiwan Semiconductor Stock as Q3 Results Approach? - sharewise.com
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor (TSM) stock recently hit an all-time high, driven by surging demand for AI chips, and investors are keenly awaiting its Q3 results on October 16. The company is a crucial manufacturer for major tech firms like Apple, Nvidia, and AMD, producing advanced 3nm and 5nm nodes. Analysts project record Q3 sales and earnings, with TSM consistently surpassing estimates, making it a viable investment despite a "Hold" rating from Zacks.

title: Apple sued over use of copyrighted books to train Apple Intelligence - Arizona Digital Free Press
summary: Apple is facing a lawsuit from two neuroscientists, Susana Martinez-Conde and Stephen Macknik, who allege the company misused thousands of their copyrighted books to train its Apple Intelligence AI model. The scientists claim Apple utilized datasets containing pirated books scraped from the internet, leading to an unspecified amount of monetary damages and a demand for Apple to cease the unauthorized use of their work. This lawsuit is part of a growing trend of copyright owners suing tech companies over the use of their content for AI training.

title: Independence Bank of Kentucky Buys Another $3.1 Million Eli Lilly (NYSE: LLY) Shares
summary: Independence Bank of Kentucky has purchased an additional 4,193 shares of Eli Lilly (NYSE: LLY), valued at an estimated $3.12 million, according to its latest SEC filing. This transaction increases the bank's total stake in Eli Lilly to 14,521 shares, worth $11.08 million, and now constitutes 1.42% of its reportable U.S. equity AUM. The bank has been consistently buying LLY shares for at least nine consecutive quarters, making it its 11th-largest holding due to Eli Lilly's strong positioning in the GLP-1 market for obesity and diabetes.

title: Independence Bank of Kentucky Buys Another $3.1 Million Eli Lilly (NYSE: LLY) Shares - The Globe and Mail
summary: Independence Bank of Kentucky significantly increased its holdings in Eli Lilly (LLY) by purchasing an additional 4,193 shares, valued at approximately $3.12 million. This transaction elevates Eli Lilly to 1.42% of the bank's reportable U.S. equity AUM, despite the company's stock underperforming the S&P 500 over the past year. The bank has been consistently building its position in Eli Lilly, recognizing the company's strong performance and leadership in the obesity and diabetes markets.

title: Apple's Joswiak flashes new hardware in cryptic post (AAPL:NASDAQ) - Seeking Alpha
summary: Greg Joswiak, Apple's senior vice president of global marketing, posted a cryptic message hinting at new hardware. His post stated, "Mmmmm… something powerful is coming," suggesting an imminent product announcement from Apple.

title: Apple expands renewable energy projects across Europe - Apple
summary: Apple is significantly expanding its clean energy projects across Europe, adding 650 megawatts of renewable energy capacity in various countries. This initiative is part of Apple's 2030 goal to be carbon neutral across its entire footprint and match 100 percent of global customer electricity use with clean electricity. The projects will generate over 1 million megawatt-hours of clean electricity on behalf of Apple users by 2030 and involve substantial financial investment.

title: Independence Bank of Kentucky Buys Another $3.1 Million Eli Lilly (NYSE: LLY) Shares
summary: Independence Bank of Kentucky has purchased an additional 4,193 shares of Eli Lilly and Company (LLY), valued at an estimated $3.12 million, according to its latest SEC filing. This acquisition increases the bank's total stake in Eli Lilly to 14,521 shares, worth $11.08 million, and now accounts for 1.42% of its reportable U.S. equity AUM. The bank has been consistently adding to its Eli Lilly position for at least nine consecutive quarters, seeing it as a key player in the obesity and diabetes markets.

title: Dynamic Advisor Solutions Dumps 26K QQQ Shares Worth $15 Million - The Motley Fool
summary: Dynamic Advisor Solutions LLC sold 26,223 shares of Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ) in Q3 2025, valued at approximately $15.02 million. This transaction reduced their QQQ holdings to 71,443 shares, now worth $42.89 million, and represents a rebalancing of their portfolio, rather than a negative outlook on QQQ itself, given the ETF's strong performance. QQQ remains one of the company's top holdings, complementing riskier tech stocks in their diverse ETF-heavy portfolio.

title: Dynamic Advisor Solutions Dumps 26K QQQ Shares Worth $15 Million - The Globe and Mail
summary: Dynamic Advisor Solutions LLC sold 26,223 shares of Invesco QQQ Trust (NASDAQ:QQQ) during Q3 2025, valued at approximately $15.02 million. Following this sale, their QQQ holding stands at 71,443 shares worth $42.89 million, representing 1.24% of the fund’s AUM. This move is interpreted as profit-taking, given QQQ's strong performance, and QQQ remains a top holding for the firm.

title: Apple Teases Powerful M5 MacBook Pro in Greg Joswiak’s Cryptic Post Ahead of October Launch
summary: Apple's Greg Joswiak has teased the upcoming M5 MacBook Pro with a cryptic social media post, hinting at significant silicon upgrades. The launch is expected in October, with the 14-inch model likely being the first to feature the new M5 chip fabricated on TSMC's N3E process. Users can anticipate faster CPU/GPU cores, enhanced battery life, better thermal management, and improved unified memory.

title: Barnes County man accused of using AI to generate child sex abuse materials set to change his plea - Valley News Live
summary: A Barnes County man, Mitchell Kohler, charged with five counts of possession of prohibited materials, is scheduled to change his plea after initially pleading not guilty. Kohler was arrested when Apple Inc. reported suspected child sex abuse material, and he later admitted to using AI to create images and videos of teenage girls from his community using their Instagram photos. He is set to change his plea on October 20, with a felony jury trial tentatively scheduled for October 21.

title: Seeking Alpha’s top Quant picks in the tech sector ahead of earnings
summary: The S&P 500's Information Technology sector has seen over 20% year-to-date gains in 2025, largely fueled by AI optimism, despite concerns of a potential AI bubble. Semiconductors and IT services are attracting the most investor interest, while tech hardware and communications equipment are seeing selling pressure. Investors are advised to watch for potential earnings disappointments, especially in the memory and HDD subsectors, which may not meet high expectations.

title: TBH Global Asset Management LLC Decreases Stock Position in Apple Inc. $AAPL - Defense World
summary: TBH Global Asset Management LLC reduced its stake in Apple Inc. while other institutional investors like Burkett Financial Services LLC and Avid Wealth Partners LLC increased their positions. The article also details Apple's recent stock performance, dividend announcement, analyst ratings, and a significant insider stock sale by CEO Timothy D. Cook. Apple operates globally, manufacturing and marketing smartphones, personal computers, tablets, wearables, and accessories.

title: Samsung Profits Surge Up 30% As Arch Rival LG Slumps - Channel News
summary: Samsung Electronics is projected to report a 30% year-on-year increase in operating profit for the September quarter, reaching an estimated A$13.1 billion, driven primarily by strong demand for AI memory chips. This surge comes as rival LG Electronics experienced a drop in profits. Samsung's growth is largely attributed to its device solutions division, securing major contracts with companies like Nvidia and OpenAI, despite declines in its TV and home appliance sectors.

title: Iridium, Qualcomm Integrate Satellite Services Into Snapdragon Radios To Boost Global Connectivity For US Government, Allies
summary: Iridium Communications and Qualcomm Technologies have integrated Iridium data services into the Snapdragon Mission Tactical Radio, enhancing global connectivity for the U.S. government and allied partners. This integration provides secure L-band satellite communications for devices in environments where terrestrial networks are unavailable. The partnership also extends to making Iridium data services available through the Snapdragon X75 5G Modem-RF System for specialized satellite connectivity solutions.

title: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Q3 Preview: With Stock Near 52-Week Highs, Here's What To Watch - inkl
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSM) is set to release its Q3 earnings, with analysts expecting significant revenue and EPS growth driven by AI and high-performance computing demand. The stock is trading near 52-week highs despite geopolitical concerns, and the company's investments in U.S. chip manufacturing and Nvidia's AI chip sales to China are potential future catalysts. The article highlights TSM's consistent outperformance of analyst estimates and its critical role in the global AI supply chain.

title: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Q3 Preview: With Stock Near 52-Week Highs, Here's What To Watch
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSM) is set to report Q3 earnings, with analysts expecting significant revenue and EPS growth fueled by AI and high-performance computing demand. The company's stock is trading near 52-week highs, benefiting from key clients like Apple and Nvidia, and strong prior quarter performance, despite potential geopolitical and tariff concerns. Investors will be watching for insights into continued demand and any updates on U.S. manufacturing investments and tariffs.

title: Apple TV+ Has a New Name - 106.9 KROC
summary: Apple has rebranded its streaming service, dropping the "+" from "Apple TV+". This change aims to simplify the naming convention, though potential confusion with the Apple TV hardware is noted. The article also mentions the upcoming F1 movie streaming on the service.

title: Broadcom makes bid to knock off Nvidia with new networking chip - Cryptopolitan
summary: Broadcom has launched its new Thor Ultra networking chip, intensifying its rivalry with Nvidia in the AI market. This high-performance chip is designed to connect hundreds of thousands of AI processors, enabling the development of larger and more sophisticated AI models. Broadcom projects substantial growth in its AI-related products, aiming to capture a significant share of the AI infrastructure market.

title: Apple Poised for Another Dividend Hike, Solidifying Appeal for Income Investors - FinancialContent
summary: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ: AAPL) is expected to announce another quarterly dividend hike, continuing its 14-year streak of increases and reinforcing its appeal to dividend growth investors. Despite a modest current yield, Apple's consistent dividend growth, strong financial health, and strategic capital allocation make it an attractive long-term investment. This move aligns with a broader trend among mature tech companies balancing growth with shareholder returns.

title: Microsoft Continues Dividend Prowess with Latest Declaration: A Beacon for Income Investors - FinancialContent
summary: Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ: MSFT) has declared a quarterly dividend of $0.91 per share, continuing its 20-year streak of dividend increases. This commitment to shareholder returns positions Microsoft as an attractive option for income-oriented investors, signaling the company's robust financial health and stability within the technology sector. The consistent dividend policy also serves as a benchmark for other tech companies, balancing aggressive innovation with reliable income generation.

title: Apple offers up to $5 million in rewards for finding security bugs - The American Bazaar
summary: Apple has significantly expanded its bug bounty program, offering rewards of up to $5 million for discovering critical security flaws, particularly in iOS or Safari's Lockdown Mode. The program aims to encourage ethical hackers to identify vulnerabilities before malicious actors can exploit them, reinforcing Apple's commitment to device security and privacy. This initiative, which has already paid out $35 million to over 800 researchers, is part of Apple's strategy to stay ahead of cyber threats by engaging a global network of security experts.

title: American Airlines will allow passengers to add boarding passes to Google Wallet
summary: American Airlines announced that passengers will soon be able to add their boarding passes to Google Wallet, mirroring a feature already available for Apple Wallet users. This new option aims to streamline the check-in process for travelers. Boarding passes can be automatically added to Google Wallet after checking in through the American Airlines app.

title: Intel Shares Outpace Market as Strong Earnings Outlook Drives Lift
summary: Intel's stock has surged due to renewed investor confidence in its turnaround strategy, marked by progress in its manufacturing plan and the expansion of Intel Foundry Services. Improved earnings expectations and AI-related demand are driving this optimism, despite ongoing challenges from competition and the capital-intensive nature of its foundry business. The company's rally is supported by operational improvements and a strategic reset, but its sustained success hinges on disciplined execution and achieving its ambitious manufacturing goals.

title: BlackRock CEO Larry Fink: Asset Tokenization Is Just Beginning — 2025 RWA and Ethereum (ETH) Trading Implications - Blockchain News
summary: BlackRock CEO Larry Fink announced that the market is at the beginning of the tokenization of all assets, signaling a continued institutional focus on real-world asset (RWA) adoption on blockchain. This move could democratize investments, allowing retail traders to access high-value assets, and opens up significant trading opportunities in tokenized assets and related cryptocurrencies like Ethereum (ETH), Chainlink (LINK), and Polygon (MATIC). The article suggests that increased institutional adoption could bolster the overall crypto ecosystem and influence price dynamics across major tokens, leading to potential bullish breakouts.

title: Apple Says It Has 'Significantly More' Than 45 Million Apple TV Subscribers
summary: Apple executive Eddy Cue revealed that Apple TV has "significantly more" than 45 million subscribers, exceeding previous estimates. This growth positions Apple TV as a thriving service in a competitive streaming market, notable for its exclusive focus on award-winning original content. The service has seen a price increase, with subscriptions now at $12.99 per month.

title: Apple Car Key could soon make its way to more GM vehicles - AppleInsider
summary: Apple's Car Key feature, which allows iPhone and Apple Watch users to unlock and start their cars, is expected to expand to more General Motors (GM) vehicles. Code discoveries and a WWDC 2025 announcement indicate that car brands like Chevrolet, GMC, and Cadillac will soon support the technology, with initial known compatibility for the 2026 Chevy Silverado EV and 2026 GMC Sierra EV.

title: Best Prime Day Apple deal: Save $120 on the Apple Watch 10 - Mashable
summary: During October's Prime Day, the Apple Watch 10 is available for $279, a savings of $120 from its original price of $399. This deal marks its lowest-ever price for the model, making it an attractive option despite the release of the newer Apple Watch 11. The article highlights the device's impressive health and fitness features, communication capabilities, and durability.

title: Morgan Stanley Predicts Steep Dip For S&P 500 Index This Month - Watcher Guru
summary: Morgan Stanley analysts, led by Mike Wilson, have issued a bearish forecast for the S&P 500, predicting a potentially steep dip this month due to escalating US-China tensions and elevated market positioning. The bank suggests a potential downside target of 6,027 for the index, nearly 11% below recent highs. While a Fed interest rate cut could mitigate the downturn, Morgan Stanley maintains its broader bullish view that a new bull cycle is underway.

title: Google Stock’s October Surge: Alphabet Nears Record Highs on AI Buzz and Analyst Upgrades - ts2.tech
summary: Alphabet's stock is nearing record highs in October 2025, driven by significant AI investments, new product launches, and strong analyst upgrades. Despite market volatility and ongoing regulatory scrutiny, the company's robust fundamentals, including a resurgent ad business and booming Google Cloud, position it as a leading performer among tech giants. Investors are closely watching its Q3 earnings report for continued double-digit growth.

title: Apple Stock Shrugs Off Trade War Scare as New Products & CEO Succession Buzz Fuel Optimism - ts2.tech
summary: Apple Inc. (AAPL) stock remained stable despite U.S.-China trade war threats, closing near $248 on October 14, 2025, buoyed by dovish Fed signals and optimism about new product launches. The company is preparing to unveil new MacBook Pros with M5 chips, iPad Pros, and an upgraded Vision Pro headset, while also subtly preparing for CEO Tim Cook's succession with John Ternus emerging as a leading internal candidate. Analysts are split on Apple's outlook, with some forecasting a new "supercycle" of demand and a $310 price target, while others express valuation concerns given the current market cap of $3.8 trillion.

title: Tech Stocks Climb As AI, Chips, And Gadgets Spark Investor Interest - Finimize
summary: Tech stocks, especially chipmakers, saw significant gains driven by advancements in AI, planned product launches, and strategic investments. Meta's $1.5 billion investment in an AI data center and OpenAI's $1 trillion spending plan highlight the growing investor confidence in artificial intelligence. Companies like Apple, AMD, and Alphabet also contributed to the surge with new device rollouts and expanded autonomous vehicle services.

title: KODEX US Dividend Covered Call Active ETF Surpasses KRW 700 Billion in Net Assets
summary: The KODEX US Dividend Covered Call Active ETF by Samsung Asset Management has surpassed KRW 700 billion in net assets, growing significantly within 10 months due to strong individual net purchases and stable returns. It boasts a high annual dividend yield of 9.2% and has consistently outperformed competitors across various return periods.

title: Tech And Chip Stocks Tick Up As AMD Gets A Nod
summary: Tech and chip stocks saw gains with AMD rallying over 6% after analysts raised price targets, indicating confidence in its long-term prospects. Alphabet and Apple also contributed to the sector's upbeat mood with new product announcements and expansions, showcasing continued growth in hardware and AI. The strength in semiconductor stocks and big tech's strategic moves suggest ongoing innovation and investor optimism.

title: Rumored Apple Home Hub tablet to be made in Vietnam, cost $350 - AppleInsider
summary: A new report suggests that Apple's long-rumored Home Hub tablet, focused on Apple Home integration, is expected to launch in March 2026. title: Microsoft, Tear Down That Wall! - Cory Doctorow – Medium
summary: Cory Doctorow argues that the EU's Eurostack initiative will fail unless it addresses the issue of data migration from existing US tech platforms. He highlights anticircumvention laws, initially pushed by the US to protect its tech giants, as a major barrier. Doctorow proposes that the EU must repeal Article 6 of its Copyright Directive to allow reverse-engineering, enabling users to move their data freely and foster European tech competition, citing cases like Dieselgate and Newag as examples of anticircumvention laws being misused.

title: Apple Updates iPad Pro, MacBook Pro, Vision Pro With M5 Chip
summary: Apple Inc. has updated its iPad Pro, Vision Pro headset, and 14-inch MacBook Pro with its new M5 chip, ahead of the holiday shopping season. These new products, which feature no major exterior design changes except for a new Vision Pro headband, are available for preorder and will be in stores on October 22nd, maintaining their previous price points.

title: Apple lobbies India to change tax law seen hindering its expansion - The Indian Express
summary: Apple is lobbying the Indian government to amend its income tax law to avoid taxation on high-end iPhone machinery it provides to contract manufacturers, a move seen as crucial for its expansion in India. The current law could classify Apple's ownership of equipment as a "business connection," making its iPhone profits in India liable for taxes. This issue doesn't affect rival Samsung, which manufactures phones in its own Indian factories.

title: OpenAI partners with Walmart to let users buy products in ChatGPT
summary: OpenAI has partnered with Walmart to enable users to make purchases directly within ChatGPT using "Instant Checkout." The partnership signifies OpenAI's broader strategy to expand into online commerce and generate revenue, following similar integrations with Shopify and Etsy.

title: Apple introduces the powerful new iPad Pro with the M5 chip - Apple

The company plans to monetize its intellectual property, enter online advertising, and develop consumer hardware. This strategic overhaul comes amidst concerns about financing its ambitious computing capacity commitments, with aims to double its paying ChatGPT subscribers and maintain its high valuation.

This new model, starting at $1,599, also delivers enhanced CPU and graphics performance, increased memory bandwidth, and an impressive 24 hours of battery life, making it a powerful upgrade for professionals and AI-centric workflows, shipping with macOS Tahoe.

title: Pricing Stays Private: Appellate Court Draws the Line on FRAND Transparency - Lewis Silkin
summary: The Court of Appeal has issued important guidance on the redaction of confidential information in FRAND (Fair, Reasonable, and Non-Discriminatory) judgments, especially regarding third-party material. The court ruled that financial terms such as lump-sum payments and unpacked per-unit rates from third-party licenses must be redacted to prevent commercial harm, affirming that open justice admits limited exceptions for confidential information. This decision emphasizes a pragmatic approach in FRAND cases, prioritizing the protection of granular commercial terms while still requiring justification for redaction through a case-specific balancing exercise.

title: Discontinued M2 Vision Pro Is Not Eligible For Trade-In, Raising Questions About Apple’s Long-Term Commitment - Wccftech

The lawsuit alleges that Cash App violated state law by sending unsolicited promotional texts through its "Invite Friends" program. Washington residents who received these texts between November 14, 2019, and August 7, 2025, without prior consent may be eligible for a payout of $88 to $147 and have until October 27, 2025, to submit a claim.

title: Apple wins dismissal of US claims that it knowingly abetted CSAM - MLex
summary: A US federal judge has dismissed most of a proposed class action against Apple Inc., which accused the company of facilitating the distribution of child sexual-abuse material (CSAM) on its devices and cloud services. The judge found that the claims were largely barred by Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act and that plaintiffs failed to prove Apple knowingly received or distributed CSAM under Masha's Law. This ruling represents a significant legal victory for Apple in a sensitive case.

The article suggests that while breakthroughs in AI and design are occurring, smart glasses are likely to remain niche products rather than ubiquitous replacements for existing mobile technology.

title: Apple launches iPad Pro, Vision Pro and MacBook Pro with M5 chip - The Star
summary: Apple has updated its iPad Pro, Vision Pro, and entry-level MacBook Pro models with the new M5 chip, enhancing performance for computing, graphics, and AI tasks. The refreshed products are available for preorder and aim to boost sales ahead of the holiday season, following the recent launch of the iPhone 17 and other devices. The company is also working on M5 Pro and M5 Max versions for future MacBook Pro models and has other product updates planned.

title: Wirecutter’s Guide to Navigating Tariffs This Holiday Season - The New York Times
summary: This Wirecutter guide offers advice for holiday shopping amidst tariffs and potential price increases. It suggests strategies like not expecting blowout Black Friday deals, researching prices, considering specific product categories for tech, allowing extra shipping time, and being aware of potential additional tariff bills. The article also recommends focusing on quality over quantity and explores ways to find good deals despite rising costs.

title: Apple Urges India To Revise Tax Rules Threatening Expansion Of High-End iPhone Manufacturing: Report - Swarajyamag
summary: Apple is urging India to revise its income tax laws, as current regulations threaten the expansion of high-end iPhone manufacturing in the country. The tech giant is concerned that existing rules could make its global iPhone profits taxable in India due to foreign ownership of manufacturing equipment. This comes as India's share of global iPhone shipments and domestic market share has significantly increased, with Foxconn and Tata investing billions in manufacturing plants.

title: Global CEOs to Meet Chinese Trade Negotiator as Tensions Linger
summary: Global CEOs, including Tim Cook of Apple Inc., are expected to meet with China's top trade negotiator He Lifeng in Beijing this week. This meeting comes amidst increased trade tensions between China and the US, and the executives are part of an advisory board for Tsinghua University’s School of Economics and Management.

title: Global CEOs to Meet Chinese Trade Negotiator as Tensions Linger
summary: Global CEOs, including Tim Cook of Apple Inc. (AAPL:US), are scheduled to meet with China's top trade negotiator He Lifeng in Beijing this week. This meeting coincides with escalating trade tensions between China and the US. The executives are part of an advisory board for Tsinghua University’s School of Economics and Management and are expected to have an audience with the vice premier.

title: Global CEOs including Apple Tim Cook are expected to meet top trade Chinese negotiator He Lifeng in Beijing this week - Bloomberg News - MarketScreener
summary: Apple CEO Tim Cook and other global CEOs are reportedly scheduled to meet with China's top trade negotiator, He Lifeng, in Beijing this week. The meeting follows recent news of Apple shifting some production from China to Vietnam, among other updates to its product line-up. This interaction comes amid ongoing developments in Apple's global supply chain and product innovation.

title: Apple AI Talent Exodus Continues As Exec Overseeing ChatGPT-Like Search Feature Jumps Ship To Meta: Report
summary: Apple's AI efforts face a setback as Ke Yang, head of the "Answers, Knowledge and Information (AKI)" group, reportedly left for Meta Platforms. Yang was overseeing a ChatGPT-like search feature crucial for Apple's revamped personal assistant, Siri. This departure is part of a trend of AI talent leaving Apple for rivals like Meta, raising concerns about Apple's competitive standing in AI.

title: Apple Expands iPad Air Accessory Lineup with New Black Magic Keyboard - Zoom Bangla News
summary: Apple has introduced a new black color option for its Magic Keyboard, specifically designed for the iPad Air, providing users with an additional aesthetic choice. This new black model offers the same functionality as the existing white version, including a responsive keyboard and built-in trackpad, and is priced at $269 for the 11-inch model and $319 for the 13-inch model. The release aims to cater to user demand for more color variety and strengthens the iPad Air's position as a versatile computing device.

title: Barclays handing ISA customers free £900 ahead of November rule change - Birmingham Live
summary: Barclays is offering new customers up to £900 for switching their current account and savings, including ISAs, ahead of a potential rule change by the Labour Party government. This offer includes various tiers for current account switches and ISA transfers, with a maximum of £500 for ISA transfers of £100,000 or more. The incentive runs until November 27, prompting mixed reactions from customers.

title: Latest OTT releases this week (Oct 14-20): What’s streaming new across Netflix, Prime Video, Zee5 & JioHotstar - The Economic Times

It provides details on various movies and series, including "How to Train Your Dragon," "Lokah Chapter 1," "The Diplomat Season 3," and "Bhagwat Chapter One: Raakshas," along with their genres, cast, platforms, and release dates. The list caters to diverse tastes, from animation and adventure to thrillers, dramas, and romantic sagas.

title: Omdia: CN 3Q Smartphone Mkt Declines 3% as Vivo Regains Top Position - AASTOCKS.com
summary: Omdia reported that mainland China's smartphone market saw a 3% year-over-year decline in Q3 2025. Despite the overall market contraction, competition among manufacturers intensified. Vivo regained the top position with 11.8 million units shipped, capturing an 18% market share, though experiencing a 9% YoY decline in its own shipments.

title: AAPL News Today: Apple Shares Slide After Supplier Data Fuels Demand Fears - Meyka
summary: Apple Inc. (AAPL) shares have declined following data from key Asian suppliers indicating waning demand for iPhones ahead of the crucial holiday season. This has led to increased volatility in the tech sector and heightened concerns about Apple's upcoming performance. Analysts have mixed views, with upcoming earnings on October 30th expected to provide more clarity on iPhone sales projections and strategic responses.

title: Microsoft Tops Phishing Impersonations in Q3 2025 - Check Point Blog
summary: Microsoft was the most impersonated brand in phishing attempts during Q3 2025, accounting for 40% of all cases. Other major tech brands like Google and Apple also ranked high, with PayPal and DHL re-entering the top ten, indicating criminals' continued focus on trusted digital services. The report details examples of sophisticated phishing sites impersonating DHL and PayPal and offers advice for users and organizations to protect themselves.

title: US Tech Majors Microsoft And AWS Eye Shifting Production From China: Report
summary: Microsoft and AWS are reportedly planning to shift production of their Surface laptops, data center servers, and sensitive AI data center servers out of China, aiming to diversify manufacturing due to geopolitical tensions. This move presents a significant opportunity for India, which has already seen success with Apple's iPhone production, though India faces competition from other Southeast Asian nations and challenges like raw material imports and skill gaps. The Indian government's Production Linked Incentive scheme and a large domestic market are seen as accelerators for attracting manufacturing investments.

title: What might Trumpian meddling mean for Intel? | Mint - Mint
summary: Donald Trump is reportedly considering a government investment in Intel, treating the struggling chipmaker like an activist investor. This move follows Intel's financial difficulties and a slowdown in demand for its older chips. The article explores how Trump’s "meddling" could influence Intel’s manufacturing (specifically in Ohio) and potential deals involving other chip designers like AMD and Nvidia, possibly forcing them to use Intel's foundry services.

title: Apple Vision Pro 2025 brings faster AI, improved display, new band design - Business Standard
summary: Apple has announced the 2025 refresh of its Vision Pro headset, featuring the new M5 chip for enhanced performance, improved display rendering, and faster AI processing. The updated device also boasts a new dual knit band for increased comfort and runs on visionOS 26, introducing new spatial experiences like widgets and upgraded Personas. Pre-orders are currently open, with general availability starting October 22.

title: Computer Engineering Sector on Track for USD 1.2 trillion Valuation by Key Players:Google, Microsoft, Apple,
summary: The computer engineering market is projected to reach a robust USD 1.2 trillion valuation by 2031, driven by rapid advancements in hardware, software, and embedded systems, growing at a CAGR of 6.5%. Key players like Google, Microsoft, and Apple are leading the expansion, as increasing demand for high-performance computing solutions across various industries fuels market growth. Factors such as technological innovation, expanding applications, favorable government policies, and increased R&D investments are supporting this significant market expansion, particularly in the Asia-Pacific region.

title: Major fat jab crackdown as potentially deadly fake 'Triple G' jabs flood the UK - Daily Mail
summary: An investigation has revealed that fake versions of an experimental weight loss drug called retatrutide, also known as 'Triple G' jabs, are being illegally sold on social media platforms in the UK. Manufacturer Eli Lilly, which produces Mounjaro, warned against using drugs from unauthorized sources due to serious health risks, while UK regulators confirmed the sale of fake retatrutide is illegal and could expose users to dangerous ingredients. Social media platforms have begun to remove related content following the investigation, despite continued reports of people, including teenagers, purchasing these unapproved injections online.

title: 6G Networks Market is Booming Worldwide | Major Giants Nokia,Ericsson,Google - newstrail.com

The market drivers include limitations of 5G, the need for ultra-fast communication in AI, XR, and IoT, and global competition for leadership in post-5G technology.

title: Amazing news: People can now control iPads with their minds - Fernandina Observer

The breakthrough significantly enhances independence and connectivity for people with motor disabilities by integrating brain signals with Apple's "Switch Control" accessibility features.

title: Should You Still Invest in the Vanguard 500 ETF After Goldman's Dire Prediction? - Mitrade
summary: Goldman Sachs' prediction of slow S&P 500 returns over the next decade hasn't materialized in the short term, with the index outperforming expectations, largely driven by the "Magnificent Seven" and AI boom. Despite this, the original forecast was long-term, and some analysts suggest considering equal-weighted funds like Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight ETF to diversify away from market concentration, even while acknowledging the continued value of cap-weighted funds like Vanguard S&P 500 ETF for long-term investing.

title: Microsoft remains the most imitated brand in phishing scams - BetaNews
summary: Microsoft was the most impersonated brand in phishing attacks during Q3 2025, accounting for 40 percent of attempts, followed by Google (9%) and Apple (6%). Phishing scams are becoming more sophisticated, using AI-generated content and mirroring official sites, with brands like PayPal and DHL also re-entering the top ten targeted brands. Experts emphasize a prevention-first approach, including multi-factor authentication and user education, to combat these evolving threats.

title: Microsoft pushes AI updates in Windows 11 as it ends support for Windows 10 - BNN Bloomberg
summary: Microsoft is rolling out new AI updates to Windows 11, including a voice-activated Copilot, as it ends free security support for Windows 10. This move encourages users to upgrade to Windows 11, despite concerns from consumer advocates about cybersecurity vulnerabilities and electronic waste for those unable to upgrade. Microsoft suggests that conversational AI on laptops will be as transformative as the mouse and keyboard, further integrating Copilot into the user experience.

title: Investors ignore red flags as Intel surges on share diluting $18 billion stake deals - Mitrade

Investors are prioritizing Intel's increased liquidity and efforts to revive its manufacturing capabilities over concerns about dilution, even as analysts warn about the sustainability of such rallies without client demand. This trend is mirrored by AMD, where a deal with OpenAI offering future equity warrants also led to a significant stock surge, highlighting a market focus on AI-driven optimism despite potential dilution and unusual circular financing.

title: Chip stocks rise after TSMC’s rosy outlook on strong AI demand - The Mighty 790 KFGO
summary: Semiconductor stocks increased after TSMC provided an optimistic forecast, fueled by strong demand for AI infrastructure exemplified by recent multi-billion-dollar deals. title: Chipmaker TSMC reports nearly 40% surge in its net profit, thanks to AI

(TSMC) reported a record net profit of $15 billion for the third quarter, a nearly 40% surge attributed to the increasing demand for artificial intelligence. The world's largest semiconductor manufacturer beat analyst forecasts and saw its revenue jump 30% year-on-year. TSMC continues to expand its global presence with new chip fabrication plants in the U.S. and Japan, supplying major companies like Apple and Nvidia.

title: TSMC’s Arizona Gigafab Cluster: A $165 Billion Bet on American Chip Dominance and AI Future - FinancialContent

The project, which will produce advanced 4nm to A16 (1.6nm) chips, faces challenges such as higher manufacturing costs and labor shortages but is seen as crucial for national security and technological sovereignty.

This growth highlights the deepening structural shift where AI hardware investments outpace traditional cyclical patterns, primarily driven by the demand for advanced chips from clients like Nvidia and Apple.

This approach showcases how intelligently orchestrating mixed hardware can lead to high-performance AI, hinting at future trends in AI infrastructure.

title: spectralDSP Corporation Revokes Unauthorized Access to Quantum-Optimized Waveform Enhancements Used in Global 4K/8K Delivery, SoC Modulation, and Bandwidth Scaling - Morningstar

The company states that this enforcement, grounded in various U.S. and international laws, will return affected devices and platforms to their baseline performance, potentially causing a reduction in video quality, increased power consumption, and latency for consumers.

Blue Owl Capital Inc. and Meta will co-own the site, with Meta retaining 20%, and Morgan Stanley arranging over $27 billion in debt and $2.5 billion in equity through a special purpose vehicle. This financing structure allows Meta to build massive data centers without impacting its credit rating, setting a precedent for other hyperscalers.

summary: President Trump announced a deal with Germany's Merck KGaA to cut drug costs for in-vitro fertilization and introduce new drugs at the same price as other developed countries, in exchange for tariff protection. The White House is also preparing to ease tariffs on the US auto industry. These developments occur amid ongoing trade tensions with China, with both sides exchanging threats and sanctions, although talks for a larger trade deal are reportedly underway.

title: Pricing Stays Private: Appellate Court Draws The Line On FRAND Transparency - Patent - United Kingdom - Mondaq
summary: A recent Court of Appeal decision in the UK provides important guidance on the redaction of confidential information, particularly third-party financial terms, within FRAND (Fair, Reasonable, and Non-Discriminatory) judgments. The court confirmed that lump-sum payments and unpacked per-unit rates from third-party licenses sensitive commercial terms should be redacted to prevent "real commercial harm," even if it slightly derogates from the principle of open justice. This ruling emphasizes a pragmatic, fact-sensitive balancing act between open justice and protecting confidential commercial information.

title: Multi Touch Market by Type and Application: Rapid Growth Projected from USD 2.5 billion (2026) to USD 6.2 billion (2033)

Despite missing EPS expectations due to this accounting adjustment, the company maintained its full-year revenue guidance and showed significant momentum in its ad-supported tier and strategic expansions. title: GM Says It Still Loves Android Auto and CarPlay – That's Why It's Killing Them Gradually

title: Corning results hit by weakness in optical fiber unit, shares fall

title: OpenAI completes corporate reorganization with support from Microsoft
summary: OpenAI has completed its reorganization into a public benefit corporation, a move supported by Microsoft. This restructuring involved significant negotiations and compromises between the two entities, including Microsoft retaining IP rights to OpenAI's models until 2032 while waiving rights related to OpenAI's upcoming consumer hardware. The new OpenAI Foundation will oversee the non-profit division, and an independent panel will verify any claims of achieving artificial general intelligence.

title: OpenAI restructures into public-benefit firm, Microsoft takes 27% stake
summary: OpenAI has restructured itself into a public-benefit corporation, a deal valuing the company at $500 billion and providing it with greater operating freedom and fundraising ability. Microsoft maintains a 27% stake, or $135 billion, in OpenAI and has secured a deal where OpenAI will purchase $250 billion in Microsoft Azure cloud computing services. This new structure aims to simplify corporate operations and facilitate future innovation and fundraising efforts while maintaining the nonprofit's control over the for-profit entity.

title: Apple, Microsoft hit $4T milestone

title: CFPB ends U.S. Bank, Apple consent orders early

U.S. Bank had been penalized for freezing unemployment benefits during the COVID-19 pandemic, while Apple faced action for failing to transmit customer disputes to Goldman Sachs regarding Apple Card. The CFPB, now under Acting Director Russ Vought, has similarly terminated other consent orders early in recent months.

title: Apple's App Store infected with XcodeGhost malware in China

The malware allowed for data theft and manipulation on infected devices, prompting Apple and affected developers like Tencent to take remedial actions.

title: This could be a ‘radically bullish’ sign for Nvidia, AMD and other chip stocks
summary: Big Tech earnings reports indicate a strong demand for AI computing that is outstripping supply, which bodes well for chip stocks like Nvidia, AMD, and Broadcom. Despite concerns over circular financing, a Cantor analyst believes the willingness to spend on AI infrastructure points to a "radically bullish" outlook for these companies. Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang projects AI infrastructure spending could reach $3 trillion to $4 trillion by 2030.

title: Google Hires PayPal Vet to Reset Strategy After Its Banking Retreat
summary: Google has hired former PayPal executive Arnold Goldberg to lead its payments division, signaling a strategic shift away from becoming a bank itself and towards fostering connections within the broader financial services industry, including cryptocurrencies. This move follows Google's decision to scrap its planned digital checking and savings service, Plex, and instead focus on integrating payment features more deeply into its existing services and operating as a comprehensive digital wallet. The company aims to partner with various financial entities and entice users by offering services without transaction fees, differentiating itself from competitors.

title: Qualcomm Stock: What to Expect from Q4 Earnings Report Amid Smartphone Slump and Diversification Push
summary: Qualcomm is set to release its Q4 fiscal 2025 results, with analysts anticipating moderate growth despite a global smartphone slump. The company's diversification into automotive, IoT, and data-center markets, alongside its licensing business, will be key areas of focus. Investors will be scrutinizing segment revenue breakdowns, management guidance, and margin trends to assess the success of its strategic shift.

title: Best Buy Black Friday ad 2025: Best deals to buy early
summary: Best Buy has launched its early Black Friday sale for 2025, offering deals throughout November before the official sale begins on November 20th. The article highlights key dates for the Black Friday event, which runs through November 29th, followed by Cyber Monday on November 30th and December 1st. It also lists several significant early deals on items like LG OLED TVs, Lenovo IdeaPads, Samsung gaming monitors, and Dyson vacuums, encouraging consumers to start their holiday shopping early.

title: Qualcomm set to report Q4 earnings as it enters AI data center market

This strategic move aims to compete with industry leaders like Nvidia and AMD and reduce reliance on the slowing smartphone market. Analysts view this expansion positively despite Qualcomm's stock lagging behind its competitors this year.

title: Alphabet stock gains 0.78% in premarket after earnings beat expectations and legal victory
summary: Alphabet Inc. (GOOGL) stock price rose 0.78% in premarket trading after last week's strong rally, driven by better-than-expected Q3 earnings and a significant legal victory regarding its search engine default payments from Apple. The company achieved its first-ever $100 billion quarter, fueled by AI and Cloud expansion, with eyes set on the $300 target despite its daily RSI signaling overbought conditions. Analysts are divided between the strength of its fundamentals and the potential for short-term exhaustion, reminiscent of the early 2000s tech boom.

title: Why Google Won… and Microsoft Didn’t
summary: This article discusses the recent tech earnings reports from the Magnificent Seven companies, highlighting strong performance from Alphabet, Amazon, Apple, and Microsoft. It also addresses a troubling trend of layoffs across tech and non-tech sectors, which the author attributes to an "Economic Singularity" where technology displaces traditional work. The author advises readers on how to profit from this shift.

title: Dell Technologies Inc. Cl C stock falls Friday, underperforms market
summary: Dell Technologies Inc. Cl C (DELL) shares experienced a decline on Friday, shedding 2.22% to close at $75.54, underperforming compared to the S&P 500's gain. The stock traded below its 50-day moving average, signaling a downward trend. Despite the daily loss, DELL's year-to-date performance remains positive, contrasting with the S&P 500's larger gains over the same period.

title: Apple to Debut In-House C2 Modems in iPhone 18 Pro by 2026
summary: Apple plans to debut its in-house C2 modems in the iPhone 18 Pro models by 2026, aiming to reduce reliance on Qualcomm and cut costs. This move follows years of development since Apple acquired Intel's modem business and is expected to enhance hardware-software integration. While promising potential savings and performance optimizations, the transition faces risks related to competitive performance and regulatory scrutiny.

title: Recosoft Launches PDF2ID Professional Suite 2026 - Workflow Automation Tools for Adobe® Creative Cloud® Users
summary: Recosoft Corporation has launched PDF2ID Professional Suite 2026, an updated version of its PDF conversion software designed to enhance workflow automation for Adobe Creative Cloud users. The suite includes PDF2ID Professional 2026, DecksMoveIn 2026, PDF2Office 2026, and PDF2Assets 2026, providing streamlined conversions for various document types. Key new features include full compatibility with Adobe InDesign 2026, footnote recovery, and enhanced PowerPoint and Keynote conversions, aiming to boost productivity for designers and marketing professionals.

title: Top Executives at Corning Unload Significant Shares in Major Stock Sale

TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates GLW as "Outperform," citing strong financial performance and a bullish outlook despite valuation concerns.

Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon emphasized that such drawdowns are common and shouldn't deter long-term investors, while Morgan Stanley CEO Ted Pick views short-term corrections as healthy market signs. This outlook comes after a strong rally attributed to tech earnings and easing U.S.-China tensions.

They view such a drawdown as a healthy development, allowing for reassessment after a period of extended rallies driven by AI enthusiasm and expected rate cuts. Major tech companies like Apple and Nvidia have reached record valuations, leading analysts to express concerns about overvalued equities.

title: Why Ford Cars Don't Have Apple CarPlay Ultra, According To CEO Jim Farley
