Williams, who retired earlier this year, was instrumental in developing the Apple Watch and architecting Apple's health and fitness strategy during his nearly three-decade career. His election will expand Disney's board to 11 members, effective from the 2026 annual meeting.

title: Former Apple COO Jeff Williams Nominated to Walt Disney Company Board of Directors
summary: The Walt Disney Company has nominated former Apple Chief Operating Officer Jeff Williams to its board of directors, increasing the board's size from 10 to 11 members. Williams, who retired from Apple in July 2025, will stand for election as an independent director at Disney's 2026 annual shareholder meeting. He previously held roles such as Head of Worldwide Procurement and VP of Operations at Apple, and was central to the launch of the first iPhone and the Apple Watch project.

title: A Triple-Leveraged Bet on Tech Giants: Examining the TQQQ ETF
summary: The ProShares UltraPro QQQ ETF (TQQQ) offers three times the daily return of the Nasdaq-100 Index, targeting leading technology companies. After recent volatility, TQQQ has shown renewed strength, with a year-to-date gain of 38.6%. Investors should be aware of the daily reset mechanism, which can cause long-term returns to diverge from simple triple leverage.

title: Apple gets a big price target hike, and Wells Fargo plants a big dealmaking flag
summary: Citi has raised its price target on Apple to $330 due to anticipated iPhone sales growth and promising AI developments, while Wells Fargo CEO Charlie Scharf aims to elevate the bank into a top-five player in Wall Street dealmaking. These updates highlight positive outlooks for both companies, based on new product cycles for Apple and strategic expansion for Wells Fargo.

title: 3 Reasons to Avoid PFBC and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: Preferred Bank (PFBC) has seen its stock rise by 11% over the past six months, in line with the S&P 500. However, analysts are cautious due to its net interest income growth slightly lagging the industry, a 74 basis point contraction in its net interest margin, and a decline in EPS and revenue over the last two years. The article suggests avoiding PFBC and instead seeking superior opportunities in other sectors.

title: Apple chip chief tells staff he’s not leaving 'anytime soon'
summary: Johny Srouji, Apple's chip chief, has assured his staff he is not leaving the company "anytime soon," following recent reports of his potential departure. Srouji, a senior vice president of hardware technologies, told his team directly that he loves his job and the company. Earlier reports indicated that CEO Tim Cook was working to retain Srouji, offering a substantial compensation package and increased responsibilities.

title: Costco (COST) Q4 Earnings: What To Expect
summary: Costco (NASDAQ:COST) is set to report its Q4 earnings this Thursday afternoon, with analysts expecting revenue growth of 7.9% year over year to $67.03 billion and adjusted earnings of $4.27 per share. Despite positive investor sentiment in the non-discretionary retail segment, Costco's shares are down 3.1% over the last month, heading into earnings with an average analyst price target of $1,057, compared to its current share price of $887.58. The company has missed Wall Street's revenue estimates three times in the last two years.

title: InterDigital (IDCC): Assessing Valuation After Legal Wins Boost Streaming Patent Revenue Prospects
summary: InterDigital (IDCC) has seen its valuation propelled by recent legal victories in Germany and Brazil regarding streaming patents, leading to significant share price growth. Despite a narrative fair value of $412 based on strong licensing agreements and recurring revenue, Simply Wall St's DCF model suggests a fair value of $70.67, indicating a potential overvaluation. Investors are weighing the impact of patent litigation wins, a reaffirmed dividend, and analyst targets against underlying cash flow strength and future growth prospects.

title: Billionaire Warren Buffett Offers 184 Billion Reasons for Investors to Be Fearful in the New Year
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has seen net stock selling for three consecutive years, totaling $183.53 billion, according to its cash flow statements. This signals a cautious approach from Buffett, who often advises being "fearful when others are greedy." The "Buffett indicator" for market valuation also sits at a historically high 225%, suggesting an overvalued market, which aligns with Buffett's selling activity.

title: Best Buy brings shoppers last-minute magic with savings, gifts and fast fulfillment
summary: Best Buy is offering last-minute holiday savings and fast fulfillment options for shoppers, including an Apple Sales Event, 3-Day Sales, and a Last-Minute Savings Event running until December 15th. The retailer also highlights gift ideas across various price points and provides multiple delivery and pickup options to ensure gifts arrive on time before Christmas. Customers can also trade in old tech for Best Buy e-Gift Cards.

title: The Apocalyptic Potential of the Netflix–Warner Bros. Deal
summary: This article discusses the acquisition of Warner Bros. Discovery by Netflix and its potential ramifications for the film industry, particularly cinematic exhibition. It highlights the concerns raised by this deal, contrasting it with a potential Paramount merger, and explores Netflix's historical aversion to traditional theatrical windows. The author also touches upon Warner Bros.' recent creative successes despite its financial struggles, making the acquisition high-stakes, and speculates on the future of filmmaking amidst increasing corporate consolidation.

title: Adobe Photoshop, Express, and Acrobat now available for free on ChatGPT
summary: Adobe is integrating features from Photoshop, Express, and Acrobat directly into ChatGPT for free, allowing users to perform image edits, create animations, and manage PDFs using natural language prompts. This integration aims to make Adobe's tools more accessible and provide a faster way for both new and pro users to make quick edits within ChatGPT, with options to seamlessly transition to the full web-based applications for advanced control. The new functionalities are available on ChatGPT desktop, web, and iOS, with Android support for Photoshop and Acrobat coming soon.

title: The Walt Disney Company Nominates Ex-Apple COO Jeff Williams To Board
summary: The Walt Disney Company has nominated Jeff Williams, former Chief Operating Officer of Apple Inc., to join its board as an independent director. Williams, who retired from Apple in 2025 after nearly three decades, is recognized for his contributions to Apple's supply chain, design team, and the development of the Apple Watch. This nomination aims to expand Disney's governance and blend creative storytelling with technical innovation.

title: Socket Mobile (NASDAQ: SCKT) launches XtremeScan v16e industrial iPhone 16e scanners
summary: Socket Mobile (NASDAQ: SCKT) has launched the XtremeScan v16e industrial barcode scanners, redesigned and optimized for the iPhone 16e. The new line features an improved ergonomic design, higher-capacity battery, optional pistol grip with enhanced durability, and integrated scanning engines, all while retaining IP67 rugged protection and full access to the iPhone camera and touchscreen. XtremeScan v16e devices are available for preorder now and will be distributed globally starting Q1 2026.

title: Cirrus Logic stock gets Buy rating reiterated by Stifel on auto haptics launch
summary: Stifel has reiterated a Buy rating and $150.00 price target on Cirrus Logic (NASDAQ:CRUS) following the company's entry into the automotive haptics market with its new CS40L5X series. This strategic move diversifies Cirrus Logic beyond the smartphone market, aligning with Stifel's thesis on the High-Performance Mixed-Signal segment as a key growth driver. The company also reported strong Q2 fiscal 2026 earnings, surpassing analyst expectations for EPS and revenue.

title: New Disney Board Nomination For Former Apple Executive
summary: The Walt Disney Company's Board of Directors has nominated former Apple executive Jeff Williams to stand for election as an independent director at the 2026 annual shareholders meeting. If approved, the board will expand to 11 members. Williams, who previously served as Apple's Chief Operating Officer, is lauded for his extensive experience in technology, global operations, and product design, which Disney believes will be invaluable for its continued focus on creative storytelling and innovation.

title: Best Buy offers deals, services for late holiday shoppers
summary: Best Buy is targeting last-minute holiday shoppers with a variety of deals, services, and extended policies. These include an Apple sales event, multi-day sales, Friday doorbusters, and flexible delivery and pickup options. The retailer is also offering price matching, extended return periods, gift idea pages, an AI gift finder, and in-store showcases to enhance the shopping experience.

title: Microsoft Stock Slips After Hours as AI Scrutiny Rises: What MSFT Investors Should Know Before the December 11 Open
summary: Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ: MSFT) experienced a slight dip on December 10, 2025, closing down 2.7% and trading marginally lower after hours, primarily due to increased regulatory scrutiny on AI and concerns over monetizing its substantial AI investments. This comes as state attorneys general warned tech companies about "delusional outputs" from AI chatbots and Microsoft announced $23 billion in new AI data center investments. Despite these near-term pressures, Wall Street analysts maintain a broadly bullish outlook on Microsoft's long-term prospects, with price targets suggesting significant upside, though some quantitative models show mixed signals and long-term caution on valuation.

title: JPMorgan Chase & Co. Reduces Stake in Host Hotels & Resorts Inc.
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. has significantly reduced its stake in Host Hotels & Resorts Inc. by 60.15%, selling over 44 million shares at $17.63 each. Despite this large reduction, the impact on JPMorgan's overall portfolio was minimal, decreasing its position by only 0.02%. Host Hotels & Resorts remains a leading REIT, considered modestly undervalued with strong growth potential, attracting other notable investors.

title: Getty Images suing the makers of popular AI art tool for allegedly stealing photos
summary: Getty Images has filed a lawsuit against Stability AI, the creator of the AI art tool Stable Diffusion, alleging copyright infringement. The stock image company claims Stability AI copied and processed millions of its images without obtaining proper licenses. This action highlights the growing tension between traditional media suppliers and AI art generators, as artists become concerned about their work being used for AI training without credit.

title: Big Tech to Congress: Listen to Taylor Swift and Go After Ticketmaster, Not Us
summary: Lobbyists for major technology companies capitalized on public outrage over Ticketmaster's handling of Taylor Swift concert tickets to deflect congressional antitrust scrutiny away from Big Tech. They argued that Congress should focus on clear monopolies like Ticketmaster, implying that existing antitrust laws are sufficient and that efforts to reform them to target tech giants are misguided. This strategy led to a Senate Judiciary Committee hearing focusing on Live Nation/Ticketmaster's monopolistic practices instead of Big Tech.

title: Google, Amex roll out anti-fraud tool
summary: Google and American Express have expanded their partnership to introduce a new security feature for Amex virtual card users in the U.S. This anti-fraud tool, initially launched last year with Capital One, replaces actual card numbers with unique virtual numbers during online purchases made via Chrome and Android apps, eliminating manual CVV entry and providing encrypted connections. Google plans to extend this feature to Visa and Mastercard virtual cards later this year.

title: Baidu stock surges after announcement of ChatGPT-style AI bot
summary: Baidu's stock surged after the company announced its intention to launch a ChatGPT-style AI chatbot called "Wenxin Yiyan" or "ERNIE Bot" in March. This strategic move highlights the ongoing AI race among tech giants, following Google's announcement of its own chatbot, Bard, and Microsoft's significant investment in OpenAI. Baidu's ERNIE Bot is based on a language model first developed in 2019 and is currently in its third iteration.

title: Reinventing search with a new AI-powered Microsoft Bing and Edge, your copilot for the web
summary: Microsoft unveiled a new AI-powered Bing search engine and Edge browser, aiming to reinvent web search by providing more complete answers, a chat experience, and content generation capabilities. These new tools are designed to act as an "AI copilot for the web," leveraging a next-generation OpenAI model (more powerful than ChatGPT) and Microsoft's proprietary Prometheus model. The update applies AI to the core search algorithm, resulting in a new user experience that integrates search, browsing, and chat.

title: C3 AI CEO on ChatGPT-Fueled Stock Jump
summary: C3.ai Inc. CEO Tom Siebel discusses the company's stock surge, which nearly doubled after the release of ChatGPT and C3.ai's new generative AI enterprise search product. Siebel highlights how generative AI will fundamentally change enterprise applications and simplify data analytics for customers, making C3.ai's offerings more accessible. Despite investor excitement, Siebel emphasizes the focus on product development and anticipates the company will become cash positive and profitable within five quarters on an adjusted basis, with plans to increase employment.

title: Absci Takes Its Generative AI Antibody Design Platform To Europe
summary: Absci is expanding its generative AI antibody design platform to Europe, establishing an Innovation Center in Zug, Switzerland, to leverage the region's talent pool and foster strategic partnerships. The company utilizes AI to design custom antibodies in silico, aiming to drastically reduce drug development times and costs for therapeutics, particularly in oncology. This strategic move is expected to accelerate the delivery of life-saving medicines to patients and transform the biopharma industry.

title: Generative AI, Explained
summary: This article explains generative AI, a rapidly evolving field using deep learning algorithms to create new and original content. It highlights the technology's history, starting with Google's Transformer model, and explores its wide range of current and future use cases across various industries such as content creation, healthcare, finance, and gaming. The piece concludes that generative AI is still in its infancy with vast potential to revolutionize many aspects of life and work.

title: Sonos CEO Patrick Spence on right to repair, spatial audio and those never-ending lawsuits
summary: Sonos CEO Patrick Spence discusses the company's new Era 100 and Era 300 speakers, focusing on the emergence of spatial audio and its mainstream adoption challenges. He also addresses Sonos' commitment to right-to-repair principles, its premium pricing strategy, the future of the smart home market, and ongoing lawsuits with Google.

title: The accelerating rise of automation: 5 top jobs that will be replaced by AI
summary: This article discusses the accelerating rise of automation and artificial intelligence, identifying five top jobs that are likely to be replaced by AI. It explores expert opinions and studies on the impact of AI on the job market and specific degrees at risk, while emphasizing that the full extent of AI's impact on employment is still uncertain.

title: Accenture is cutting 75 San Jose workers
summary: Accenture is cutting 75 employees based at Google's campus in North San Jose, appearing to be cutting contractors who worked for Google. This news comes amidst a wave of other major layoffs by tech companies including First Republic, Google, Lyft, and Meta Platforms.

title: Google announces US-Taiwan-Philippines cable with Chunghwa, Globe, and AT&T
summary: Google has announced plans for a new subsea cable system, TPU (Taiwan-Philippines-US), linking the US, Taiwan, and the Philippines, partnering with Chunghwa Telecom, Innove (Globe Group), and AT&T. This new cable, expected to be ready for service in 2025 with NEC as the supplier, will provide 260Tbps of capacity and offer an alternative route to Google's existing Apricot cable, enhancing resilience and capacity in the APAC region. Additionally, the article notes another subsea cable development, the EMC West system in the Middle East, being built by Center3 and ASN.

title: U.S. Supreme Court declines to hear bid to sue Reddit over child porn
summary: The U.S. Supreme Court has declined to hear a lawsuit attempting to hold Reddit Inc. liable for child pornography posted on its platform, upholding a lower court's decision that Reddit is shielded by Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act. The case explored the scope of a 2018 amendment, the Fight Online Sex Trafficking Act (FOSTA), which allows lawsuits if the claim involves child sex trafficking, but the court found Reddit did not "knowingly benefit" from such activity. This decision follows a similar sidestepping of Section 230 immunity in a separate case involving Google and YouTube.

title: Baidu Creates $140 Million Fund to Back ChatGPT-Like Startups
summary: Baidu Inc. has launched a 1 billion yuan ($140 million) fund to support Chinese startups developing generative AI, similar to ChatGPT services. This initiative aims to incubate projects built on Baidu's Ernie AI model, with individual deployments potentially reaching 10 million yuan. Venture capitalists like IDG Capital will assist in evaluating pitches and providing seed funding to promising founders.

title: Cisco debuts its Secure Service Edge offering and enhances app security
summary: Cisco Systems Inc. has unveiled a new Secure Service Edge (SSE) offering called Cisco Secure Access, designed to help enterprises securely connect edge resources with features like zero-trust network access. Alongside SSE, Cisco announced Multicloud Defense for protecting cloud service workloads and significant upgrades to Panoptica, its cloud-native security development platform. These introductions aim to simplify security processes, enhance performance, and provide comprehensive protection across various enterprise environments.

title: EPAM Announces Strategic Global Partnership with Google Cloud
summary: EPAM Systems, Inc. announced a strategic global partnership with Google Cloud to develop and deploy AI-first solutions for enterprise digital transformation. This enhanced collaboration will leverage Google Cloud's AI and ML capabilities with EPAM's engineering expertise to deliver innovative cloud-enabled AI, data modernization, and analytics solutions across various industry verticals. The partnership aims to help clients accelerate their transformations into AI-enabled businesses and drive growth.

title: SAIC wins $1.3B Treasury cloud contract
summary: Science Applications International Corp. (SAIC) has been awarded a $1.3 billion contract by the Department of the Treasury for cloud modernization. Under the T-Cloud contract, SAIC will act as a cloud broker, managing services from major cloud providers like Amazon, Google, IBM, Microsoft, and Oracle, supporting the Treasury's adoption of a multi-cloud environment. The contract, with a seven-year performance period, aims to enable rapid and secure adoption of modern cloud solutions and centralize management to reduce costs and duplicative efforts.

title: Baidu: Why It’s One Of The Best Chinese Stocks To Own
summary: Baidu is presented as a strong opportunity among Chinese stocks despite current market underperformance. The article highlights its strengthening financials, particularly in ads and cloud, and its bullish innovation in AI with Ernie Bot and Apollo Go. Analyst upgrades and a significant price target increase by Morgan Stanley reinforce its potential for substantial upside.

title: Snowflake Native App Framework Now Available to Developers on AWS
summary: Snowflake has announced the public preview of its Native App Framework on AWS, allowing developers to build and test Snowflake Native Apps directly within their accounts. This framework enables the creation of applications that run close to the data, addressing issues of data silos and offering enhanced security by eliminating the need to move sensitive data. Distribution and monetization capabilities for these apps are expected later this year on AWS, with an array of existing applications already available on Snowflake Marketplace.

title: Nuclear power to reduce Microsoft data centre carbon footprint
summary: Microsoft has signed a "landmark" hourly energy-matching agreement with Constellation Energy Corporation to significantly reduce the carbon footprint of its data center in Boydton, Virginia, bringing it closer to 100% carbon-free operation. The deal leverages nuclear power's environmental attributes, complementing existing wind and solar purchases, and utilizes Constellation's hourly carbon-free energy matching platform for tracking. This collaboration aims to revolutionize clean energy procurement by ensuring real-time matching of electricity needs with regional, clean, carbon-free sources, addressing limitations of traditional annualised renewable energy certificates.

title: AI Startup Typeface Raises $100 Million From Salesforce, GV
summary: Typeface Inc., an AI startup specializing in content creation services for businesses, has successfully raised $100 million in funding from investors including Salesforce Ventures and Alphabet’s GV. This investment values Typeface at $1 billion and increases its total fundraising to $165 million, reflecting growing investor interest in generative AI technologies.

title: OUTFRONT Media Wins Gold & Bronze Lion in Cannes
summary: OUTFRONT Media's XLabs won a Gold Lion for Digital Craft - Metaverse/New Realities and a Bronze Lion for Entertainment - Music-Led Brand Experience at the Cannes Lions 70th International Festival of Creativity. These awards recognize their partnership activation with Google and Gorillaz, which included transforming Times Square into a live stage for a virtual Gorillaz performance using augmented reality. The company emphasizes the importance of creativity in advertising and leverages its XLabs and STUDIOS teams to push creative boundaries in out-of-home media.

title: An End to Regulatory Risk in China’s Internet Sector
summary: Recent meetings between Premier Li Qiang and heads of major Chinese internet companies signal an end to a period of regulatory crackdown in the sector, turning a significant investor headwind into a tailwind. This shift, marked by commitments to transparency and growth support, is seen as paving the way for more sustainable development in China’s internet economy. Investors are looking to capture this potential growth through instruments like the KraneShares CSI China Internet ETF (KWEB), which tracks key Chinese tech companies.

title: CFO Corner: Ascent Industries’ Bill Steckel
summary: Bill Steckel, CFO of Ascent Industries, discusses how the CFO role has evolved, emphasizing the impact of information and data analytics, talent competition, and ESG considerations. He highlights the differences in the CFO role across industries and offers advice for aspiring finance professionals, stressing the importance of interpersonal and communication skills. Steckel also touches on the potential impact of AI and his concerns, such as talent shortages and global conflicts.

title: AI as an investment theme
summary: The article discusses Artificial Intelligence (AI) as a significant investment theme due to its potential to revolutionize industries and create new opportunities. It highlights the booming AI sector, strong investor interest, and the impact of AI on technology stocks and the broader market. The author also touches upon various ways to invest in AI, including specific ETFs, and emphasizes the importance of careful research despite the vast potential.

title: BlackRock Inc. Acquires Additional Shares in Mercury Systems Inc.
summary: BlackRock Inc. has increased its stake in Mercury Systems Inc. by acquiring an additional 100,009 shares, bringing its total holdings to 5,878,104 shares. This transaction highlights BlackRock's confidence in the aerospace and defense company, which is considered undervalued by GuruFocus's GF Valuation despite recent stock declines. Mercury Systems Inc. demonstrates good outperformance potential with a strong GF Score, profitability, and growth rank, but also presents some financial risks.

title: Dropbox review: Still the best at syncing and sharing
summary: This PCWorld review reaffirms Dropbox's position as a top choice for fast, reliable file synchronization and sharing, despite its limited free storage and lack of intermediate subscription tiers. While it excels in its core functionality and offers business-oriented features, its pricing model lacks options between the free 2GB and the paid 2TB. The article highlights its strengths for collaborative file access and its backup capabilities.

title: Google Cloud, HCA team up to deploy AI in the emergency department
summary: HCA Healthcare is expanding its partnership with Google Cloud and Augmedix to deploy generative AI tools in emergency departments, aiming to improve documentation efficiency and allow clinicians more time for patient care. Following a successful pilot program in four hospitals, HCA is considering wider implementation of Google's generative AI, and also exploring the use of Google's medical large language model, Med-PaLM 2, for complex medical queries. The initiative focuses on enhancing workflows and caregiver support while acknowledging the need for careful ethical deployment and rigorous quality assessment of AI in healthcare.

title: Ginkgo Bioworks and Google Cloud Partner to Build Next Generation AI Platform for Biological Engineering and Biosecurity
summary: Ginkgo Bioworks and Google Cloud have announced a five-year strategic partnership to develop an AI platform for biological engineering and biosecurity. Ginkgo will leverage Google Cloud's Vertex AI and computational infrastructure to build new large language models across genomics, protein function, and synthetic biology, with Google Cloud providing funding and positioning Ginkgo as a key partner in developing foundation models for life sciences. This collaboration aims to accelerate innovation in areas like drug discovery, agriculture, manufacturing, and biosecurity, and will be discussed further at Google Cloud Next.

title: SAP and Google Cloud Enhance Open Data Cloud With New Generative AI Solutions for Enterprises
summary: SAP and Google Cloud announced an expanded partnership to integrate generative AI solutions within their open data cloud. This collaboration will leverage SAP Datasphere and Google Cloud’s Vertex AI to create industry-specific solutions, starting with automotive, and enhance sustainability performance for enterprises. The partnership aims to provide customers with powerful new tools to improve business insights, analysis, and decision-making through responsible and secure AI deployment.

title: Bandwidth Partners with Google and Cognigy to Launch AIBridge, Integrating Artificial Intelligence with Contact Centers Using Maestro
summary: Bandwidth has announced a partnership with Google and Cognigy to launch AIBridge, a new capability within its Maestro platform. AIBridge enables enterprises to deploy voice-based AI tools to their contact centers, allowing for faster and more efficient call resolution in the communications cloud without direct agent intervention. This integration is designed to improve customer experience, increase agent satisfaction, and significantly reduce contact center operating costs by leveraging conversational AI from partners like Cognigy.AI and Google Cloud's Dialogflow.

title: Breakthrough and Enovis (TM) Announce Official Partnership, Empowering Private Practice Healthcare to Help Improve Quality of Care While Increasing Profitability
summary: Breakthrough, a leader in conservative care marketing solutions, and Enovis™ Corporation, a pioneer in innovative rehabilitation technologies, have announced an official partnership. This collaboration aims to empower private practice healthcare providers to improve patient care quality and increase profitability by promoting innovative therapeutic technologies directly to patients through data-driven marketing campaigns. The partnership enables clinics to confidently adopt new technologies, like laser therapy, by offering solutions to overcome declining insurance reimbursements through cash-based services.

title: OpenAI’s Sam Altman tells Salesforce’s Marc Benioff that AI ‘hallucinations’ are more feature than bug
summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman suggested to Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff that AI "hallucinations" should be seen as a feature, not a bug, emphasizing their creative potential. This discussion took place at the Dreamforce conference where Salesforce rolled out new AI products, integrating with platforms like Google Workspace. Altman's perspective highlights a focus on generative AI's creative capabilities over its strict adherence to factual accuracy.

title: Arm climbs 25% in Nasdaq debut after pricing IPO at $51 a share
summary: Arm Holdings saw its stock jump nearly 25% on its first day of trading on the Nasdaq after pricing its IPO at $51 per share, valuing the company at almost $60 billion. SoftBank, which took Arm private in 2016, retains about 90% of the company's outstanding shares. Despite its high valuation relative to its current growth, Arm's unique royalty-based business model, including revenue from decades-old designs, and its strategic importance in AI and chip design, are key factors in investor interest.

title: Manyika appointed to Airbnb board
summary: Google's Research, Technology and Society senior vice-president, James Manyika, a Zimbabwean-born businessman, has been appointed to the board of American online homestay firm, Airbnb Inc., effective immediately. Manyika, an expert in AI and technology's impact on society, will help Airbnb leverage artificial intelligence and joins eight other board members at the US$91.96 billion valued company. His extensive background includes roles at McKinsey & Company, advising the White House, and serving on various influential boards, bringing significant expertise in technology, economy, and global trends to Airbnb.

title: Indian auto insurance technology start-up Roadzen listed on Nasdaq
summary: Indian auto insurance technology start-up Roadzen has listed on Nasdaq, with its ordinary shares trading under the symbol "RDZN" and warrants under "RDZNW." The company, powered by artificial intelligence, achieved a pre-money equity value of $683 million and aims to lead the transformation of the auto insurance market through AI, mobility, and insurance. Roadzen's CEO, Rohan Malhotra, emphasizes the company's global vision and its commitment to building innovative AI technology for markets worldwide.

title: Apple is ordered to face Apple Pay antitrust lawsuit
summary: Apple has been ordered to face a private antitrust lawsuit brought by payment card issuers. The lawsuit alleges that Apple exerts a 100% monopoly over the domestic market for tap-and-pay wallets on its devices, forcing banks to pay excessive fees and hindering competition and innovation. A U.S. District Judge dismissed a "tying" claim but ruled that plaintiffs could proceed with their claim that Apple violated federal antitrust law.

title: Supermicro At 30: From Designing AI Chips To Selling AI Systems
summary: Supermicro, founded 30 years ago, began with Charles Liang's vision to improve server motherboards and power supplies after working on an AI processor design. The company has grown into a $10 billion systems business with global manufacturing facilities and aims for $20 billion in the next three years, continuously expanding its operations and exploring new factory locations.

title: Stanford’s AI transparency index shows foundational models are shrouded in secrecy
summary: A Stanford University report reveals that most popular foundational AI models from companies like OpenAI, Google, and Meta lack transparency regarding their development and societal impact. Meta's Llama 2 topped the transparency index, while OpenAI's GPT-4 scored lower despite extensive public information from partners, indicating that open-source models generally lead in transparency. The researchers highlight the need for greater disclosure to inform policymakers and foster trust in AI, especially as regulations like the EU's Artificial Intelligence Act emerge.

title: Enphase Energy (NASDAQ: ENPH) stock down 22% - higher interest rates kill installations
summary: Enphase Energy (NASDAQ: ENPH) stock dropped 22% due to slowing installations, a trend exacerbated by higher interest rates impacting the attractiveness of high-capital-cost solar energy solutions. The slowdown, following similar results from SolarEdge Technologies, highlights an underlying problem where increased financing costs make solar installations less appealing to buyers, affecting sales and revenues across the sector. This situation is seen as damaging to Enphase's stock price as it undermines previous expectations of swift growth.

title: MOAT: History May Not Repeat Itself (BATS:MOAT)
summary: The VanEck Morningstar Wide Moat ETF (MOAT) has a strong historical track record and reasonable fees but is significantly underweight in big tech. Given a bullish view on big tech, the author suggests MOAT may underperform the S&P 500 going forward. The article provides an overview of the ETF's strategy and the author's financial disclosures.

title: Hartford Funds Seeks to Let $4.1B Fund Make More Concentrated Investments
summary: Hartford Funds is proposing to reclassify its $4.1 billion Growth Opportunities Fund as a non-diversified investment, which would allow it to make more concentrated investments. This change, if approved by shareholders, would increase the fund's risk profile and volatility, prompting plan sponsors and fiduciaries to re-evaluate their inclusion of the fund in retirement lineups. The reclassification comes as allocations to a few mega-cap tech stocks have pushed some diversified funds to exceed investment thresholds.

title: Sonos v. Google : A Decision Based on Ignorance of Patent Law That Must Be Overturned
summary: This article argues that a district court's decision in the Sonos v. Google patent litigation, which found Sonos's patents unenforceable due to laches because Sonos filed a continuation, demonstrates a fundamental misunderstanding of patent law. The author asserts that filing a continuation is a right and that the ruling, which also controversially suggested "fraud on the court" and "new matter," is legally unsound and must be overturned by the Federal Circuit to prevent significant disruption to patent practice. The piece also highlights the perceived double standard where patent owner delays are sanctioned, but alleged "efficient infringement" strategies by well-funded defendants are not.

title: Diamond Hill Capital Reduces Stake in Alphabet Inc.
summary: Diamond Hill Capital Management Inc. reduced its stake in Alphabet Inc. Class A (GOOGL) by 8,431 shares. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates GOOGL as "Outperform" due to its strong financial performance and strategic investments in AI and cloud services, despite risks from high valuation and increased costs. Alphabet Inc. Class A has shown a YTD price performance of 50.68% and has a current market cap of $3351.9B.

title: Exclusive: Two tech firms sign office leases at same S.F. location — and it’s not downtown
summary: Snap Inc. and Supercell have signed new office leases at Levi's Plaza in San Francisco's northern waterfront, moving away from downtown. This move reflects a broader trend of tech companies seeking amenity-rich, campus environments with green spaces over traditional downtown skyscrapers, despite significant discounts available there. The leases contribute to a reported 140,000 square feet of new leases and renewals in Jamestown's northern waterfront properties.

title: First Pacific Advisors LLC Reduces Stake in Alphabet
summary: First Pacific Advisors LLC, managed by Richard Atwood, reduced its stake in Alphabet Inc. Class C (GOOG) by 95,179 shares. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates GOOG as "Outperform" due to its strong financial performance, growth in AI and cloud services, and solid balance sheet, despite a high valuation. The article also provides key financial metrics for Alphabet.

title: 3 Compelling Cloud Storage Stocks to Send Your Portfolio Higher
summary: This article identifies three compelling cloud storage stocks: Alphabet (GOOGL), Dropbox (DBX), and Shopify (SHOP). It highlights Alphabet's strong Google Cloud growth and its dominant Google Services. Dropbox is discussed for its collaboration with Nvidia on generative AI and its potential to convert a large base of free users to paying subscribers. Shopify is included not as a pure-play cloud storage company, but because its successful e-commerce platform relies heavily on Google Cloud infrastructure and its recent financial performance has been strong.

title: 7 Stocks That Your Grandchildren Will Be Glad You Bought for Them
summary: This article suggests seven high-quality stocks to buy and hold for grandchildren as a long-term investment and a way to teach them about personal finance. The selected stocks, including Automatic Data Processing, Broadcom, Alphabet, and UnitedHealth Group, are chosen for their strong earnings, dividend growth, and potential for market-beating returns over several decades. The author emphasizes that these gifts could lead to substantial wealth and financial success for future generations.

title: Why Investors Should Keep An Eye on Small-Cap Stocks
summary: This article discusses how the increasing concentration of market-cap-weighted indexes, particularly driven by large-cap tech stocks, is creating historical levels of concentration. It explores the implications for the size premium, suggesting that higher market concentration leads to increased expected returns for small-cap stocks due to capital misallocation and reduced investor demand for smaller firms, making them an attractive area for investors.

title: Microsoft Annual Shareholders Meeting 2023
summary: The 2023 Microsoft Annual Shareholders Meeting featured discussions on record financial results for FY23, strategic investments in AI, and responsible technology development. Key executives, including Satya Nadella, Amy Hood, and Brad Smith, addressed topics ranging from AI integration across product lines and revenue generation plans to safeguards against AI misuse, partnerships, and commitments to privacy and social responsibility. The meeting also covered the election of directors and various shareholder proposals.

title: Just 3 of the "Magnificent Seven" Have Outperformed the S&P 500 Since 2022. Here's the One I'd Buy for 2024 and 2025.
summary: This article analyzes the performance of the "Magnificent Seven" tech stocks against the S&P 500 since 2022. It identifies Nvidia, Microsoft, and Apple as the only three that have outperformed the S&P 500. The author argues that Alphabet, despite underperforming recently, is the best buy for 2024 and 2025 due to its valuation, potential in digital advertising, and cloud segment growth.

title: Google, AES, others to create marketplace for 24/7 hourly renewable energy certificates
summary: Google, AES, Microsoft, and Constellation have partnered with LevelTen Energy to create a marketplace for "granular certificates," a new type of energy attribute certificate that tracks renewable energy generation on an hourly, location-specific basis. This initiative aims to provide more accurate signals for renewable energy development and help corporate and utility buyers meet 24/7 clean energy goals. The platform is expected to launch next year, offering both forward and spot markets for these certificates.

title: The Cheap Trick Alphabet Is Using To Boost Its Share Price
summary: Alphabet's 20-for-1 stock split, following similar moves by Apple and Tesla, is unlikely to fundamentally change the company's valuation but aims to make shares more accessible to smaller investors and potentially gain entry into the Dow Jones Industrial Average. While some tech giants saw significant share price boosts post-split, Alphabet's future success might be tempered by changing market conditions. The article suggests Amazon could be the next tech giant to undertake a similar split to boost its stock.

title: Google's AI Spin-Off Isomorphic Labs Strikes Big Pharma Deals, Paving the Way for Future of Drug Discovery
summary: Isomorphic Labs, an AI spin-off of Alphabet's DeepMind, has secured partnerships with Eli Lilly And Co and Novartis AG, totaling approximately $3 billion. These collaborations aim to leverage AI, specifically AlphaFold 2 technology, for new drug discovery and development. The financial agreements include significant upfront payments and performance-based milestones, highlighting the growing role of AI in the pharmaceutical industry.

title: Applied Materials Collaborating with Google to Advance Next-Generation AR Computing Platforms
summary: Applied Materials announced a collaboration with Google to advance next-generation augmented reality (AR) computing platforms. This partnership aims to combine Applied Materials' expertise in materials engineering with Google's platforms, products, and services to develop lightweight visual display systems for AR experiences. The companies plan to accelerate the development of future AR products, applications, and services.

title: Specialty Insurer RLI Ranks Among Best Places to Work: Glassdoor
summary: RLI Corp., a specialty insurer based in Peoria, Illinois, has been recognized by Glassdoor as one of the best places to work in 2024, ranking 27th among large U.S. companies. RLI is the only insurance company on Glassdoor's list this year, a testament to its unique ownership culture and employee empowerment, according to CEO Craig Kliethermes. This recognition is attributed to positive employee feedback on Glassdoor and the company's long-standing profitability, supported by its employee stock ownership program and incentive bonus plans.

title: Jabil announces collaboration with Fintech Leader Revolut
summary: Jabil Inc. announced its ongoing collaboration with Revolut, a digital banking pioneer, to support the neobank's growth and global expansion in merchant acquiring. Jabil provides custom, pre-certified Point-of-Sale (POS) hardware platforms, including the Revolut Reader, which enables merchants to accept various in-store and on-the-go payments. The partnership highlights Jabil's role in accelerating market entry and providing comprehensive product design, development, and manufacturing solutions for Revolut's innovative payment solutions.

title: Six Flags Gets Seriously Digital with ‘Largest’ Tech Alliance in Theme Park Industry
summary: Six Flags Entertainment Corp. has formed the "largest digital alliance in the theme park industry" with major tech companies like Google, HCL Tech, Dell, Snowflake, Fueled, and Pure Imagination Studios. This partnership aims to introduce unparalleled immersive and interactive elements across its parks, enhancing guest experiences from planning to post-visit engagement through AI-driven personalization and potentially bringing parks into the metaverse. The initiative focuses on accelerating innovation and revolutionizing the theme park industry by leveraging cutting-edge technology.

title: Community Health Systems Completes Data Migration and Implements New Generative AI Innovations with Google Cloud
summary: Community Health Systems (CHS) has completed its migration to a FHIR-based clinical data platform leveraging Google Cloud, enhancing data centralization and interoperability. This move enables CHS to implement new generative AI innovations using Google Cloud technologies to improve administrative efficiencies, streamline clinical workflows, and ultimately enhance patient experiences across its 71 affiliated hospitals. The partnership aims to provide real-time insights and automate tasks, allowing healthcare professionals to focus more on patient interaction.

title: Vishay Unveils New High-Speed Photodiode for Wearable Devices
summary: Vishay Intertechnology has expanded its optoelectronics portfolio with the VEMD2074, a new high-speed silicon PIN photodiode designed for wearable devices. This photodiode offers improved visible light sensitivity, low capacitance, and quick switching times, making it ideal for accurate signal detection in applications like pulse oximetry and optical heart rate detection. Its small size, flexibility in sensor placement, and cost-effectiveness facilitate integration into compact and price-sensitive products such as smartwatches and earbuds.

title: Motorola Solutions and Google partner on safety and security
summary: Motorola Solutions and Google Cloud have announced a multi-year collaboration focused on enhancing cloud solutions within Motorola Solutions’ safety and security technologies. This partnership will leverage Google Cloud's infrastructure for developing assistive intelligence, video content delivery, mapping, and AI capabilities to tackle real-world safety challenges. The initiative aims to improve public safety and enterprise security outcomes through advanced cloud security software like Avigilon Alta.

title: Google joins coalition to label AI-generated content
summary: Google has joined the Coalition for Content Provenance and Authenticity (C2PA), a standard for labeling digital content to indicate its origin and creation methods, alongside Microsoft, Meta, and Adobe. This move is significant given Google's market share with Android and YouTube, aiming to combat misinformation by making AI-generated content more transparent. While the C2PA aims for widespread adoption to make unlabeled content stand out, critics question its tamper-proof nature, suggesting that bad actors could strip or swap metadata, and it may not fully address the issue of malicious misinformation.

title: Silicon Valley Has a Harvard Problem
summary: The article argues that Silicon Valley, much like elite universities, suffers from a lack of authentic belief and moral courage among its leadership, leading to a managerial class primarily focused on self-preservation and avoidance of controversy. Authors Alexander C. Karp and Nicholas W. Zamiska connect this issue to the recent congressional testimony of university presidents, suggesting a broader cultural problem where a fear of offending stifles critical thinking and engagement with significant moral questions. They contend that this vacuum leaves major tech companies without a clear sense of purpose beyond self-interest, making them vulnerable to external agendas.

title: Akamai extends its edge-computing platform as it looks to challenge AWS, Azure and GCP
summary: Akamai has launched its Gecko "Generalized Edge Compute" platform, expanding its cloud-computing network with 10 new regions in Q1 and another 75 throughout the year. This initiative aims to bring compute capacity closer to users, reducing latency and enabling new use cases, directly challenging major cloud providers like AWS, Azure, and GCP. The company plans to open hundreds of small regions in the coming years and integrate its container service and automated workload platform.

title: Navitas Powers Samsung Galaxy S24 with Integrated AI
summary: Navitas Semiconductor announced that its GaNFast™ power ICs are used in Samsung’s 25W “Super-Fast Charging” (SFC) for the new AI-enhanced Galaxy S24 smartphone. This technology enables a compact and efficient charger that delivers a 50% charge to the phone's battery in just 30 minutes, while also being compatible with other Samsung devices. The GaNFast™ technology allows for a 30% size reduction compared to conventional charger designs and a 75% reduction in power consumption during sleep mode.

title: DigitalOcean beats expectations under the helm of new CEO Paddy Srinivasan
summary: DigitalOcean Holdings Inc. exceeded earnings and revenue expectations for the last quarter and provided optimistic guidance for the current quarter, leading to a stock surge. The company, under new CEO Paddy Srinivasan, is strategically focusing on AI solutions for small businesses, utilizing its Paperspace platform to offer Nvidia H100 GPUs, and demonstrating strong growth in its annual revenue run rate and average revenue per customer. Despite a slowdown in growth in the final quarter, analysts believe AI will be a key strategy for rekindling growth under the new leadership.

title: Collective Audience CEO and Chairman Discuss the Rapidly Evolving AdTech Industry in Interview by Veteran Broadcaster, Jane King, at Nasdaq MarketSite
summary: Collective Audience CEO Peter Bordes and Chairman Joe Zawadzki were interviewed at Nasdaq MarketSite, discussing growth opportunities in the AdTech market. They detailed Collective Audience's strategy to address market inefficiencies through an open digital advertising ecosystem and a "rising tide, building blocks" model involving acquisitions and joint ventures to drive exponential growth and shareholder value.

title: Tap Into China AI Boom With This ETF
summary: China is a major player in the global artificial intelligence (AI) landscape, offering significant investment opportunities beyond U.S. domestic stocks. The KraneShares Hang Seng TECH Index ETF (KTEC) provides U.S. investors with an avenue to access China AI plays, with key holdings like Baidu and Kingsoft Office driving its AI credentials. These companies are integrating AI into their products and services, signaling potential for substantial growth in the burgeoning AI market.

title: Unlocking The Advertising Power of YouTube
summary: This article discusses the growing importance of YouTube Shorts in the advertising landscape, driven by the increasing consumer preference for short-form video content. It highlights how Comscore's enhanced Campaign Ratings, integrated with YouTube, provides advertisers with comprehensive cross-platform insights to measure campaign impact effectively across various YouTube inventories, including Shorts. The piece emphasizes the shift in retail media towards e-commerce driving content and the significant role AI plays in democratizing access to innovation in this space.

title: Alphabet is the bargain stock among the ‘Magnificent Seven’
summary: Alphabet, Google's holding company, is highlighted as a compelling investment opportunity among the "Magnificent Seven" tech stocks due to its valuation. Its stock trades at a lower price/earnings valuation than the S&P 500, positioning it as a bargain compared to its peers and the broader market. This situation is likened to the opportunity presented by Meta's stock after its 2022 decline.

title: Equinix Announces Leadership Succession Plans: CEO to Move to Executive Chair and Google Cloud Exec Selected as Next CEO
summary: Equinix announced a leadership transition plan where current President and CEO Charles Meyers will become Executive Chairman in late Q2 2024. Adaire Fox-Martin, Google Cloud's Go-to-Market President, will take over as the new President and CEO. Peter Van Camp, the current Executive Chairman, will move to an advisory role to the Board.

title: Equinix hires Google Cloud executive as CEO
summary: Equinix (EQIX.O) has named Adaire Fox-Martin, a Google Cloud executive, as its new CEO, effective late next quarter. Fox-Martin, who has been an Equinix board member since 2020, will succeed current CEO Charles Meyers, who will transition to executive chair. The data center operator recently forecast optimistic adjusted core earnings, driven by anticipation of steady client spending on its data centers due to increased artificial intelligence technology integration.

title: Adaire Fox-Martin to become Equinix President and CEO
summary: Equinix, Inc. announced a leadership transition effective late Q2 2024, naming Adaire Fox-Martin as its new President and CEO. Charles Meyers will transition to Executive Chairman, and Peter Van Camp will become a Special Advisor to the Board. Fox-Martin brings over 25 years of technology experience, including senior roles at Google Cloud, SAP, and Oracle.

title: Nasdaq listing is a strategic move aimed at bringing value to Noventiq: CEO Hervé Tessler
summary: Noventiq CEO Hervé Tessler discusses the company's strategic move to list on Nasdaq from the London Stock Exchange, highlighting the benefits of increased access to capital and enhanced brand prestige. He emphasizes Noventiq's strong presence in emerging markets, its partnerships with tech giants like Microsoft and AWS, and its focus on digital transformation, cybersecurity, and AI solutions. Tessler also addresses challenges like navigating diverse global regulations and the imperative for continuous innovation in the rapidly evolving technology sector.

title: Meta Bows Down to EU Regulations After Apple And Google, Cut Subscription Prices for Ad-Free Facebook and Instagram
summary: Meta Platforms has significantly reduced the subscription fee for its ad-free Facebook and Instagram services in Europe, lowering the monthly cost to 5.99 euros from 9.99 euros. This move addresses concerns from privacy and antitrust regulators and comes as a response to the EU's Digital Markets Act (DMA). The company aims to find a middle ground amidst EU privacy laws and the DMA's stipulations, following similar concessions by Google and Apple.

title: Microsoft, Google, Nucor partner on initiative to spur emerging 24/7 clean power technologies
summary: Microsoft, Google, and Nucor have launched the Advanced Clean Electricity initiative to accelerate the development and deployment of reliable, low- or zero-carbon electricity generation technologies like advanced nuclear, next-generation geothermal, and long-duration energy storage. The initiative aims for widespread commercial deployment by the early 2030s and aggregates the three companies' demand for clean electricity to spur first-of-a-kind and early commercial projects. Projects must be located in the U.S., with a preference for the PJM region, and meet specific evaluation criteria, including a potential capacity factor above 50% and project capacity above 50 MW.

title: Communication Services Stocks: Advertising Continues to Rule
summary: Advertising continues to be the dominant force in the communication services sector, with Alphabet and Meta Platforms leading the market. While traditional TV ad revenue is declining, online digital advertising is growing significantly, and streaming platforms are attracting more ad spending. The article highlights Warner Bros. Discovery, Crown Castle, and Comcast as top picks in the sector.

title: Esports Investing: Opportunities & Strategies
summary: Esports is a rapidly growing industry with significant investment opportunities despite its relative newness. Investors can gain exposure through companies involved in game development, streaming platforms, hardware/software manufacturing, or through dedicated esports ETFs. While growth prospects are strong, investors should be prepared for volatility and perform thorough due diligence.

title: Google parent Alphabet may buy Cambridge-based HubSpot, report says
summary: Alphabet Inc., Google's parent company, is reportedly considering an offer to acquire HubSpot Inc., a Cambridge-based marketing technology firm. This potential acquisition would involve one of the world's largest tech companies buying one of Massachusetts' largest public companies by revenue. The report, citing individuals familiar with the matter, was published by Reuters on Thursday.

title: Report: Google parent Alphabet may buy HubSpot
summary: A report indicates that Google's parent company, Alphabet, may be considering an acquisition of marketing tech firm HubSpot Inc. This is not the first time HubSpot has reportedly attracted interest from a major tech company.

title: Apple Signs Deal For AI Training Data from Image Service Shutterstock
summary: Apple has signed a deal worth between $25 million and $50 million with Shutterstock to access its vast archive of images, video, and music for training AI systems. This move indicates Apple's strategic intent to develop its own AI models, rather than relying solely on existing solutions. The deal highlights Apple's characteristic approach to adhere to rules and protect user privacy, contrasting with some competitors' controversial methods of data acquisition.

title: Adobe Is Buying Videos for $3 Per Minute to Build AI Model
summary: Adobe (ADBE) is actively procuring videos to develop its artificial intelligence text-to-video generator, aiming to compete with technologies like OpenAI's Sora. The company is offering artists $120 to submit videos depicting everyday actions and emotions for AI training purposes. This initiative highlights Adobe's strategy to enhance its AI capabilities in the face of competitive pressure.

title: D-Wave Quantum Computer: Commercial QC Pioneer [2024]
summary: This article chronicles the history and technological advancements of D-Wave Systems, recognized as the world’s first commercial quantum computer startup. It details D-Wave's quantum annealing approach, the evolution of its quantum machines from D-Wave One to Advantage2, and its cloud services. The article also addresses the ongoing debate regarding whether D-Wave's annealing machines are truly quantum computers.

title: Carrier Ventures invests in Strategic Thermal Labs for data center liquid cooling solution
summary: Carrier Ventures is investing in Strategic Thermal Labs (STL) to develop direct-to-chip liquid cooling solutions for data centers. This investment aligns with Carrier's 2030 ESG goal to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and addresses the increasing demand for efficient cooling in high-density computing environments driven by AI. Carrier will also receive a board seat and exclusivity for the developed solution.

title: Alphabet issues first-ever dividend, $70 billion buyback
summary: Alphabet announced its first-ever dividend of 20 cents per share and a new $70 billion share repurchase program. This news, released alongside better-than-expected first-quarter earnings, drove the Google parent's shares up 15%. Alphabet's move follows Meta's initiation of a dividend, indicating a trend of increased maturity signals from large-cap tech companies.

title: Sundar Pichai confirms Alphabet Inc. is going to issue first-ever dividend, $70 billion buyback - Hindustan Times
summary: Alphabet Inc., Google's parent company, announced its first-ever cash dividend of 20 cents per share and a new $70 billion stock repurchase program following strong Q1 2024 earnings. CEO Sundar Pichai highlighted robust performance from Search, YouTube, and Cloud, attributing success to the "Gemini era" and AI leadership. This move, similar to Meta's recent dividend, signals tech industry maturity and has been positively received by investors.

title: How to Buy Alphabet (Google) Stock Online in 2025
summary: This article provides a comprehensive guide on how to buy Alphabet (Google) stock online in 2025, detailing steps, top brokers, and reasons to invest in the company. It covers Google's diverse services, its financial performance, business strategy, and historical stock information, emphasizing its growth and expansion into new technologies like AI. The article also addresses common FAQs regarding Alphabet stock.

title: After Earnings, Is Meta Stock a Buy, a Sell, or Fairly Valued?
summary: Morningstar assessed Meta Platforms' stock following its Q1 earnings report, maintaining a "Wide" economic moat rating but deeming the stock overvalued with a 2-star rating and a $400 fair value estimate. The article highlights Meta's strong core advertising business, driven by AI investments, but also points out the high uncertainty due to speculative AI initiatives and competition. Investors are advised to be comfortable with Meta's aggressive investment in new technologies, as regulatory risks and dependence on online advertising remain significant concerns.

title: Alphabet's First Dividend: What You Need to Know
summary: Alphabet has announced its first-ever quarterly dividend of $0.20 per share, payable on June 17 to shareholders of record as of June 10. While the initial dividend yield will be modest at approximately 0.5%, the company also authorized $70 billion in share repurchases. This move makes Alphabet one of the eight largest US companies by market capitalization to pay a quarterly dividend, alongside a significant share repurchase program.

title: AEP faces 15 GW of new load, driven by Amazon, Google, other data centers: interim CEO Fowke
summary: American Electric Power (AEP) is facing a substantial increase in electricity demand, primarily driven by data centers from companies like Amazon and Google, projected to reach 15 GW by 2030. Interim CEO Ben Fowke noted this load growth is sparking discussions in Ohio about utilities potentially owning power plants again and highlighted AEP's intent to sue the EPA over new environmental regulations. The company anticipates requiring significant capital investments in transmission and generation to meet this rising demand while keeping rates affordable.

title: Up 7% This Year, Will EOG’s Gains Continue Following Q1 Results?
summary: EOG Resources is set to announce its Q1 results, with expectations of revenues beating but earnings falling short of market expectations. The company has shown strong gains historically and has a strategy focused on organic growth, low breakeven costs, and returning capital to shareholders, despite recent underperformance compared to the S&P 500 in 2023. Trefis analysis estimates EOG's valuation to be in line with its current market price, suggesting little to no immediate movement post-Q1 results.

title: 4 Invesco ETFs That Could Help You Retire a Millionaire
summary: This article highlights four Invesco ETFs that investors might consider for retirement planning, potentially helping them become millionaires. It details the Invesco S&P MidCap Quality ETF (XMHQ), the Invesco NASDAQ Internet ETF (PNQI), the Invesco S&P 500® Quality ETF (SPHQ), and the Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ), discussing their holdings, expense ratios, and historical performance. The author emphasizes that while these ETFs present different investment strategies, they each offer unique opportunities, particularly the QQQ for exposure to large tech companies.

title: NVIDIA and Alphabet’s Intrinsic Put Next-Gen Robotics Within Grasp
summary: NVIDIA and Alphabet's Intrinsic are collaborating to advance autonomous robotic manipulation through the integration of NVIDIA AI and Isaac platform technologies. They are showcasing their work at Automate in Chicago, focusing on robotic grasping and industrial scalability using foundation models enabled by NVIDIA Isaac Manipulator. This partnership aims to make complex robotics tasks more manageable, reduce development costs, and increase flexibility for end-users, demonstrating the impact of foundation models in industrial automation.

title: Google class action claims company trained AI tool with copyrighted work
summary: A class action lawsuit has been filed against Alphabet Inc. and Google LLC by a group of visual artists, alleging that the companies trained their artificial intelligence (AI) software, Imagen, using copyrighted images without authorization. The plaintiffs claim that Imagen is an infringing derivative work and seek to represent a nationwide class of individuals whose copyrighted works were used by Google for training its Google-LAION Models. They are demanding a jury trial, injunctive relief, and damages for direct and vicarious copyright infringement.

title: The Best Gaming Stocks to Buy
summary: This article identifies four undervalued gaming stocks with economic moats: NetEase, Roblox, Take-Two Interactive Software, and Electronic Arts. It details Morningstar's screening methodology, which focuses on US-listed companies with narrow or wide economic moat ratings and undervalued price-to-fair value metrics. For each company, the article provides an analyst's commentary, Morningstar ratings, and key business highlights.

title: Intelligent data infrastructure: NetApp's latest trends and strategies
summary: NetApp CEO George Kurian discusses the company's vision for intelligent data infrastructure and AI integration strategies, emphasizing AI, data unification, and cybersecurity. Key priorities for FY25 include modernizing data centers with flash storage, enhancing security with ransomware protection, and collaborating with hyperscalers for seamless hybrid and multicloud experiences. The strategy centers on bringing AI to data to maximize efficiency and effectiveness, building AI centers of excellence, and offering a unified data platform.

title: Google Glass Making A Comeback? New Prototype AR Glasses Make A Cameo Appearance At I/O 2024
summary: Google revealed a prototype of new augmented reality (AR) glasses at its I/O 2024 conference, sparking speculation about a revival of the Google Glass project. The new prototype was shown in a demo video for Project Astra, worn by an employee, and suggests Google is actively pursuing its AR ambitions amidst a growing AR market. This comes after Apple's Vision Pro launch and the success of Meta's smart glasses.

title: Investing in Gold? Forget GLD, Buy PHYS Instead
summary: Michael Burry's Scion Asset Management recently invested in the Sprott Physical Gold Trust (PHYS) while divesting from major tech stocks, highlighting PHYS as a superior gold investment compared to GLD. The article details reasons for gold's rising appeal, including central bank purchases and investor safe-haven demand, and explains PHYS's advantages such as physical gold redemption rights, secure custody with the Royal Canadian Mint, and more favorable tax treatment for U.S. non-corporate investors.

title: AWS and SAP Unlock New Innovation with Generative AI
summary: AWS and SAP have announced an expanded strategic collaboration to enhance cloud ERP experiences and integrate generative AI into enterprise applications. This partnership will make it easier for customers to adopt RISE with SAP on AWS, improve SAP workload performance, and leverage generative AI models from Amazon Bedrock within SAP AI Core. Additionally, SAP plans to use AWS chips like Graviton, Trainium, and Inferentia for future SAP Business AI offerings and has boosted performance for RISE with SAP on AWS.

title: As Apple's iPhone 16 Launch Nears, Report Says More Than Half Of World's Smartphones Will Be AI Capable By 2028: Here Are Top 5 Use Cases
summary: A new report by Canalys predicts that by 2028, over half of the world's smartphones will be AI-capable, driven by advancements in chipset technology and consumer demand. This surge is anticipated ahead of Apple's iPhone 16 launch, which is expected to feature significant AI integration. The article highlights five key AI use cases on phones, including generative AI, communication features, and productivity tools.

title: Google: Chief Privacy Officer to resign in the fall, additional staff will be hired to meet regulatory requirements.
summary: Google's Chief Privacy Officer, Keith Enright, announced his resignation effective in the fall after 13 years with the company, citing a desire for new challenges. Enright was appointed to his role in 2018 in response to privacy regulatory requirements. Google plans to continue improving its privacy protection mechanisms and hiring more staff to meet regulatory demands following his departure.

title: AES enlists AI to boost its sustainable energy business
summary: AES, an American power supplier, has implemented an AI-powered platform called Farseer AI Generation Forecasting and Market Automation Program to enhance its sustainable energy business. This platform, developed in partnership with Google, leverages machine learning to accurately forecast renewable wind, solar, and energy storage output, leading to significant revenue growth and contributing to the company's Paris Accord goals. The system also automates market responses, improving efficiency and cost-effectiveness in distributed energy resource management.

title: What Does Nvidia’s Stock Split Mean for Investors?
summary: Nvidia's 10-for-1 stock split has been completed, making shares more accessible to individual investors, although it does not change the company's overall value or Morningstar's rating. The split occurred amidst Nvidia's significant AI-driven boom, with strong first-quarter earnings and a positive outlook for data center revenue. Analyst Brian Colello maintains a fair value estimate of $105 post-split and sees no immediate signs of AI demand slowing.

title: Construction giant CRH’s reuse strategy is winning customers such as Google
summary: CRH, an international construction material supplier, is successfully implementing a reuse strategy that attracts major customers like Google. The company's focus on sustainable products, including those made from recycled materials and lower-carbon alternatives, accounted for 40% of its 2023 revenue, with a goal to reach 50% by 2025. CRH is also actively involved in over 400 pilot projects for waste reuse and climate-resilient infrastructure, alongside significant water management initiatives, driving both environmental benefits and financial opportunities.

title: FOX Announces TIME as its First Publishing Partner on Verify Protocol
summary: Fox Corporation announced TIME as its first external publishing partner for its Verify protocol, an open-source solution for content verification and licensing. The Verify protocol uses blockchain technology to cryptographically sign content, establishing its origin and history to combat misinformation and create commercial opportunities. FOX also plans to transition Verify beta from the Polygon Proof-of-Stake network to a dedicated zero-knowledge blockchain on Ethereum using Polygon CDK.

title: Nvidia becomes world’s most valuable company, dethroning Microsoft
summary: Nvidia has dethroned Microsoft to become the world's most valuable company, with its market capitalization reaching $3.335 trillion. The chipmaker's stock price surged by 3.5 percent to $135.58, driven by the strong demand for its GPUs essential for artificial intelligence development. This milestone follows Nvidia's consistent rise, fueled by its dominant market share in AI chips and strategic investments by CEO Jensen Huang.

title: Apple is first tech company accused of violating EU's new competition law
summary: The European Union has accused Apple of violating its new Digital Markets Act, making Apple the first tech company to face charges under the law. The investigation focuses on Apple's app store rules, which allegedly hinder developers from directing consumers to alternative purchasing methods. Apple has a chance to respond before a final decision in March 2025, potentially facing fines up to 20% of its global revenue for repeated infringements.

title: Hackers Auction Off LendingTree Consumers' Data
summary: Cybercriminals are auctioning off data belonging to consumers of LendingTree Inc.'s subsidiary QuoteWizard following an unauthorized access incident on a Snowflake Inc. cloud database. The hackers are demanding payments ranging from $300,000 to $5 million from affected companies. LendingTree is investigating the breach, which has also impacted its market shares and Snowflake's stock.

title: What’s the Secret Sauce in this High-Income Fund?
summary: The article explores the success of Fidelity Tactical High Income Sr F, managed by Adam Kramer, highlighting its consistent category-beating performance. Kramer attributes the fund's "secret sauce" to a flexible mandate across various income-oriented asset classes, the ability to preserve capital in down markets, and skillful matching of bonds and stocks. The fund's strategy involves actively adjusting asset class weightings and leveraging expertise from a specialized team to identify the best risk-reward opportunities across the capital structure.

title: What Does Chipotle’s Stock Split Mean for Investors?
summary: Chipotle Mexican Grill (CMG) executed a 50-for-1 stock split on June 25, one of the largest in NYSE history, resulting in shareholders receiving 49 additional shares for each one owned. The split aims to increase liquidity and make shares more accessible to individual investors, although it does not change the company's underlying value. Morningstar's fair value estimate for Chipotle stock has been adjusted to $40 per share following the split.

title: Fumble! Your Favorite NFL Team Is On The Hook For $450 Million In Sunday Ticket Lawsuit, 1.76x More Than Player Pay In 2024
summary: A federal jury has ruled that the NFL must pay between $4.7 billion and $14.4 billion in damages due to a class-action lawsuit over anticompetitive practices related to the Sunday Ticket television package. If the maximum amount is upheld, each of the 32 NFL teams would be liable for approximately $450 million, an amount significantly higher than their 2024 player salaries. The NFL plans to appeal the verdict.

title: How Ford Motor Company is reshaping Detroit into the next great tech hub
summary: Ford Motor Company has revitalized the historic Michigan Central train station, transforming it into a 30-acre mobility campus in Detroit. This initiative, with support from companies like Google and venture platforms like Newlab, aims to create a new tech microeconomy in Detroit. The goal is not to replicate Silicon Valley but to leverage Detroit's legacy of innovation to attract top tech talent and significantly alter the region's economic outlook.

title: Peloton accused of providing customer chat data to train AI
summary: Peloton is facing a class-action lawsuit in California, accused of using customer chat data to train AI without user permission. The lawsuit, filed by Consumer Advocates, alleges Peloton violated the California Invasion of Privacy Act (CIPA) by sharing chat content with AI-powered marketing firm Drift. The core issue is whether Peloton properly informed users about the data sharing and obtained consent, with the court allowing the case to proceed despite Peloton's attempts to dismiss it.

title: Alphabet calls off multibillion-dollar HubSpot acquisition
summary: Alphabet Inc. has reportedly abandoned its plans to acquire marketing software firm HubSpot Inc., causing HubSpot's stock to fall over 11%. The deal, which would have been Alphabet's largest acquisition, was likely called off due to anticipated regulatory scrutiny and a potential lack of clear benefit for HubSpot's customers. Analysts suggest the negotiations did not progress to detailed discussions and that regulatory bodies would have likely opposed the union.

title: CBRE Group Appoints Zalora CEO to Its Board
summary: CBRE Group has appointed Gunjan Soni, CEO of Zalora and COO of Global Fashion Group, to its board of directors, effective July 15. Soni brings over 20 years of experience in technology and international business, which CBRE believes will be invaluable for digital enablement in real estate solutions and global growth. Her appointment reflects the increasing importance of technological expertise in the commercial real estate sector.

title: Will Newmont’s Q2 Results Shine On Strong Gold Pricing?
summary: Newmont's Q2 results are anticipated to benefit from strong gold pricing and increased production following its Newcrest acquisition. The company expects significant synergies and improved margins, despite its stock underperforming the S&P 500 in recent years. The long-term outlook for precious metals, including gold and copper production, remains positive for Newmont.

title: Going Into Earnings, Is Meta a Buy, a Sell, or Fairly Valued?
summary: This article by Morningstar analyzes Meta Platforms (META) ahead of its Q2 earnings release on July 31st, evaluating if the stock is a buy, sell, or fairly valued. Key points of focus include advertising demand, AI monetization strategies, and platform usage growth. Morningstar assigns a 2-star rating, indicating Meta's stock is overvalued compared to its long-term fair value estimate of $400.00, but notes the company's wide economic moat and strong financial strength.

title: Google Co-Founder Sergey Brin Pledges $15M To Psychedelics Research Start-Up
summary: Google co-founder Sergey Brin, through his non-profit Catalyst4, has pledged $15 million towards Soneira, a psychedelics research start-up focusing on ibogaine as a treatment for traumatic brain injury. This investment is part of a larger Silicon Valley trend of funding psychedelic research for mental health and neurological conditions. Soneira aims to mitigate risks associated with ibogaine by combining it with heart medications and developing synthetic versions.

title: Humana and Google Expand Partnership to Help Reduce Cost of Care and Improve Member Experiences
summary: Humana and Google Cloud have announced an expanded multi-year partnership to modernize Humana's cloud infrastructure and leverage Google Cloud's Generative AI capabilities for healthcare innovation. This collaboration aims to reduce healthcare costs and improve member experiences by enhancing contact center responsiveness, simplifying provider networks, and personalizing primary care. The agreement builds on an ongoing effort to co-develop population health solutions and integrate AI technologies for Humana members.

title: Healthcare insurance company Humana to use Google Cloud Platform
summary: Humana Inc. has partnered with Google Cloud for a multi-year agreement to modernize its IT infrastructure using Google Cloud's platform and AI technologies. This collaboration aims to lower healthcare costs and improve consumer experiences by enhancing contact centers, simplifying provider networks, and personalizing care delivery, while Humana maintains human oversight in clinical decision-making when using AI. The move marks a shift for Humana, which previously utilized Microsoft Azure and IBM Watson Health.

title: ETF Spotlight: FBL Soars on Meta Stock Performance
summary: The GraniteShares 2x Long META Daily ETF (FBL) experienced a significant surge after Meta Platforms Inc. exceeded second-quarter earnings expectations. FBL's gains, up over 68.5% year-to-date, are directly linked to Meta's improved performance, driven by increased digital advertising revenue and investments in AI technology. Analysts note Meta's strong revenue growth surpassed that of other tech giants.

title: First Pacific Advisors LLC Reduces Stake in Alphabet
summary: First Pacific Advisors LLC, managed by Richard Atwood, reduced its stake in Alphabet Inc. Class C (GOOG) by selling 20,427 shares.
