This move benefits Nvidia by securing a large market but also provides China with advanced semiconductors it couldn't produce independently, potentially reshaping the U.S.-China technological competition.

title: EPAM launches seven AI agents on Google Cloud Marketplace By Investing.com
summary: EPAM Systems, Inc. has introduced seven new AI agents on Google Cloud Marketplace, targeting specific industry challenges in sectors like finance, healthcare, and retail. These agents, powered by Gemini Enterprise, aim to automate various processes and expand EPAM's collaboration with Google Cloud. The launch follows EPAM's strong third-quarter results and upward revision of its full-year outlook, reflecting confidence in its digital transformation services.

title: EPAM Launches New AI Solutions on Google Cloud Marketplace
summary: EPAM Systems has launched new AI solutions on the Google Cloud Marketplace, focusing on advanced engineering, enterprise security, and compliance. The company demonstrates strong financial health with consistent revenue growth and a robust balance sheet, despite a long-term decline in gross margin. This strategic move positions EPAM to capitalize on the growing demand for cloud-based services.

title: Vivo Capital LLC Purchases Shares of 600,000 Tango Therapeutics, Inc. $TNGX
summary: Vivo Capital LLC recently acquired 600,000 shares of Tango Therapeutics, Inc. (NASDAQ:TNGX) for approximately $3.07 million, establishing a 0.54% stake in the company. Institutional investors collectively own about 78.99% of Tango Therapeutics, which has received a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts with an average price target of $13. The company outperformed revenue expectations in its last quarterly earnings but remains unprofitable with a negative return on equity and net margin.

title: Alphabet (GOOGL) Stock: Strong Gemini 3 Adoption Offsets Fresh European Antitrust Pressure
summary: Alphabet's stock is performing strongly, driven by the rapid adoption of its Gemini 3 AI model, which has integrated across its key products and services. This positive momentum is currently outweighing concerns from a new European antitrust investigation into Google's AI training practices and content usage. Analysts remain bullish on Alphabet's AI capabilities and infrastructure despite potential regulatory risks.

title: Microsoft Reveals 7 AI Trends to Watch in 2026
summary: Microsoft has identified seven key AI trends that will shape 2026, marking a shift from AI simply answering questions to becoming a collaborative partner. These trends encompass enhanced security for AI agents, AI's expanding role in healthcare and scientific research, more efficient AI infrastructure, AI that comprehends code's "why," and quantum computing's acceleration towards practical application. The company emphasizes that AI will amplify human capabilities rather than replace them, fostering innovation across various sectors.

title: How Trump’s U-Turn on Nvidia Chips Changes the Game for China’s AI
summary: President Trump has made an unorthodox deal, allowing Nvidia to sell its H200 artificial-intelligence chips to China, a move that critics fear will help Beijing catch up in the technological Cold War. This decision provides Nvidia with a massive market while also supplying China's AI industry with high-end semiconductors it cannot produce domestically, effectively reshaping the U.S.-China tech landscape.

title: Why Alibaba Stock Is a Great Way to Ride the AI Boom
summary: Alibaba Group is strongly positioned in China's AI transformation due to its cloud services, which are experiencing significant growth from AI-related revenues. The company has developed a full-stack AI strategy, including its large language model Qwen and plans for domestic AI chips, giving it a strong competitive advantage. Furthermore, Alibaba's vast digital ecosystem allows it to embed AI across various services, creating a powerful flywheel effect that boosts performance and data generation.

title: Microsoft, Cognizant and Intel Chiefs meet PM Modi in efforts to boost AI adoption in India — Here's what we know
summary: The CEOs of Microsoft, Cognizant, and Intel met individually with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi on December 9, 2025, to discuss accelerating AI adoption in India. Microsoft announced a significant $17.5 billion investment to boost AI infrastructure and skills in the country, while Cognizant and Intel also reaffirmed their commitment to India's technological advancement. These meetings highlight India's growing importance as a hub for AI development and investment, with total Big Tech AI-centric data center investment plans reaching $42.5 billion in 2025.

title: Why EPAM (EPAM) Stock Is Trading Up Today
summary: EPAM Systems (EPAM) shares rose 3% after announcing seven new high-impact AI agents on Google Cloud Marketplace, designed to address challenges in finance, healthcare, and retail. These solutions aim to automate tasks like KYC processes and drug discovery, leveraging Google's global infrastructure. While the market views this news positively, its impact is seen as significant but not fundamentally transformative, contrasting with a previous 8% jump following a $1 billion stock repurchase program.

title: Alphabet Stock Jumped 13.9% In November. What's Next?
summary: Alphabet's stock (GOOG, GOOGL) saw a significant 13.9% increase in November, outperforming the Nasdaq amidst broader tech sell-offs and AI bubble fears. This surge was attributed to the successful release of Google's new AI model, Gemini 3, which was trained on its own custom-built TPUs, validating its long-term investment in proprietary silicon. Despite a recent court ruling requiring annual renegotiation of its search contracts, the article suggests Alphabet's core business remains strong, positioning it well for future AI advancements.

title: Apple gets a big price target hike, and Wells Fargo plants a big dealmaking flag
summary: Citi has raised its price target on Apple to $330 due to anticipated iPhone sales growth and promising AI developments, while Wells Fargo CEO Charlie Scharf aims to elevate the bank into a top-five player in Wall Street dealmaking. These updates highlight positive outlooks for both companies, based on new product cycles for Apple and strategic expansion for Wells Fargo.

title: Braze Reports Fiscal Third Quarter 2026 Results
summary: Braze (Nasdaq: BRZE) has reported strong fiscal third-quarter results for 2026, ending October 31, 2025, with a 25.5% revenue increase to $190.8 million. The company showcased significant operating leverage, a 14% growth in total customer count, and a 29% increase in large customers, alongside stable dollar-based net retention at 108%. Braze also introduced several innovations in BrazeAI™, enhancing personalized customer engagement and solidifying its market leadership.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang on why despite being the CEO of world's most-valuable company, sense of uncertain
summary: Jensen Huang, CEO of Nvidia, despite leading a $5 trillion company, lives in constant anxiety, a fear stemming from a near-bankruptcy experience in the 1990s. This anxiety is validated by recent market turmoil, including a $250 billion drop in Nvidia's market value after reports of Meta potentially buying Google's AI chips. Huang's unwavering work ethic and belief that the company is "30 days from going out of business" highlight his drive to avoid failure, shaping his leadership and Nvidia's trajectory.

title: 'Uber Is Cooked,' Says Ross Gerber As Waymo Hits 450K Weekly Rides — Touts $200 Million Annual Revenue For Tesla Rival
summary: Investor Ross Gerber believes that Alphabet Inc.'s Waymo autonomous cab service poses a significant challenge to Uber Technologies Inc. Gerber highlighted Waymo's impressive growth, reporting 450,000 weekly rides and an estimated annual revenue exceeding $200 million. This comes as Tesla CEO Elon Musk also anticipates his company's Robotaxi operations in Austin to go driverless by year-end, with a broader European expansion planned for Tesla's Full Self-Driving (FSD) technology.

title: Adobe Approaches Q4 With $5 Billion AI Tailwind: Can 'Agentic' Innovation Silence Skeptics?
summary: Adobe is entering Q4 with over $5 billion in AI-influenced Annual Recurring Revenue and is shifting its strategy toward "Agentic" AI to expand workflows. Despite strong financial performance and a "Switzerland of GenAI" approach, analyst sentiment remains mixed due to concerns about the impact of generative AI on its core revenue model and the upcoming SEMrush acquisition. Adobe's management, however, projects confidence, highlighting significant share repurchases and solid revenue targets for Q4.

title: Amazon Pledges $35 Billion To Supercharge India's AI, Cloud Market And Create 1 Million Jobs By 2030
summary: Amazon has announced a significant investment of over $35 billion in India's artificial intelligence and cloud computing sector by 2030, in addition to its existing $40 billion investment. This initiative aims to drive AI-powered digitization, boost exports, and create 1 million jobs in India. The move comes as other tech giants like Microsoft, Intel, and Google also increase their investments in India's rapidly growing AI market.

title: Niterra Partners with Rackspace Technology to Accelerate Digital Transformation with Rapid Migration to Google Cloud
summary: Niterra, a major automotive supplier, partnered with Rackspace Technology to rapidly migrate its entire SAP ECC environment to Google Cloud within two months. This digital transformation unified Niterra's global server landscape and consolidated three on-premises data centers without business disruption. Rackspace's expertise in cloud migration and managed services enabled Niterra to achieve operational stability and set the stage for future innovations on Google Cloud.

title: Alphabet stock price is at risk of deeper pullback if Powell signals end of rate cuts
summary: Alphabet's GOOGL stock is facing bearish pressure after breaking a key technical pattern, falling 4% week-to-date, as investors await the Federal Reserve's interest rate decision. A hawkish stance from Chair Jerome Powell, even with a rate cut, could deepen the pullback, potentially breaking support levels at $311.3 and $305. The stock's weekly and monthly RSI being in overbought territory increases the likelihood of a correction if dovish guidance is not provided.

title: S&P Global Advances AI-Powered Enterprise Transformation Through Strategic Partnership with Google Cloud
summary: S&P Global announced a multi-year strategic partnership with Google Cloud to accelerate its AI-powered enterprise transformation. This collaboration focuses on unifying S&P Global's proprietary data on Google Cloud's BigQuery to deliver AI-ready insights and expanding agentic offerings on Gemini Enterprise for customers to interact with their data. Additionally, the partnership aims to empower S&P Global's workforce with Gemini Enterprise and other AI tools to enhance productivity and efficiency.

title: S&P Global (SPGI) Partners with Google Cloud to Enhance Data and Workflow
summary: S&P Global (SPGI) has partnered with Google Cloud to integrate Google's BigQuery and Gemini Enterprise platforms, aiming to enhance data distribution and workflow automation. This collaboration is expected to boost productivity and streamline operations for the financial data and benchmark provider. Despite recent margin declines, S&P Global maintains strong financial health, indicated by its Altman Z-Score and Piotroski F-Score, with analysts recommending a "Buy" for the stock.

title: Netflix (NFLX) Stock Today, December 10, 2025: Warner Bros. Discovery Bid, Lawsuit Risks, and 2026 Price Targets
summary: Netflix (NFLX) stock is currently experiencing volatility due to its proposed acquisition of Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD), facing a competing bid from Paramount Skydance and a new consumer class-action lawsuit. Despite these challenges and concerns about increased debt, Netflix's core business remains strong with growing subscribers, revenue, and free cash flow, along with promising growth from its ad-supported tier and expansion into live sports. Wall Street analysts largely maintain a positive outlook, although some express caution regarding the deal's risks and its potential impact on Netflix's balance sheet.

title: Colliers partners with Google Cloud to accelerate digital and AI-powered innovation
summary: Colliers, a global diversified professional services and investment management company, has announced a partnership with Google Cloud to accelerate digital and AI-powered innovation. This collaboration is a key part of Colliers' multi-year technology transformation strategy, aiming to leverage advanced analytics and AI for new product development and integrated systems. The partnership is expected to enhance efficiency, elevate client service, and strengthen operational consistency across the built environment.

title: Colliers Announces Partnership with Google Cloud to Enhance Technology and Innovation in Professional Services
summary: Colliers, a global professional services and investment management company (CIGI), has announced a partnership with Google Cloud to accelerate its technology transformation strategy. This collaboration aims to leverage advanced analytics and AI for new product development, improved operational efficiency, and enhanced client service within the real estate industry. The initiative focuses on delivering smarter insights, predictive models, and optimizing business functions through AI, marking a significant step in Colliers' digital evolution.

title: Uber Stock Drops As Waymo Gains Ground In Autonomous Ride‑Hailing
summary: Uber Technologies Inc. shares fell on Wednesday as Alphabet Inc.'s Waymo demonstrated significant growth in autonomous ride-hailing services. Waymo reported serving over 1 million fully driverless rides monthly since spring, with plans to expand into 20 more cities by 2026, including Tokyo and London. This rapid expansion and Waymo's success has led investor Ross Gerber to declare "Uber is cooked," while Uber itself faces challenges with its electric vehicle transition.

title: Bank of New York Mellon stock hits all-time high at 117.42 USD
summary: Bank of New York Mellon's stock reached an all-time high of $117.42, reflecting strong investor confidence with impressive 1-year and year-to-date returns. The company, which has a "GOOD" financial health rating and a 55-year history of dividend payments, is considered undervalued by InvestingPro analysis. Recent developments include a raised price target from TD Cowen, integration of Google Cloud AI, launch of a stablecoin reserves fund, and a decrease in its Prime Lending Rate.

title: Microsoft Stock Slips After Hours as AI Scrutiny Rises: What MSFT Investors Should Know Before the December 11 Open
summary: Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ: MSFT) experienced a slight dip on December 10, 2025, closing down 2.7% and trading marginally lower after hours, primarily due to increased regulatory scrutiny on AI and concerns over monetizing its substantial AI investments. This comes as state attorneys general warned tech companies about "delusional outputs" from AI chatbots and Microsoft announced $23 billion in new AI data center investments. Despite these near-term pressures, Wall Street analysts maintain a broadly bullish outlook on Microsoft's long-term prospects, with price targets suggesting significant upside, though some quantitative models show mixed signals and long-term caution on valuation.
